Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay and do the "Duval Crawl".....”
Reviews.Author: tnblueeyes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at OKR in February for Valentine's Day. This is our fourth or fifth time staying at the resort and we are ALWAYS happy with the friendliness of the staff, cleanliness of the rooms and the location of the resort. If you stay, get a room/suite facing Mallory Square or the Ocean. The sunsets are awesome from your balcony and you can basically walk to most major attractions, restaurants, bars, etc. in Key West. Would highly recommend this place!! Can't wait to return in June!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LakeLoafer
Reviews.Content: This resort has it all...restaurant, spa, pool, bar to watch the famous sunsets. Our junior suite had a balcony with a partial ocean view but right on Mallory Square to watch the festivities each evening at sunset. We had a separate living area, comfortable bed and huge Jacuzzi tub right in the bedroom! The staff was very helpful...even gave us a call when our room was ready early. The price was over the top however...since we didn't use the spa, pool or restaurant, we paid too much for a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: viisitor
Reviews.Content: Ocean Key is a great place -- the rooms are large and beautifully decorated -- the location could hardly be better. We were especially lucky to have a room with a balcony and a view of the Gulf so we could watch sunsets over the water as well as the sundown celebrations that fill Mallory Square daily. Food in the restaurant was very good too -- they even went off menu on my last day and served me key lime pie for breakfast. The one caveat, as someone else has noted, is the cruise ship problem. We awoke one morning to find a huge ship entirely blocking our view. Not only could we not see the water but it was uncomfortable to sit on the balcony facing the ship windows. Take this warning more seriously than I did and contact the hotel in advance to insist on a room that won't be blocked even if there are 3 ships in port. And don't let them tell you they don't know the cruise schedule -- they have a calendar with all the visits marked.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more from "luxury"”
Reviews.Author: worldgirl2010
Reviews.Content: This is supposed to be one of the nicest hotels in Key West, if not the absolute best. And it is in some areas but needs work in others. First the good...the staff, with the exception of the evening receptionist, were fantastic. There's a fabulous view for many of the rooms. The rooms themselves were enormous and beautiful. And the food is wonderful (though I didn't eat from Hot Tin Roof, only room service and the pool.) Here's the areas where they need work...for the price that this hotel is, someone should be greeting you at your car, instead of you intuitively knowing that you should leave your car at valet, walk away from it, go check in, and then they'll send someone back out with you to get your bags. They should be opening your door for you - that's how it's been every other place I've ever been in this price category (and even much lower.) This isn't a Holiday Inn. The internet is TERRIBLE. Truly. It's wireless but it's not secured so people can wander around near the hotel and use it and it drops CONSTANTLY. The only time it worked was on Sunday night/Monday morning. Otherwise it's not enough bandwidth for the number of customers. They should be using a hotel password or use wired internet vice wireless. Cruise ships do block your view. This happened my last morning so I was thrilled I was checking out. If more than one cruise ship docks at Mallory Square, the second one is directly in your way - so all you see is people looking into your room and the parking lot at Mallory Square - the Oceanview is entirely blocked until the ship leaves, usually around or after sunset. The pool is very small. The rooms facing the ocean and Mallory Square can be loud - you can block most of the noise out by closing your balcony off. This hotel is at the very end of Duval - which is nice in that there's not alot of riff raff in front of the hotel - but it's at least a block to anything going on, including restaurants except those in the hotel itself. So for the exorbitant price I paid, I'm not sure I got my money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is the place to be!”
Reviews.Author: lolotraveler
Reviews.Content: Our first time to Key West and we booked last minute so there were slim pickin's on the hotel choices. I came across Ocean Key with availability and without doing much research on its location, I took a chance to hope for a good place. When we arrived, I was so excited and impressed I picked such a nice resort. The location is perfect on the Gulf and across from Mallory square where the action is in the eve. The restaurant on site has awesome views of the water and the food is perfect. There are also views from the pool area. Everything is in walking distance and many other really great restuarants are nearby that we tried. The rooms at the resort are a decent size... we had a jr. suite with a private balcony, and jetted tub in the bath. We were there spring break but minimal spring breakers in the resort and the the resort is overall quiet unless youre on your balcony during the sunset celebration. Its perfect to walk out of the hotel to watch the sunset right there.. Overall this place is totally amazing and highly recommend... Great location, friendly staff, clean and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: Patrick W
Reviews.Content: My wife and i on the spear of the moment, decided to spend the night in Key west and we were lucky enough to be able to reserve a room at this wonderful resort. We wished after spending one night we didn't have to leave, but we had tickets the the Daytona 500 so we had to leave. We are making plans to stay longer next time. You have to try the eggs bennidict stuffed with crab, it's to die for. Thanks to the most friendly staff we've run acrossed in a long time. SEE YOU SOON

Reviews.Title: “most awesome place in my world!”
Reviews.Author: LINDAWoodburn_Ky
Reviews.Content: this is the most beautiful hotel I have ever been to. We had a junior suite overlooking the ocean. we could sit on our balcony and watch the most beautiful sunset.

Reviews.Title: “I'm very picky”
Reviews.Author: Bill H
Reviews.Content: Great location, great room, and great service. We would like to repeat the mini-vacation again. Welcome is wonderful, everything was on-time and efficient. Excellent concierge service from Patrick. Cruise ships and sun-downers each day. What a great way to take in the experience of Key West. We would highly recommend the Resort, location, and staff. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Ocean view is great, but be prepared to hear the music”
Reviews.Author: Robert H
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our first trip to Key West and loved the location of the hotel, the quality of the service and staff, and the facilities overall. We opted for what we considered a very expensive room ($850 per night) to get the best ocean view. It overlooked the ocean, harbor, and the hotel dock. Downside is that live, aplified music began in the early afternoon and continued until just after 7 p.m. It sounded as though the speakers were in our room, you could not carry on a conversation, and we were on the 4th floor.. One staff member said they get those complaints "a lot." One night ater there was a wedding party, but that music was not noticeable as it was at the far end of the dock. Suggest you look for rooms in the hotel that are oriented a little to the north that do not have a view of the dock and the cabana (where the band operates from). Those are actually cheaper rooms, and still have a spectabular water view.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Lakesnake
Reviews.Content: My wife and 3 other couples spent the first days of March at this very nice older hotel for my birthday. It was THE place to be. The Hot Tin Roof was a great restaurant enjoyed by all. Service was a bit slow but hey it's vacation! Just about everything was in easy walking distance and if not just hope on the tram. Not a new high end hotel you can find anywhere; Ocean Key had the local color we enjoy and the sunsets were out our balcony door. The staff was very friendly and very helpful and the room was spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and dated”
Reviews.Author: Angela F
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights here recently and was disappointed at how dated and worn the room was. Huge jacuzzi bath in the middle of the master bedroom made an awkward narrow hallway bath to the sink/shower area. Only one flat-screen TV which had a dim picture with garbled sound. Sheets had holes in them and paint was peeling in the closet areas. For what you pay, this is no 'resort'. Pier was occupied for two days for wedding events which was disappointing. In future, will check out other hotels instead of Ocean Key. Did not receive value for money spent.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations Met”
Reviews.Author: BlindTom
Reviews.Content: It's pricey, but worth it in my opinion. Great location, great room, and great service. Can't find a thing to complain about, and that is rare indeed. Bar area is great, but did not try the restaurant. Excellent concierge service.

Reviews.Title: “Never wanted to leave”
Reviews.Author: Giavona P
Reviews.Content: I honestly rarely write review's for places because I find that people at hotels these days rarely go above and beyond. That is not the case with this resort. Dale at the front desk was pleasant and sweet and Nate at the pool made our trip truely a special one. The entire time I was at the resort I felt like people really cared about the time I was spending there. When you go to Key West you are in "island mode" and staying in this resort only enhanced that feeling. I love this place and I can't wait to be back soon!! PS the Hot Tin Roof restaurant is amazing and you should make reservations there during sunset!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and great service”
Reviews.Author: honkytonkdog1
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for enjoying the view during the day and the amazing key west sunsets. Our room was immaculate and had a terrace overlooking the pool. April at the pool always made sure we had drinks and food without being intrusive. Nate the pool concierge was attentive to all the guests during the day. I even heard him offer to loan a guest some of his own fishing equipment. The front desk staff was efficient and pleasant. Check in and out was a breeze. We had to switch rooms (because we added another day) and it was an incredibly smooth process. I have been to key west many times and I highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Patrick the Concierge is THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: pfssr1
Reviews.Content: Without question Ocean Key Resort and Spa has everything you need for a fabulous stay in Key West. Location, Location, Location tops the bill of great things to say about this modern luxury hotel. What truly makes it spectacular however is Patrick the Concierge. Our stay was infinitely easier because of the attentiveness and genuine kindness of this young man. Patrick hooked us up with bicycles, scuba diving, jet skiing, and the most romantic dinner reservations across the bay at Sunset Key. Every hotel has great rooms, but not every hotel has Patrick the Concierge! Don't Not Stay Here. Stay Here! Patrick makes it soooo worth your while ~! Thank you my friend! Paul and Christina

Reviews.Title: “What an experience”
Reviews.Author: delwy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our 25th wedding anniversary and were bowled over both by the hotel it's accommodation and the views of the sunset. One of the best hotel experiences ever and the food at the cat on a hot tin roof was equally excellent, can't wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: meanrenee
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location . On top of that you have great rooms( we had a partial ocean/cruise ship view) Nice layout with a large bathroom and separate living room. Great pool area with bar and food. Everything very clean. Best part were the people though. Left behind my diamond necklace somehow. Called and inquired about it. Patrick called me back with the wonderful news that it had been found in the room AND turned in!! He boxed it up and shipped out that day and I had it the next day. WOW . Can't say enough about that. Honesty and integrity all in a fabulous place to stay. No need to tell you we WILL be back. Our new favorite place in paradise!

Reviews.Title: “way overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: Jim P
Reviews.Content: This resort was way over priced. We had a junior suite PARTIAL ocean view (maybe a giraffe could see the ocean) we did have a nice view of the parking area. The tub was not what was pictured (much smaller). The door handle to the balcony was broken. The first night we came back from dinner the bathroom was infested with ants. We ate lunch at the pier on the first day since we couldnt get in the room until 3:55, most expensive lunch ever. The pool was a large hot tub at best and we soon learned if you were not out there before 9 you didnt get a seat. On a better note the people were very friendly that worked there.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more.”
Reviews.Author: jerseyd1
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely spot to relax and unwind. Beautiful large suites and the location is perfect. Right at the beginning (or end) of Duval St, for shopping and dining. Close enough to the landmarks, but far enough from the boisterous bars. We even "attended" two weddings that were right below our balcony, where we we also able to watch gorgeous sunsets. Very friendly and helpful staff. I'd go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful pool !”
Reviews.Author: Juliejupe789
Reviews.Content: Great location. Take a room with oceanview, fabulous sunset. Amazing pool experience, perfect water temperature (90F !!), very professional staff. We'll be back !

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME...AWESOME...AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: cheesehead08
Reviews.Content: Great location, wonderful and helpful people. They treat you like a million bucks. Location is great. We had a beautiful room overlookin Mallory Square. Key West was fun, fun, fun.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: Shelley G
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful both inside and out. The location can 't be beat! The staff were very friendly and accommodating. Very close to down town but just far enough away from the night time noise. We will be coming back to Ocean Key!

Reviews.Title: “Classy!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: WildwoodNJCatman
Reviews.Content: Spectacular! Just got back from our anniversary and they really know how to take care of you. Clean, quiet and what a water view. Located in downtown Key West, even a few blocks south of the noisy action of Duval street. Absolutely the best location on the island!!!!!!!!! We will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GBrown1
Reviews.Content: This resort is right in the heart of Key West within easy walking distance of all Duval St and Mallory Square have to offer. The food and service at the bars and restaurants on site is top notch! Rooms are spacious with great views of the sunset. Highly recommend if you are headed to Key West and want to be in the middle of the action.

Reviews.Title: “So expensive”
Reviews.Author: Tazer321
Reviews.Content: My god how much? Stayed here for free thank god, view was spoilt by a cruise ship!! But it was a fab hotel for looks and they have big round tubs in the rooms great for bubbles!!!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful place”
Reviews.Author: Dpgunner
Reviews.Content: Room is spacious, clean, quaint and airy. Great location for walking the tourist haunts of Key West. The pool area is great. Sunset view from our balcony was wonderful. We were underwhelmed by the length of time of our massauge. Our 80 minutes were way different from theirs.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel experiance”
Reviews.Author: Susan L
Reviews.Content: This is the best place to stay In key West It is in a perfect spot to everything Beautiful rooms,very clean and the help are fantastic We go every year in Jan. and have stayed here all but one time in about 7 trips,the only time we stayd anyplace else was the first trip and we sure learned fast

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: bcgradgirl
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research to find the "perfect" hotel for our babymoon in Key West. I read so many reviews on tripadvisor and looked in Conde Nast and Travel and Leisure magazines to find the ideal place to stay and this hotel seemed to be the perfect place but we were so disppointed. We got there early and our room was not ready, which was totally fine, so they took our cell phone number and said they would call us when the room was ready. My husband and I went and explored the town for hours and never received a call so eventually re returned back to the hotel several hours later. The concierge, who was amazing (I think her name was Oksana) has gotten us an upgrade to a two bedroom waterfront suite which was wonderful. We were shown to our room and it honestly looked as if they had never vacuumed the floors and carpet. There was a large hot tub in the room and there were hairs in the bottom which really turned my stomach. At $369 a night, I had much higher expectations. I contacted the front desk and they sent a manager up right away to look over the room. I did not get too upset, I figured every place has an "off day" and they sent up a cleaning person right away. They also comped us for breakfast for all three mornings that we were there. We enjoyed the rest of the day and were looking forward to getting a good nights sleep. As we have a seven month old at home and one on the way, this was our only time away and sleeping in and relxing was the primary reason for our get away. the bed was comfortable but at 12:45 am the fire alarm went off. I must say there is nothing better than standing in the middle of Duval Street in your pajamas with a bunch of strangers after being awoken from a sound sleep. Needless to say, we were pretty ticked off. We were told that a guest lit a candle in their room and set off the alarm. It took us about 2 hours to fall back asleep and just when we drifted off, the fire alarm went off again at 4:45. This time it went back off after about 2 minutes, just long enough to get us good and awake. At that point, we were fuming and started calling other hotels to see if they had rooms available to change hotels. Since we were up so early, we figured we wouldl have an early breakfast at the hotel restaurant since we had been comped. The view was beautiful and we started to finally relax a bit when I started eating my eggs. A few bites in I found a black hair in my eggs...now I have long blonde hair so I know it was not mine. I immediately sent my food back and although they offered, I had completely lost my appetite and skipped out on breakfast altogether. We called down to the front desk to see what time the manager came in as I was ready to have a nice "chat" at that point. We took a walk and came back to meet with the manager at 9:00. He was very nice and attempted his best to compensate us by comping us for 2 nights stay at the hotel. I had my bags packed and was ready to leave at that point but we were so tired from not sleeping the night before, we really could not make the long drive back. I figured since we were being comped another night we would stay one more night and check out a day early. Thankfully there were no problems with the fire alarm that night and we did get a good nights rest. The next morning we got up and ate breakfast (definitely not at the hotel) and decided to leave a day early. As we were checking out, they gave us a bill which I reviewed. There werechardes for almost $1000 and other than the valet charge and one dinner in the restaurant, we should not have been billed for anything else. The woman at the desk seemed confused when I told her we met with the hotel manager and that we were being comped for both nights of our stay. There were charges for cocktails and mini bar snaks and what not which I knew were not ours. As I looked closer I realized that this was not even o ur bill, it had someone elses name on it! I just rolled my eyes and we asked the valet to pull our car around while we waited in the lobby. Now this is not a huge hotel by any means, so I think a 35 minute wait for your car seemed a bit long. I finally asked them how long it would take to get the car and they said that it had been outside waiting for 15 minutes. I then told them that our car was not outside and they finally realized that they had mixed up our car with someone elses and that they would go to get ours....15 minutes later we finally got our car and although I felt a bit guilty, I did not even tip the valet as I was so aggrevated. I must say that I would strongly discourage staying at this hotel. Although the manager was very nice and tried his best to make up for all of the poor service and problems during our stay, for this kind of money you can stay just about anyplace on Key West. There is another nice hotel called the Pier House across the street that looked lovely. I think we would have changed to that hotel had they not been booked up. For what is tauted as a 5 star resort, they are sorely lacking...

Reviews.Title: “Can't think of a better place to stay in Key west”
Reviews.Author: KENTGA
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right on the water at the end of Duval Street (a very happening street) and has a pier for drinks and watching the sunset. Our room was comfortable and the staff was very nice. We stayed two nights and had breakfast/brunch in the room both days. The first day we both had lox and bagel and they were great and the next morning I had a three egg cheese omlette and my wife had oatmeal with several choices of toppings. A couple of thoughts and bonuses for the hotel. 1. Don't rent a car in KW. Everything is within walking distance or you can get a pedicab or hop off one of the sightseeing trolleys. 2. You are right at Duval, Whitehead and Front Streets and that's where the action is, but the hotel was quiet. 3. Mallory Square is next to the hotel and huge crowds gather there for the sunset and various performers. Our favorite was a so-so banjo player with his star golden retreiver named Cleo that would come around and take dollar bills from several people at once and then take them over and put them in a bucket. 4. There's a CVS right next door that has water, sodas, beer and wine and some sandwiches and it's convenient and will save you money. Will definately stay here if we ever return.

Reviews.Title: “almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: zo6man34531
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself stayed two nights at your hotel, with this being my first trip to key west. The location is perfect for walking and seeing the sights, no need for your car here. Loved the hotel and the attention to detail the crew had. Pool side staff absolutely great! The only negative was the restaurant "Hot Tin Roof". Called for reservation for sunset dining and a suitable table for viewing. Table was not great, but no problems just excited about dinner. My wife was so excited about the shrimp fennel risotto, but once it arrived immediately she was not happy. It was lumpy, clumpy, not creamy like good risotto. It almost looked microwaved. It was so hot it over cooked the shrimp. I can't believe they let it leave the kitchen looking like that. I told her to say something twice but she didn't want to a big deal out of it so I'm telling you now so somebody can correct this. We didn't eat again at the hotel just because we didn't want to to take the chance of being disappointed again. She hardly took three bites of it! It probably bothered me more than her because you just want everything to be great... and with a $168.00 bill it should have been much better. I'm in the business and I know you would want to know.

Reviews.Title: “BEST Views!”
Reviews.Author: Leeza612
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the BEST location! Our room was on the 4th floor , perfect place to see the sunset off the balcony AND Mallory square. Room was large & decorated beautifully. True tropical feel! Bed was super comfy. Will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “"Surreal Hideaway"”
Reviews.Author: crankoldman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ocean Key Resort in Mallory Square in early july 2011. Family vacation one Child or 11 and one of 8. Everyone loved the hotel and setting. Room overlooked mallory square which starts to come alive into an almost carnival atmosphere from about 5.30pm, when everyone gathers to watch the sun set while enjoying food, entertainers and the incredible view of biplanes and sail draped boats set against an oversized orange sun. Key West at night is fantastic, from haunted walking tours, great food and a very safe and fun atmosphere. i think that's what the kids will remember most; the kick back, relaxed atmosphere. Even during a lightning induced black out, whee the whole town went dark, the laughs continued, the food still came on time and everyone was so friendly. During the day, the hotel was very low key, with a quite pool and luxiourious sun loungers, ranging to mini-cabanas. Throught the day a waitress circled the pool taking orders and providing frozen face towels. A perfectly relaxing experience apart from an 8 and 11 year running riot. The room was huge, with a very large bathroom and sunken bath, which appear to be about 5 feet deep, more like a little hot tub. Nice! Even the walk to reception, from our room or the pool, was quite quaint, with a flora covered canopy across the carpark and little seating areas as one approched reception, decorated with illuminated parrots. I really loved this place at the very tip of the US. Any further south and we would have been smoking cigars with Castro in Cuba. If your like me, and will probably only ever get to Key West once or twice, then don't blow it by staying in a motel, stay here instead. The atmosphere is everything.

Reviews.Title: “We had to return to the Ocean Key, it's the BEST”
Reviews.Author: thedeb
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I stayed at the Ocean Key for our second time, booked for January 27-31, 2011. We got there a bit later due to weather getting out of the Boston area. This time we tried a room on the side facing Mallory Square. The room was a one bedroom suite and it was beautiful. There was a pull-out couch in the living room area so there was plenty of room for the three of us. We were very happy with the room the first day, there were spectacular views of the water and the square. The next day though, we were surprised to look out directly at an enormous cruise ship. This blocked our view of the water all day! We hadn't thought this through. We discussed it and decided to request a room on the side facing the Sunset Pier bar again. We did have to pay a bit more, but it was worth it. We got two bedrooms and two baths, a kitchen and a view of the water and the pier. We were happier on that side. We truly love this hotel and will certainly go back again soon, as they are very accommodating and friendly there, and it is worth every penny for the location and the amenities!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: evomoore
Reviews.Content: we drove from south beach to the keys and stayed one night at the Ocean key . we arrived early but our room was ready (a great room with a spa bath) Spent a wonderful day looking around (went on the Conch tour ~very entertaining). Saw a beautiful sunset~ a walk around some great bars~then had breakfast on our balcony. A perfect 24 Hours

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Jason Z
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the north end of Duval street (you can tell that from the address, 0 Duval Street) and the location was great. Our room was "partial ocean view" but it was even better than the "Ocean Vista" in Casa Marina we stayed the day before. MAllory Square is right below our balcony and at sunset we can hear people having a party there. However if I close the door to the balcony, the room became silent and I could hear the drop of a nickel. The bathtub was great and was the largest I've ever used.

Reviews.Title: “You just feel good”
Reviews.Author: flebet
Reviews.Content: We have been many times at Key West, staying at various good places, but this time, we took Ocean Key Resort, which is so fare the best we did ever. Right from the drive up to the hotel front, we had super service, with helpfull staff. This continued through the whole stay. The location is perfect, you are right at the pier, start/end of Duval street, and still you feel like you are in a perfect spot, just for yourself, without to much noise. Perfect view from the pool, which was kind of crowded, mainly because people came in from the street, and no one checked, but besides that, you have a super surrounding with a perfect view. Highly recomended, we will for sure be back !

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Sarah4747
Reviews.Content: Ocean Key is a great spot. Even though you are at the beginning of Duval Street (#0) and next to the famed Mallory Square, once the sun goes down you don't hear a thing....actually don't hear much during the day either other than the local roosters in the morning and the island music during the day. Oh you may hear some laughter from your new friends in the chairs next to you at Liquid Lounge (aka the pool) but everyone is relaxed. Try one of their great cocktails (fresh watermelon mojito!) and sit in the sun all day while the pool staff waits on you hand and foot. This place is great, and by no means stuffy like some other places with pool staff. And because the hotel doesn't have an expansive "activity" program, the guests tend to be couples and groups of friends in Key West for a little fun. Only saw three children under the age of 12 during my 5-day stay. I would highly recommend staying at Ocean Key if you're looking to relax and have some fun in a prime Key West spot. Oh did I mention you can see the sunset from your pool chair?!!? Beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Nachocheeze
Reviews.Content: The attitude of the employees is what made this stay so wonderful. I was looking for the perfect place for my wife and I to spend our "babymoon". Key West has long been on our list of places to see. Room 525. The views are to die for. Right over Mallory Square. Out into the Gulf. We saw plenty of ships coming in and going out at all times of the day. The unobstructed sunsets were amazing. Breakfast on the balcony (something someone on Tripadvisor had mentioned) was totally worth it. They bring your breakfast at the half hour increment you desire and set it up with a newspaper for you to enjoy the morning. Everyone had advice on where to eat the best cuban food (although the Meson de Pepe had just okay food but with a great atmosphere), where to do the best snorkeling, and the best way to get around. The pool area is small, so if you need a chair, get there early. You will need to valet your car, and make sure you do, because there is NO parking anywhere down there. They are going to charge you $20 for it, but it is worth it. I realize we stayed on a busy week, and the resort was amazing, but its only downfall is that it was $600 a night. I know you have to pay for good things, and my wife and I will not be going on vacation for a long time (darn babies), it just seemed like a lot, especially when the Hyatt was less, and in the same area. Don't let that discourage you. The stay at this hotel is amazing, and I wouldn't trade those few days for anything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great stay”
Reviews.Author: Tednlu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights, got upgraded to a beautiful suite. Great location, staff could not have been more helpful. No noise, room cleaned to high standard each day. Would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tonje H
Reviews.Content: We were so happy with this hotel, decided to come back as soon as possible. The hotel has soul, is a home, has the most spectacular view, is just heavenly. Food is brilliant, breakfast is beautiful! Pool area is clean and very inviting, great menu and service! My parents, my sister and her family, and my own family including at all 9 adults and kids were all fully happy with this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Clermont_Cowgirl
Reviews.Content: We had booked a 2 night stay at the Ocean Key Resort & Spa. It was our first time to Key West and this hotel is in the best position. It is right on the water and at the end of Duval Street, where all the action is. It is also the premier place to view the sunset in Key West, with everyone flocking to the pier in front of the hotel to photograph the sunset. Our room was large and had a great bathroom, with double vanity, walk in shower and spa bath. We had a balcony overlooking the water and the great sunset. Our 2 night stay was extended to an 11 day stay after my husband had an accident. The staff were exceptional at accommodating me during the very busy week of Fantasyfest and the annual Parrotheads 'Meeting of the Minds'. The hotel has a day spa (which I didn't get to try), it's own restaurant, pool and bar on the pier with live music every night. Everything in Key West is a quick walk away. I would definitely stay here on my next visit to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: default1117
Reviews.Content: This was an awesome hotel. We had three seperate areas including a balcony. Beautiful rooms. Super friendly staff. Great concierge, Oksana, helped us arrange a wonderful sunset cruise. We could walk to everything. The restaurant, Tin Roof is exceptional. We went between Thanksgiving and the middle of December, it was not crowded at all. The weather was very nice. I would go back in a heartbeat. We went

Reviews.Title: “My favourite place”
Reviews.Author: Holmby
Reviews.Content: Ocean key is just great. Great location on Duval street, great straff that makes You feel welcome. The rooms are maybe a little old fashioned, but great size and great view from the balcony, all is just perfect and i would love to visit again

Reviews.Title: “You can't fault it. Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: JSJUK
Reviews.Content: From Dale in reception to Patrick in Concierge. Great customer service. Made the Xmas day stay memorable. A big thank you. Great rooms great location. Don't go anywhere else in key west.

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get any better than this!”
Reviews.Author: bmayhew7
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I chose Ocean Key Resort for our stay in Key West last weekend. Our stay was so enjoyable, I can't imagine staying anywhere else in Key West. From the moment we arrived, the staff made us feel welcome with their quick smiles, friendly and inviting attitudes, and excellent customer service. We were married in a private ceremony at Smathers Beach; not at the hotel, and not involving Ocean Key. However, that didn't stop the gracious Ocean Key wedding coordinator from assisting my (now) wife with her wedding dress, or stop the concierge from placing a complimentary bottle of champagne in our room. Dinner at the award winning Hot Tin Roof was made special by the excellent service provided by our waiter, Louis (he reminded us of our neighbor back home). Poolside views of the Gulf of Mexico (located 15 yards from the pool) were made even better by the service provided at the Liquid Lounge. As for the breath-taking Key West sunsets, there is no better viewing point on the island than from the Ocean Key. There is no question where we will be staying on future visits to Key West; there is no other place to stay in my opinion. But the true testament to the Ocean Key is the fact that we will visit Key West again just for the experience of staying at this second-to-none hotel. They have at least two loyal customers for life.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot”
Reviews.Author: KwattsRIC
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at Ocean Key for four nights. The staff was amazing, and service was impeccable, this was my forth trip to this resort. Very welcoming and friendly. You can not beat the location and would not consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: Zzannahk
Reviews.Content: We stayed 11/28 to 12/2 at the Ocean Key Resort and simply did not want to leave. From the moment we pulled up (tricky three point turn, by the way) to the moment we checked out everything went beyond our expectations. The location is perfect. I apologize now for not remembering anyone's names. The staff was incredible!!!! Check-in- Normal and quick, our porter/valet took us to our room. OMG!!! We were upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite, room 405. It was perfect for us, 3 adults, me, my mom and my aunt. More than enough room for even more people. The first bedroom was a Queen, connecting to the hallway bathroom, which was small but still ample space. The Living/Dining room was HUGE. A a beautiful balcony with a view of the water and Duvall St. The King Bed room had an amazing whirlpool bath in it and a separate bathroom with shower stall. ~~The room was more than we ever expected and more incredible than we ever dreamed. We are definitely spoiled for our next trip. Pool/Liquid Lounge - We went to the pool almost every day. It has a view of the water and one night we even watched the sunset from in the pool. There are tons of comfortable lounge chairs, even some in cabanas if you want to stay out of the sun. On our first visit we snagged a cabana, although we weren't sure if there was an extra charge or not. We went to the bar and got some of the best Mojitos we have ever had. A few moments later a gentleman in hotel uniform comes over, we thought we were getting kicked out the cabana, but no!! he was the pool concierge and he wanted to see how we were enjoying ourselves. We saw him numerous times over the week and he was always helpful, even offered to wait on us from the bar. The bartenders were also great, made great drinks (try the Mango Mojito) and would try to make rounds to the chairs and swimmers to replenish drinks when they weren't too busy. Most days there was a pool boy replacing towels and fixing chairs as well. There are bathrooms near the pool, down a short flight of steps. NOTE: Sign at pool says open dawn to dusk, but book in room says 9am-9pm. One night we called to make sure the pool was open and the front desk said as long as they didnâ€™t get any noise complaints then it was fine. Needless to say we went to the pool most nights, very late. Hot Tin Roof Restaurant â€“ We ate both dinner and breakfast here, both meals were outstanding. For our dinner, we wanted to sit outside, but it was very windy, the host offered to move us inside, and when we refused to get us pool towels to wear as shawls. The food was very good, but expensive. The mojitos here were also very good. Our breakfast was also good, the tea they serve and the pots they use were really interesting, and now my mom wants one for Christmas. Sunset Pier â€“ A great place for an app and drink to watch the sunset, away from all the performers by the Westin. The food they serve here is also the food they serve by the pool at lunchtime. I had a mojito club sandwich that was very good. The Spa- One afternoon on a whim I decided to stop by the spa to see if they would fit me in, and I got so lucky. I had a 50 Swedish massage and it was great, there is no sales pitch to buy products or anything. Just a relaxing massage, in a gorgeous room, there was a soaking tub on the balcony and a beautiful view. Concierge â€“ We used the concierge to book our dolphin/snorkel trip and our Wind and Wine trip on the Danger. She was incredibly helpful and we had a wonderful trip thanks to her. Front Desk â€“ Every time we went near the desk, the staff was so friendly and helpful. I cannot wait to go back! I almost forgot the coolest part, the parking lot is on the ground floor, but they grew flowers and vines as a ceiling so you can't see the cars. It was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously, resort??”
Reviews.Author: rs2512
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in the past week. Pros - Since we had just two days in Key West, we decided to stay here after so much research. What better address than 0, Duval St. Hotels/Price line/Expedia and all the sites laud this place. The suite was spacious and looked very colorful.. more like Caribbean decor. The bed was super comfortable. The bathroom was aesthetically decorated and the whirpool/jacuzzi tub was a nice bonus to have... The evening live music was enjoyable and Mallory square being a step away was awesome and again cant beat the location! Cons - All said and done, this is NOT a resort. This is your average Holiday Inn type of hotel, can you accept that as a resort and pay $300-400 per night? Partial Ocean view room that we had booked was facing a parking lot. When I stand in the patio, tilt my head to see across some 5 coconut trees, I see water in some distance. From the room, all I can see is the tree. Be prepared to get wake up call by roosters at 5 30 AM and you can hear them loud and clear. Or service personnel rolling drums or parking noise(we stayed in 3rd floor) or your neighbor shutting the door. The facility is really old, it looks like some apartment complex built decades ago. The valet parking (imagine apartment parking, but not underground) is totally insecure and anyone can walk in to this parking area through the back door (open 24 hrs to all!) and to your rooms too! Internet did not work for us - on an iphone, HTC, ipad and a laptop. The receptionist requested that we bring our system to her. When that happened, the response was "Due to bad weather, may be the router is not working". Du'h, thats the most lame reason... like ever. It was difficult to not laugh for that reason, aye. The room had two TVs, really old LG ones. On demand movies / music menu did not work in our room and again the receptionist suggested that someone come and take a look. At 11 in the night, we did not have the patience to go through that. So no TV either. Then my husband was hungry late in the next night and I suggested the snacks that they had beautifully arranged on this side table. As he checked, most of the items had expired. We shot couple of pictures and then got tired clicking other expired stuff there. I've attached two photos here. If above all still qualifies this hotel as a resort, try this. The toilet paper is the really cheap single ply paper that you can only find in public rest rooms on a highway. I lost it there and decided to write here. For all the cons said above, we were waived the 40 $ parking fee off. When I travel from west coast all the way to key west, pay thousands of $, I'd spend that 40 and take a nice vacation in a semi decent place than this one. This is an over rated hotel, 4 star is seriously laughable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: teamzsteve
Reviews.Content: This place was awesome I cant wait to go back next year. 0 Duval Street says it all the best location. The restaurant is awesome also. Price was a little high but I will be back next year. Not going to take a chance to save a little money.

Reviews.Title: “Okay place to stay, but not great!”
Reviews.Author: Eggroll22
Reviews.Content: I have been to Key West many times and always wanted to stay at this hotel because of the location and pool! I have to say the location is pretty great. Right next to Mallory square. We had a nice room which was rather large. A decent view and a patio looking at the water. We went with a friend who is handicapped and I explained when making the reservation that we needed a room that would be easy for him to walk to. They said "no problem". Imagine my horror when we had to walk through the lobby, down a long corridor, across the parking lot and down long hallways to get to our room. This was not a great start. The pool was very crowded and it's not very big so you really don't have much room to move around. It's also quite loud and has a Vegas vibe, not really my scene when it comes to hotel pools. We had a good breakfast at the hotel restaurant. It has a nice atmosphere. I just don't see that this hotel lives up to the Noble House reputation. It's not worth the price and I don't think that it's a 4 or 5 star hotel. It's comparable to a Marriot or a Sheraton. We will stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location !!”
Reviews.Author: MdPeeps
Reviews.Content: We had previously been to Key West on a cruise stop, but this was our first true trip there. We liked the idea of being in the middle of things, without the need to rent a car or bike. Ocean Key's location fit the bill. The only room type available upon booking was the Junior Suite - Island view. Room was great - sitting area, balcony, large bathroom, etc. Some negative reviews I had seen noted troubles with housekeeping and noise from roosters and people. We would leave our room and come back to a clean one. Not a single issue with housekeeping. Yes, we heard roosters, but they were never loud enough to wake or bother us. Actually, the blinds in the room were so nice that no light came in until you opened them. Allowed us to sleep late a couple days. As for people noise, we heard very little outside noise. Again, not at all annoying, The hotel's location was perfect. Taxi from the airport was $17. We walked to all meals and shopping. We also really walked on two days along the bike path around the island, resulting in over 24 miles clocked on my Iphone, and saw three iguanas in trees. Pool was fabulous. Never had trouble getting a chair. Staff was great. When a guest left, the chairs were cleared and reset immediately. Bartenders and attendants were very friendly. Had lunch by pool one day - very good food. Pool area is also great spot to watch sunset and avoid the crowd. Would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here on our next trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place In Key West”
Reviews.Author: gnat2217
Reviews.Content: Ocean Key Resort has the perfect location and atmosphere. All the fun and excitement of Mallory Square and Duval Street are right around the corner, yet the hotel could not be more peaceful. Beautiful view of the Gulf from the pool, Sunset Pier, and your rooms. Hot Tin Roof, the hotel restaurant, has a wonderful view of the Gulf as well that you can enjoy while eating breakfast, lunch or dinner. The staff is very friendly and attentive to all your needs and the rooms are beautiful! This was our first time in Key West and it was a wonderful experience. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms and views”
Reviews.Author: Laureninvail17
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in arguably one of the best locations in all of Key West. It's at the tip of Duval Street, right on the water with views of the most exciting and beautiful time of day in all of Key West: Sunset. The hotel's rooms are gorgeous. They're what I would call a modern Hemingway style, with whites, corals and blues throughout. The pool is one of the best features of this hotel, as are the Hot Tin Roof restaurant and the Sunset Pier located just outside. The pool overlooks the ocean, and the decor around the pool cabanas and bar is also quite beautiful. The location of the hotel is also nice because while you're just steps away from all of the nightlife on Duval and Mallory Square, you're also just far enough away to get some peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy Appetizers”
Reviews.Author: pilar1127
Reviews.Content: You could not ask for a better location or view at the outside bar, and the bartenders are quite good. However, the appetizers we had were awful. The Peel & Eat Shrimp were tasteless, overcooked, and mealy. The other thing we had was some deep-fried steak & cheese thing that was obviously something acquired from Sysco - definitely not house-made. It was completely tasteless as well. I will not be returning there for the food, that's for sure. Inexcusable that cook's in Key West do not know how to properly prepare Peel & Eats, and that management is allowing crap like this to be served. And choosing pre-prepared frozen garbage from Sysco is just plain lazy.

Reviews.Title: “A great balance between the excitement of Duval & peace of the Gulf”
Reviews.Author: Tery_Dave
Reviews.Content: A great find @ the end of Duval Street. Stayed in a really beautiful suite overlooking Sunset Pier and the Gulf. If you want the music and nite life of Duval - it's just around the corner to the right...Malory Square @ Sunset - make a left...prefer the quiet of Gulf - sit on the balcony or by the pool right in front of you.. The staff couldn't be more accommodating, the resort is expertly maintained and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding”
Reviews.Author: Megansbyrd
Reviews.Content: Just had my wedding at the Ocean Key Resort and Spa! It was absolutely amazing. Stephanie and Katherine the coordinators were so helpful! The rooms were spacious and very nice. The location is awesome except for the noise but that is unavoidable! I would highly recommend this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: JPCJR
Reviews.Content: Sometimes when people say a hotel is friendly and quaint that means it isn't also comfortable and modern. Not true at all with Ocean Key Resort. It is quaint and has many of its own idiosyncracies but it is also very comfortable and as modern as you could hope for on a vacation to Key West. Above all, every member of the staff that my wife and I interacted with was friendly and helpful from the moment we pulled up to the moment we left after our long weekend. The room was unnecessarily large with a comfortable patio overlooking palm trees and the water. Great location at the end of Duval Street near every place you could possibly want to go for fun in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: Lisa Rob U
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ocean Key during Fantasy Fest. The 2 bedroom suite was perfect for both couples, The rooms were well maintained, clean and spotless. The staff was just great, with great service. The amenities were perfect, we got a couples massage which was so nice!! Will be back next year for the boat races.

Reviews.Title: “My Great escape”
Reviews.Author: WayneDurant
Reviews.Content: I stayed their with my ex partner ten years ago at the resort. I had experienced many feelings when i was there on my birthday sept 11th 2001 when the twin towers came down when i was about to drink champagne at aprox 9am in the morning. The accomadation and staff were all amazing. I still have my cuddly toy monkey with hat and tee shirt still intact from the time. I would recommend you to anyone that goes to Key West. Good luck to your future. x

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel - will return”
Reviews.Author: susan h
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Tripadvisor, I chose this hotel. A perfect pick!! Right in the middle of the action, yet quiet and relaxing in our room. We were lucky to get an upgrade and ended up with a fabulous suite overlooking Sunset Pier and the gulf. The hotel itself was immaculate and the staff very accommodating. The only downside was that they charged an extra $20 a day to park your car. I had never encountered that "hidden fee" before. So be aware that your room will cost $20 more than posted.

Reviews.Title: “The location is the best aspect of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: KellyIom
Reviews.Content: Great location on Duval Street, even during the flooding! But the room wasn't great; old, dirty and sour smelling, it was a bit of a shock after 3 weeks touring the States as this room was way worse than hotels elsewhere where we paid $100 for a suite with a kitchen, which included breakfast. Not that it was terrible don't get me wrong, it is just a bit old. Some might describe it as having 'character'. Probably was just not to my taste but could definitely have done with a good clean as everywhere was dusty, the windows were filthy and on the door to get to the patio I actually wrote my name in the grime. Maybe this is just the style of Key West hotels, as I can't really compare as this was our first time to Key West. Also wasnt keen on the fact you had to step up a 2 foot wall to get into the bath to have a shower but loved the comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, view & service”
Reviews.Author: MSR100
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were more than pleasantly surprised to be upgraded to the penthouse. The view from the full deck was unbelievable, and the location at the end of Duval Street gave us a sense of privacy while being steps from all the action. We loved having live music in the Sunset Pier right below us. Dinner at the Hot Tin Roof, the hotel's restaurant, was exceptional. Our only complaint (and it's minor) was on our last day when we had to drive to Miami to catch a plane, we were counting on an early breakfast in the hotel when they were scheduled to open at 7:30, but they were still closed at 7:45. When we checked with the front desk, they told us the restaurant was open, but this was not the case. The rest of the stay was great in spite of being there for an historic rain storm that flooded Duval Street.

Reviews.Title: “NOT RECOMMENDED”
Reviews.Author: lana690505
Reviews.Content: Went there last week with my family last week. To start with the positive aspects - good location with a great view and a small, but nice Pool & Jacuzzi and rather large rooms At breakfast I had to repeat 3x my order and it took about 20min (and 4 follow-ups before we got coffee) - when the breakfast came half of the order was wrong. The quality of the food was rather poor (fruits did not seem to be fresh) Every day at about 15:00 I had to remind room service to clean our room. The cleaning was ok, but the dishes was never washed. The room and equippment is rather old and the air-conditioning is so loud that you have to decide: ultra-hot in the room and no sleeping, or cold and no sleeping The TV set in the sleeping room is definitively form the last century and the quality of the picture is poor - not acceptable! And the paid internet was the slowest I experienced on my US trip. Conclusion: over-priced hotel, with average quality and rather poor service. You will find much better places with similar price range and beach (e.g. Waldorf) where we had breakfast on our leaving day. Friendly people, good quality food and a nice beach

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sharon105
Reviews.Content: We stayed at OKR for 5 nights and had a wonderful time. All who worked at the hotel were friendly, professional and helpful with any questions we had. Patrick was especially helpful in suggesting activities to fill our time during our stay. We received a very warm greeting upon arriving (as well as an upgrade to a suite) and a very speedy check out with a taxi waiting outside. The location of the hotel is PERFECT...far enough to be a bit outside of the action yet walking distance to everything. The Sunset Pier is perfect not only for viewing the spectacular sunsets but to visit daily for afternoon cocktails. Without question, I recommend OKR for anyone planning a trip to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Jan675
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Great hotel staff. Great rooms. Great location. Only place to stay in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable if you get the right room.”
Reviews.Author: JeremyKingsbury
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Ocean Key Resort on two occasions and, after initial room issues, (on both visits), we ended up having an excellent stay. On the first occasion the Resort was being cleaned/repainted and we were given a room overlooking Mallory square, unfortunately the large diesel power plant that was providing the cleaning power was directly underneath our balcony which meant that we would have been unable to use the balcony during the day due to diesel fumes. I went back to the front desk and explained the situation only to be told there were no other similar rooms available, not what I wanted to hear so I requested an upgrade, even if it meant paying for it. The front desk could not have been more helpful really, they gave us an ocean front room on the third floor overlooking the tiki bar and sunset pier, there was an additional charge that we came to an agreement over, (as it happened, this was waived on checking out), I think it helped that we kept the issue civil and appreciated the job the staff were doing, they were apparently unaware of the diesel problem. As it turned out, we could not have asked for a better room or outlook, it was certainly one of the holiday highlights. The second visit had a strange similarity to the first, beneath our balcony, again overlooking Mallory square, was a workman with a pipe threading machine, he was installing a small bore pipe system around the Resort/car park, climbing up ladders to be almost level with our balcony whilst he worked, again not acceptable. The front desk offered an alternative room which we didn't really like so we again came to an agreement to upgrade to a better room, this one overlooked the pool and the ocean. All the rooms we looked at and stayed in were furnished in a similar fashion, typical Key West/Caribbean style, all were of an excellent standard and the cleaning could not be faulted. The Resort itself is in an ideal location at the bottom end of Duval street and all the bars/restaurants and entertainment that is available at this end of the island, is within easy reach. There is a motor scooter rental just outside the Resort, boat trips and jet ski hire are also right outside, the tram tour stop is over the road, Mallory square, the ship wreck museum and any number of shops are also right on your doorstep. The tiki bar on sunset pier offers reasonably priced food and drinks, it is a great place to chill out watching the sunset along with the regular live entertainment. We ate at the Resorts Hot Tin Roof restaurant on both visits and had very good meals but the wine is quite expensive for what it is. The pool area is quite compact but is exceptionally clean and well run, the staff were polite and attentive to your needs. The Resort shop offers the usual fare, we thought the prices were quite high, however, not sure that the quality doesn't warrant this, especially the clothing. There is a CVS shop practically next door to the Resort that provides practically all your extra holiday needs, really convenient if you find you have forgotten or run out of something. I thought the nightly car parking fee was a bit on the high side considering the Resort room rates, I appreciate that space is of a premium but the Pier House Resort over the road from the Ocean Key does not charge its clients a parking fee. To address other reviewers comments regarding the "homeless" people that live on the Key West streets, people should be aware that a number of these people do sleep and "live" around the Resort location, ie. Mallory square. It seems that the Resort management allows them to use the pool area toilet facilities to wash and get drinking water, I assume this is the Resorts choice of action as no staff members prevented them access or moved them on. During our time at Ocean Key, none of these people posed the slightest threat and all were relatively polite if engaged in conversation. At the end of the day this is Key West and I think the general attitude and easy going nature of the Key West locals is commendable. We did notice a couple of minor incidents with street people along Duval street but the Police are quick to respond. Of all the trips and excursions available, and if you have the nerve, I think that the bi-plane flight options are an absolute must, it is literally breath taking, also take some time to visit the cemetery, some really interesting Key West history can be found here. Most of the bars along Duval, (and obviously the other Key West locations). have live entertainment of all styles and to suit all tastes, mostly geared towards drinking and having a great time. there are also any number of excellent restaurants to suit all tastes and budgets, (if you are able, visit Louie's Backyard restaurant, it's certainly one of the best). To sum it up, Key West is a must do/see location for anyone, you have to see it and experience it for yourself and, if your budget allows, the Ocean Key Resort is probably the best place to stay when you do visit. Unfortunately the Ocean Key Resort rates have become a little expensive for myself now I have retired, so when I return to Key West next May, I will be staying at the Pier House Resort, I will review this Resort on my return.

Reviews.Title: “management needs customer service”
Reviews.Author: ohiorona
Reviews.Content: I try to dot my eyes and cross my tees before leaving for a trip. I emailed this hotel twice about an early checkin as our fligh arrived at 11:30 and their check out is at 11:00. We got to the hotel around 12, and was told that our room wasn't ready and to go have lunch, we did and after waiting around til like 2:00 I addressed the clerk about the hold up. The manager rudely decided to step in and tell me in no uncertain terms that they never guarantee early check in before 4:00. I told him I had corresponded with them and they said it wouldn't be a problem and he basically told me that didn't happen. Now my blood pressure is getting up there and I told him I'd never recommend anyone to go to this hotel if this is the way management talks to guests and he yelled across the counter not to threaten him! I'm telling you he set the tone of my overall feeling about this hotel. I own my own business and I would never do that to any of my clients. How about, sorry for the inconvenience go and have a drink on us or I'll send up a bottle of wine, whatever. And the best part is to show how out of touch he was, we had been upgraded before he even got involved and all he had to do was know his property by the room number to know someone in reservations had done this for us already. All he had to do was say, hey we upgraded you, I never knew that until we got to the room. The hotel itself was fine, we had gotten a 2 bedroom suite, but the kitchen in the unit was not remodeled and they kept it locked. These were timeshares converted. Overall, I would have enjoyed myself had this guy been less arrogant and condensending and more professional. We paid a good buck for this trip as I orginally booked a jr suite , but not for the attitude. I notice that this hotel likes to reply back to reviews, mycomment to them is don't try it with me , if It was that important to you you would have spoken to me in person, not online. Sorry, it's back to the Hyatt for us.

Reviews.Title: “watch out for noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: ken f
Reviews.Content: Great hotel although a bit quirky as others have said. Right where everything happens meaning the location could not be better. Only compaint we had was the room we were given (315) - gorgeous room with spa bath in the corner of the room, overlooking the ocean but it was directly above the restaurant and bar area where we could not avoid the speakers directed towards the pool area. There was no way we could sit on our balcony or read our books listening to the ocean waves with that racket which we could hear even with our bedroom door closed. Fortunately we were given another room (417) one floor up and overlooking the pool and ocean but we could then hear the pool bar music which I wasn't too happy about but it was an improvement and they gave us a suite which was beautiful. We found some of the staff slow but we are told that is the Key West way! it is a beautiful hotel, food was wonderful and we encountered some friendly faces but not all! it would have been a better experience if our room had have been right at the offset and I was not made to feel like a criminal for complaining but I guess some people make a living from compalining in the hope to get an upgrade and the staff must think everyone is the same. I genuinely was upset at spending $1000 for three nights then put in a room with no escape from their choice of music. I am not against music but I like to control it myself and not be at the mercy of those in the bar. For party people it would have been a great experience and the room of their dreams but we are just a little quieter. Key West has a party atmosphere and maybe it was just the wrong choice of Island for us party poopers. Key west is stunning, the hotel is excellent and we will be back when it isn't raining but we may opt for a hotel that is slightly further from the action - dumb I know but we are all made different!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Catchi99
Reviews.Content: We just spent four days at this hotel for our honeymoon! The room was perfect, we had a view of the ocean, pool and the square! We watched the sunset from our balcony rather than standing on a crowed pier! The food a Hot tin roof was great, room service was punctual and delious. The people who worked at liquid lounge were so atentive and friendly. The location was great. In the heart of town. A stones throw to everything. We went fishing one day and Nate from the pool called the chef who cooked up our fresh catch for lunch n dinner! A special shout out to Nate at the pool! He was the best. He made sure to offer the best places to go, eat... Etc. A real nice guy. I could go on and on! I will never stay anywhere else! Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Key Resort Key West”
Reviews.Author: michael c
Reviews.Content: The hotel was converted from timeshare/condo use about 12 years ago and has not been updated since. The location is great, as is the sunset pier but the rooms are noisy (single glazed windows, poorly fitted doors and no soundproofing. Overall - a tired hotel. If I return to Key West I will go elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: TBRON
Reviews.Content: Perfect view of the sunset without even leaving our balcony! Rooms are beautiful, service is A-1! Great accessibility to all of Duval and Mallory Square. Have sent all family and friends on their visits!

Reviews.Title: “Premier location”
Reviews.Author: Starison
Reviews.Content: Ask for a room overlooking the ocean and Mallory Square. it's worth the cost. A very nice room/suite with a great deck. The location couldn't be any better.

Reviews.Title: “It's pretty close to perfect here.”
Reviews.Author: MamaFitz15
Reviews.Content: From start to finish was best hotel experience we have ever had. Great location and immaculate rooms. Loved the islandy feel very upscale. Excellent staff!! They were all so great and so willing to help. We can't wait to come back. If it wasn't perfect it was really, really close.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort with top notch staff and service”
Reviews.Author: Jill D
Reviews.Content: Ocean Key definatley met and exceeded my expectation. I had the basic room and it was big with beautiful spa bath. Balcony with ocean view and partial view of Malory square sunset activities. Staff and service were tremendous! Pool drinks and food pricey but well worth the experience...would HIGHLY recommend Ocean Key resort!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kristin b
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms and views! My first trip to Key West and I was SO happy I made my reservations at this hotel. Well maintained rooms, lobby, and grounds. We've stayed at some really high scale establishments and this hotel was top notch all the way. Did not have enough time to get to eat in one of their restaurants, but the menus looked wonderful. Located right in the heart of the action with LOTS to see and do within walking distance. I highly recommend paying a little extra and staying at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for destination wedding!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl8727
Reviews.Content: Ocean Key was the perfect setting for our destination wedding ceremony and reception. We planned the entire event from Chicago and were extremely impressed with the resort and the staff. Everyone from the front desk, bell boys, and pool staff were very courteous and attentive. I can't give enough compliments to Stephanie Happ, Catering Manager, as she is extremely knowledgable and helped ensure our wedding was all we hoped it would be...and better!! The Ocean Terrace is ideal for a sunset wedding as the resort transforms the terrace into a beatiful and private space. The Sunset Pier is gorgeous and it's the perfect location for watching the sunset. The food for the reception was fantastic and the bar service was excellent. The food from the Sunset Pier during the day is also great and I highly recommend the fish tacos! I would recommend this property to anyone who is looking to have a wedding and/or to stay while in Key West. Ocean Key is in the best location, at the end of Duval Street, and within walking distance to restaurants, bars, shopping, and tourist attractions. Overall, we and our guests loved Ocean Key and they all said it was the best destination wedding they've attended.

Reviews.Title: “All was excellent”
Reviews.Author: Heidi O
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ocean Key for only two days buy wished we stayed longer just for the hotel. The staff was friendly and the pool was relaxing and wonderful! I would recommend this to anyone who is tired of being disappointed with other reports. This will be a breath of fresh air!

Reviews.Title: “Great food, beautiful pool and terrific location”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer B
Reviews.Content: I travel constantly for my job and stay in countless hotels across the US. We loved our stay at the Ocean Key. The suite we stayed in had the perfect view of the gulf, a terrific private deck overlooking the Sunset Pier. The room was clean and the bed super comfortable. The shower felt like a shower at a Spa. The location was perfect. A CVS right beside the hotel was convenient for purchasing water, sun tan lotion, etc. The pool was the best part of our trip. The view from the pool was gorgeous. The servers brought you drinks, placed towels on your chairs, brought you cold washclothes to cool you down and provided consierge service pool side. I've stayed at numerous hotels and B&Bs in Key West, but the Ocean Key was by far the most beautiful and convenient location on the entire island.

Reviews.Title: “Plush paradise in the Keys' party capital”
Reviews.Author: Nomad464
Reviews.Content: After our civil partnership we honeymooned in the Florida Keys and Ocean Key Resort & Spa was our final stop. We were there off-season, in September, and it was very hot and muggy. The a/c in the room was fierce but not at all loud (some of the other hotels we stayed in had a/c units that sounded like approaching trains). When we checked in, we were upgraded to a beautiful double aspect room overlooking the pool and Malory square, where the Sunset Festival happens every night featuring local performers (the guy on the 10ft unicycle was v good) and craft work for tourists. The hotels bar and restaurant have great views of the ocean - I've reviewed the restaurant separately (Hot Tin Roof). Our room was spotlessly clean and had a large bath tub with jacuzzi in the bedroom, jack and jill sinks and a separate w/c and shower room. The bed was super comfy and the look and feel was modern plush. We had room service breakfast on one day and the service was excellent - our balcony table was laid with cloth, vase, cruet set etc - nice touch I thought. The pool area looks very high end, and the attendants are great at making sure that all the seating has fresh towels and everything looks spick and span. I can't really fault this hotel, it's rarely I'll give an "excellent" in all categories - thanks Ocean Key for a perfect end to a fantastic honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RJO13
Reviews.Content: Great food great location great views, loved the spa!! Don't go during spring break was a little loud. Great activities near by too.

Reviews.Title: “Attitudinal”
Reviews.Author: robertnkenn
Reviews.Content: The front desk was helpful , but the overall expirience of the visit was uneventful . I got the idea that the employees took it for granted that people would come there to drink and eat because of their location on the water. Prices for weak drinks were expensive and served without flair or care. The staff gave us the impression that they were in fact doing us a favor serving us. In such a location as Key West, everything was mediocre including the food and drinks. There are other alternatives that we expirienced where we were welcomed with open arms and treated with respect, they include the Hyatt on Front Street, the Pier House and the restaurant and bar downstairs from A&B Lobster House which has the best happy hour on the island, 1/2 price apps and drinks everyday from 4 to 6:30 and validated parking right next door. Places like Ocean Key obviously have have bad management and pass it right down to their employees. Don't bother

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: keywest8
Reviews.Content: Had a great time here in June 2011 staff were excellent room was lovely and view was great hotel in ideal position the pier was good good service on there and great meals.Was there a few years ago and was good then but has got better.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD CHOICE”
Reviews.Author: topdown111
Reviews.Content: Great location and outstanding view from the balcony. Room was spacious and comfortable. Thought that the valet parking would be an issue, it wasn't. Everything was in walking distance and walk we did. We only spent one night so we didn't eat at the restaurant on-site. Being Floridians, the pool wasn't a big draw for us. But the pool area looked busy and people seemed to be soaking up the sun and the rum, in that order. Lounges were plentiful and well cushioned, everyone seemed to be having a great time. Would definitely return and would recommend this hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, clean rooms, awesome views”
Reviews.Author: elizabethroscoe
Reviews.Content: Staff is friendly, efficient and helpful. Location is fantastic. Everything, from the rooms to the spa to the food is well done without being fancy or fussy. Laid back small resort that is totally in sync with the relaxed, fun Key West vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: jjula1979
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first visit ever to Key West...and although it's a bit on the pricier side for our budget, I would still stay here again and adjust finances accordingly. The rooms are breezy, bright, and comfy. The hotel is ridiculously accessible to the heart of Key West. They park your car for you, show you to your room, and do turn down service every night. We had a great balcony and I'm quite sure I've never been in a bathroom quite that size before! :) There were a few times we didn't want to go out of our room because we wanted to just relax there. Everything is within walking distance. Everything. I loved Ocean and would reco it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: Jhoneycutt
Reviews.Content: I brought my wife here for birthday. The resort is beautiful,the staff is super friendly. The pool is the best place to just hang out and watch the sunset. The room was very nice,roomy,wonderful view and a super comfy bed. The food was fenaminal!! The Hot Tin Roof is a must do while here. Although the poolside and sunset pier food is wonderful as well!! Will defiantly stay here again,as a matter of fact wife wants to make this her birthday trip every year. Thank you staff of Ocean Key!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have been too!!”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Bean101
Reviews.Content: Wow! This is probably the best hotel I have been to in my life! The lobby is very nice and the room is amazing! We got lucky and managed to get one of the best rooms in the hotel. It had two BIG rooms, two bathrooms, one spa, a huge living room, and a nice kitchen with a mini bar. It also has two balconies. The pool is very nice and also has small bar. They also have a very formal restaurant that you have to make reservations to eat there. So all in all, this is the best hotel I have been to and would recommend this to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed every minute of it!”
Reviews.Author: Bethlani
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in December. It is truly a great location, so convenient! The staff was very helpful and friendly. The hotel room was clean. The view of the sunset from our room was awesome. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: magicdave76
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in Key West, you can't be better placed than at Ocean Key. 2 minutes from Mallory Square but a couple of blocks from where Duval Street gets loud at night, it really is perfectly placed. Room was nice - spotlessly clean. We were on 5th floor (top) so we had lovely double height ceilings and a great view of the ocean. Really good concierge called Patrick who I'd whoelheartedly recommend you use - he helped us book 2 trips, both of which were top notch. Food at the pool comes from the Sunset Pier restaurant and is very good - the turkey club is highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise...”
Reviews.Author: BrianHighley
Reviews.Content: There isn't a better property in a better location in Key West! We stayed in an ocean front boutique suite (513) for four day which was simply amazing. This was my second visit to Ocean Key Resort but certainly not my last. Check in was simple and fast and the staff was very friendly and attentive. The pool is very nice and overlooks Sunset Key. The pool area is the perfect size for the property and has outstanding poolside bar service (thanks Jennifer). great way to relax! The property is at the very beginning of Duval Street which is just steps away from everything you need to do or see in Key West. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice But Too Expensive”
Reviews.Author: WeatherGuy8
Reviews.Content: I really do not like giving the Ocean Key a bad review because it is a nice hotel and it is in a prime spot - FOR KEY WEST, however it was way over priced in my view, in comparison to other traditional vacation/party spots in the U.S. The rooms were nice, up-scale, and clean. The staff was very friendly, in fact maybe a little too eager to ask you EVERY single time you walked by the front desk if you needed anything and to try to make small talk (sometimes you just want to walk through and not be bothered). The bedding was terrific - high thread counts on the sheets. It had a quaint small pool from which you could watch the sunset. That being said, it just was not worth $500 a night. We were there for a wedding and got a discount and it was still about $300 per night. You can get a larger room with more amenities for one third the price in Vegas. Yes, there is a somewhat decent view of the ocean but you can get better almost anywhere else in Florida ON THE BEACH (no beach anywhere near the Ocean Key) for one third the cost. One bad thing was that they did not have fans for my brother in law's wedding. It is hot during the Summer in Key West. We had to rent 3 fans for over $100 per fan.
