You would think that a resort that hosts a lot of Weddings and has such a high price would have some large fans to keep people cool. If you are into the Duval Street party scene and have some money to blow, then Ocean Key is probably right for you. It IS very nice. It IS close to the historic part of Key West and the most popular party spots. It worked out good for the wedding, I was happy that my brother in law chose a spot that was central to Key West and all of our eating/fun was right near the hotel. Good job brother!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel...Great Room”
Reviews.Author: TheSuze12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ocean Key Resort for 3 days. We had a two bed room suite for a family of 4 and had plenty of room to stretch out. The rooms were beautiful, the view amazing and the location close to lots of places to eat. We loved it and would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Teddy49_11
Reviews.Content: We are close enough to the property and location to utilize this as an overnight relaxation and getaway for the weekend. We have found the web sight most helpful in making this come true. The room provided for this trip is a Junior Suite with separate Living Room, Master area with a Jacuzzi and view of the Bay and Duval Street. We love it and will continue our use of this property as the number one spot in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service, friendly, great location and will be back”
Reviews.Author: J C
Reviews.Content: Husband and I chose Ocean Key after reading reviews here..far exceeded our expectations! Concierges Patryck and Oksana were outstanding and helped us create a fun and romantic experience..all staff was professional with can-do attitude and knowledgeable about hotel and recommendations for places to go..liquid lounge at pool is not to be missed..we will return again next year for sure..went in August so not overcrowded but still a lot of life and visitors..loved staying here ..rec suite on ocean side with balcony overlooking the Pier to enjoy pot of coffee in am and to listen to live music at sunset .

Reviews.Title: “We loved it so much we're already booked for next year!”
Reviews.Author: Kathy D
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Key West in Oct 2010 for a five-day getaway. What a wonderful experience we had at the Ocean Key Resort! Warm, friendly reception, beautiful decor and views, and we couldn't have asked for better service. The first night I had a small concern about the Jacuzzi tub not working properly and they offered us three different rooms (all upgrades) to make sure we were happy. We actually decided to stay in the same room even though the others were larger because we liked our view overlooking Mallory Square and the cruise ship docks. If I could come back every year, I would!!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation Pampering & Fun in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Ginnybug
Reviews.Content: We drove from SW Florida, and I would recommend the drive if you haven't done it. The overseas highway is beautiful. The resort staff was welcoming, interested in pleasing us, and went overboard to make sure our needs were met. I loved the robes and the room amenities. The room was HUGE, spotless and beautifully appointed, and our balcony overlooked Mallory Square and the swimming pool. I don't know if they have a special name for their beds, but they should. We slept so soundly both nights. The food at the Hot Tin Roof was superb, and the chef was very accommodating to my lowfat, low carb diet. It is located right in the center of the action and within walking distance to anywhere you'd want to go.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and a superb location - the best location!”
Reviews.Author: MariellaBritain
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our honeymoon trip and out first time to The Keys. We loved it. The room was very spacious, clean and colourful with a great view of the sea and Mallory Square. The bathroom was amazing - a lovely shower and a fab jacuzzi bath, the bed was comfortable and clean. The balcony was lovely and we say drinking wine and watching the crowds at Mallory Square. The pool is small but perfectly formed and the bar staff were brilliant. Helpful, hard working and efficient. My only negatives would be lack of parasols, loud music that said more party than relax. In the mornings and early afternoon it would be nice to chill with smooth music/jazz etc and start the lively stuff later on. Food; we ate at the pool and in the room. Food was perfect and good value. The room service was served by one of the nicest members of staff I have ever encountered on a holiday. I wish I could remember his name. He set up our table with a cloth and flowers and chatted away - very friendly. Would we go back - Yes! We loved Key West and we loved the hotel, and we would ask for the same room.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay anywhere else again!”
Reviews.Author: kdenson1420
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just got back yesterday from our stay at Ocean Key and are still talking about what an amazing time we had. The location is the best in Key West, right at the end of Duval St., within walking distance to all the local nightlife, and on the water in case you are interested in the watersports. The staff are very friendly and accomodating. Nate at the pool is a ROCKSTAR! Always there with a frozen towel to cool you down, and willing to do anything to make your stay as relaxing as possible. We stayed thursday night at the Pier House, across the street, and were very disappointed. We called Ocean Key the next morning and they had a great suite for the next two nights available! It is a little pricey, but worth every penny!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful, flawless hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lydia H
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel in a prime location. Our room over looked the ocean where crowds gather at night to watch the sun set. The hotel was lovely and clean. As it was our honeymoon, we felt the hotel was perfect for our stay. The hotel staff were very freindly and polite. We bith felt it was the best hotel we've stayed in throughout our 3 weeks of travelling around Florida. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice ramada”
Reviews.Author: jodi p
Reviews.Content: I have been to alot of hotels. This one was extra nice . The staff are nice and organized. The prices are affordable. This is a good choice of hotel if you are staying in this area!

Reviews.Title: “Superior experience in every way”
Reviews.Author: Jim730
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. I cannot think of even one complaint including an incredible location. Be sure and enjoy the sunset at the Sunset Pier.

Reviews.Title: “amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: cindycoholan
Reviews.Content: So I just checked out this morning so I am hoping I wont have any of the credit card issues I read about on here. With that said I must say we LOVED our stay!! Last min. we needed to find a room for the night and took a look at a few different properties. The staff here was wonderful and even let us look at the room before booking.....a HUGE plus!!! We did stay on the top floor with an ocean view and view of the pier. I know some dont enjoy the fact that you can hear music from your room but it made us feel like we have a front row seat to a concert we didnt pay for!! It was so nice to sit and enjoy the music while having the best view on the island in our opinion. We can't wait to return!!!!! OH and the poolbar was amazing!! OUr bartender was great and made a wonderful martini. Also there was someone who came around with frozen towels so you could cool off. Top notch!!!!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is great”
Reviews.Author: darcey1971
Reviews.Content: Lovely rooms. Ours seemed recently renovated and looked over the ocean, great location, you are on Duval Street and Sunset Pier. The pool and hot tub are beautiful, you can watch the sunset from the pool. The restaurant is a great place for all your meals or even and afternoon iced tea (of course it overlooks the water). Call the hotel directly when making reservations they may be able to give you better rates. The spa and gym looked nice even though we didn't use them. It feels like a boutique hotel and we didn't see many kids. Easy to get taxi to and from airport.

Reviews.Title: “The last stop on our honeymoon :) Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Kinnes31
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here the second week of August as the capper to our honeymoon. We absolutely LOVED Ocean Key. I would say one of it's strongest points, is it's location. It is right at the end of Duval, right next to Mallory Square, where everyone gathers at night to watch the famous Key West sunsets. You're a stone's throw to many of Key West's main attractions and if you're too far, the front desk is more than ready to help you with a taxi, bike or car rentals. The room we had was lovely, with a view of Mallory Square, the ocean and the pool. The rooms are cute and decorated very "Key West" in my opinion. The bed was quite comfortable and the room stayed relatively dark with the curtains closed. The restaurants at Ocean are excellent, especially Hot Tin Roof. We found it recommended in many Key West guides and it didn't disappoint. Incredible views, creative and delicious dishes, romantic ambiance and good service. The pool here is quite small, and I imagine that it is packed during the winter months. Other than that, the seating is comfortable, the Liquid Lounge is great and they even walked around offering pool guest frozen towels occasionally! The one downside I do have to mention is the noise. It certainly isn't overly noisy, but the since the halls are tiled, when anyone rolls their luggage or housekeeping rolls their cart through the halls, you hear it. You can also hear talking from the halls and music from the square until about 11pm. The noise at night didn't bother my husband and I but I did find I woke up every morning to the sound of housekeeping's carts. Overall we loved Ocean Key and can't wait to get back!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Robert M
Reviews.Content: We upgraded our room and had a view to die for! We watched the sunset from our balcony,this must be the best location for a hotel on Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Roper97414
Reviews.Content: We had a room overlooking Mallory Square. Loved the balcony! The bathroom alone was the size some other hotel rooms in KW( large open shower and jacuzzi tub ). Really comfortable beds with fluffy pillows. You really feel safe in the entire complex area. A little on the pricey side for most people even with discounts but it was worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Cropwell
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July with our 14yr old son. We had booked a double roomthrough our tour operator but when we arrived we found ourselves in a two bedroom suite with jacuzzi bath, our son had his own bedroom and TV. The room overlooked Mallory Square and had a balcony. The rooms here were quieter than those ovelooking Duval Street. Room was very spacious and had excellent maid service. The location of the hotel and pool afforded great views over the harbour at Key West and was very convenient for Duval Street and other sights. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Only downsides were that the pool was rather crowded at the Weekends and $20 compulsory Valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Had our wedding here...”
Reviews.Author: robinett77
Reviews.Content: We have family in the Keys and frequently visit, but don't usually stay in hotels. We had a destination wedding in Key West and planned it at the Ocean Key. The rooms were large. The location is great. The service and staff was excellent. Hot Tin Roof restaurant service was excellent. The Pier Bar restaurant had spotty service and just ok food for the price. I would have rated the hotel higher, but it is expensive. The Pier House Hotel next door was $100 per night cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SunnyLana
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter for a mini vacation and the location made all the difference. We were 1 step away from everything - all fun water activities right downstairs, all shopping (art, gifts, fun stuff) right outside the front door of the hotel. The hotel itself is a beautiful property, with a charming and relaxing outside and indoor decor. Loved it. I highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, awful infrastructure”
Reviews.Author: mntaormina
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and another couple spent 3 nights at Ocean Key. We booked a last-minute deal for a "junior suite." To call this room a suite is a stretch, but the rate of $199 per night was good. If we had paid full price, we would not have checked in. The location of the resort is great--right on Duval Street near shops and restaurants. The entire staff is friendly, knowledgeable, courteous, eager-to-please and polite. However, the physical plant itself is old, not adequately air-conditioned (except in the guest rooms). The elevators are not air-conditioned at all (this, in Florida's summer). In addition, you must walk through the parking lot (no a/c) to get to/from your room just before walking an unair-conditioned catwalk to your room. The room we were in had no mirror at all except for the bathroom. The furnishings were old and worn. There were roosters below our balcony who woke us each morning at 4:30 AM (nobody mentioned this to us prior to check-in). I would have asked for a room away from the poultry. Our view (which I specified was very important to us while booking the room) was obstructed by a wall and billed as overlooking Mallory Square (which it did partially) but mostly overlooked a parking lot. I had a facial at Spa Terre--excellent! Best facial I've ever had--80 minutes including a back massage. We ate dinner at the expensive hotel restaurant, Hot Tin Roof. The food quality was excellent. However, this area too, had inadequate air conditioning. We spent well over $300 for dinner for the two couples and will not return because we don't have to be uncomfortable at those prices. To sum up, we had a great time in Key West and plan to return. Ocean Key has a great staff, but we will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Spot”
Reviews.Author: sstterry
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two room suite for 3 days and loved it. The room was spacious for a family of 4 and the views are breath taking. Neat pool and very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly”
Reviews.Author: aleciagj
Reviews.Content: Got married on Smathers Beach while there.. ezweddinginparadise.com. Everything about our 7 day experience was wonderful. Beautiful property, friendly and effecient staff and service. Not a better location on Key West. Loved everything and can't wait to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Overall excellent experience, the staff was great!!!”
Reviews.Author: JadedTom
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel was very friendly! They genuenlly seemed to want to do whatever they could for you to make your trip more enjoyable. The hotel was very clean and updated. The spa was very relaxing and the concierge was very helpful in planning our trip. The only downside was the elevators, they were hot and slow (mid summer), so I would recommend the stairs whenever possible! Being that it only has five floors the stairs were not too much of a bother, and hey it helped burn off all the great food in Key West that we couldn't get enough of!

Reviews.Title: “Best place we have ever stayed in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Napa626Venice_FL
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate on hotel website. A last minute special. The hotel is near everything, restaurants, shops, beach. Beautiful views and 5 star service. This was a getaway for my husband's birthday and the room was fabulous(junior suite) beautiful terrace where you can relax with a cocktail and people watch. Pier where you can watch sunset and enjoy entertainment that is top notch. NL 7/29/11

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, Fine Dining, Unmatched Sunset Views.”
Reviews.Author: southmiamijill
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Ocean Key Resort many times over years for the same reasons. The location. The service. The spa. The Hot Tin Roof Restaurant. The amazingly gorgeous views...my blood pressure drops just writing about their amenities. But seriously, there is no way you could possibily be disappointed by staying here. The location is right at the end of Duval, where the sun sets into the water. Their onsite Sunset Pier is where everyone wants to be at sunset. It's adjacent to Mallory Square if you want to walk over and join the traditional festivities of watching tightrope walkers, jugglers, etc. but there is no need when you have the pool deck with loungers and a bartender all to yourself! The rooms are tropical, colorful and sophisticated. We love the boutique suite with its large jetted tub, separate living area and large comfy bed. Oh, and the balcony! Just take the elevator to the second floor to the pool or spa or restaurant. So easy, and that's what Key West is all about. The restaurant, Hot Tin Roof, is award-winning and serves three meals a day and you can dine inside or out, overlooking the water. It's so lovely. Room service is always a great option, too. Sit back and watch your big screen TV and feast in your jammies. Ahh. The good life. Ocean Key Resort is high on my list of top resorts in the U.S. and I travel quite a bit. The gift shop has a great assortment of items, too, from clothing to shoes and jewelry to nautical housewares. I always find something I can't live without.

Reviews.Title: “Way below expectations.”
Reviews.Author: FLTraveler1980
Reviews.Content: First of all the good things about this resort are the location and their concierge but that was it. We decided to splurge since our vacation was only going to be 3 nights long. When we got to the room I was so disappointed since the website makes the rooms look beautiful. I travel for business so I have stayed at many hotels all over the world. I have lots to compare it to. The furniture was older and sagging, floor was extremely dated, kitchen and appliance should of been replaced long ago. The two bedrooms had old console TVs. One didn't work so I called the front desk to tell them. No one came so I flagged down a housekeeping guy. Housekeeper told us not to use one of the sinks because it doesn't drain well. We had ocean view but were on the 2nd floor so we saw mostly shrubs. Asked for a higher level but was told it would cost us more and the room would be smaller. We paid over $500/night on the off season so we expected much better.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Key Resort & Spa â€“ Great place for our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: TravellerNI79
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Ocean Key Resort in mid June for 3 nights as part of our honeymoon travels. We loved every minute of our stay here! This Hotel, based on the experience my wife and I had during our stay was great! Great location on Duval Street, beautiful quirky key west dÃ©cor from the lobby and carried on throughout the resort into the rooms. Check in was effortless and sorted in no time. We had booked a King bed with an in room hot tub but during check-in we received a complimentary upgrade to a one bedroom suite as we mentioned while checking in we were on our honeymoon. This was totally unexpected but greatly received! My wife and I were in our room within minutes of arriving after being assisted by the doorman and receiving a quick tour of the resort. The room was great, it had everything you needed and wanted. The living area was huge with a separate kitchen area, large balcony overlooking Duval Street and in the bathroom was a large Jacuzzi style tub! Awesome! Life in the Ocean Key is very chilled and relaxed and just what my wife and I needed after staying NYC and Miami on our honeymoon travels prior to arriving here! The Pool area, aka The Liquid lounge, which was run by Nate, was great! Frozen daiquiris, dips in and out of the pool and good info on where to go in key west from Nate were just what my wife and I were looking for! We loved the Ocean Key resort and would stay there again! Thank you for making our honeymoon travels memorable for all the right reasons! Top tip: Watch the Key west sun set from the wooden pier thatâ€™s part of the hotel while sitting back with a few frozen daiquiris! Mr & Mrs S******

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: beachbumsmd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights ( we extended our stay in Key West and our inn was booked) so we moved to Ocean Key. Fabulous View!!!!! Georgeous Room, only neg I can say is a little noisy, could hear people in hallways and doors closing loudly , but if you are looking for a quiet spot you wouldn't stay here anyway ( Might be tough on light sleepers. ) Pool was awesome ( kind of miamish compared to the inn we left. ) Had good massages at the spa and great room service for breakfast. Would love to stay again, it is very high priced though. If money isn't an option, then go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Great start bad ending”
Reviews.Author: Jordanskills134
Reviews.Content: So, this was or fun little trip to Key West. We had the whole trip planned out. We were gonna swim, relax, jet-ski, etc. Although we only stayed at this hotel for one day, we experienced quite a lot. Check-in was a breeze, pleasant employees wanting to help us reach our room. We had wanted an upgrade for our room, so we asked the woman at the desk if we had gotten an upgrade. After about two minutes she replied yes I upgraded you to the bay view suite. It was strange that she wasn't going to upgrade us unless we had asked, but it was alright. The bellman was absolutely wonderful as he had quickly shown us to our room. He explained some of the fun things to do in Key West and even where some amenities were. Our room had an amazing view as well as a rain shower which we had used quite often that day. The hotel was almost like a maze and it took a couple wrong turns and confusion to finally locate some of the things we were looking for. The pool was stunning with glistening water over looking the bay area. There was actually a live band playing the day that we were their and the music was very amusing. The next day was check out. We decided to go to the hotel restaurant for breakfast. The food was alright but the service was horrible as the server hardly checked on us and most of the tables we greasy and disgusting. After waiting all night for the concierge to call us when a bag from the airline had been delivered. We walked downstairs and had found out that the bag had been delivered and no one had called us. The woman was not paying attention to us and when she was asked whether she had called or not, she gave a quick reply stating that she left a voicemail. We knew she didn't call! We left the hotel with a positive attitude just because we had gotten our bag!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Beautiful Rooms - Yummy food”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel2345
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night and could not get more so sad. This was right on the pier at 0 Duvall St. The rooms wee beautifully decorated and spacious. THe bathrooms were grand and large so enticing that i took a spa tub bath on the night of arrival as I was so tired. We stayed at the sister property "Little Palm Island" and saw some of the similar foods. The room service attendant said they would make the Papas Bravas the same way they did at Lil Palm. Thats great service. Breakfast was almost too delicious - rich. Parking was $20 and valet only. The location is really prime. I wished we stayed here the enter time. This is where the action is - close the mariana and tours, close to Fat Tuesdays etc and close to all the concert areas. The hotel had this great lounge soul singer that we watched for our balcony along with the sunset. How romantic and enjoyable. Would stay here again - this would be my choice location. Free Internet. Get an ocean front room. Quite at pm. Felt very rested in am.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, noisy”
Reviews.Author: Darke_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Key West, Stayed here for three nights. First off the place is beautiful inside, very clean, the room was spacious and spotless, high quality bedding and furnishings. The staff is top notch, helpful, professional. The not so good., Like several others stated the place is noisy, paper thin walls, you can hear EVERYTHING from adjoining rooms and outside, that is puzzling for such a otherwise top notch hotel. Also the sinks in the bathroom drained very slowly, otherwise no issues. If you are a light sleeper you might have issues here.

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort In Key West for Couples”
Reviews.Author: Torque9
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had a truly amazing experience at The Ocean Key Resort, and based on my girlfriendâ€™s expression when first seeing the room I can attest that you wonâ€™t be disappointed at choosing this resort for your stay. We stayed in Room 416 which we both agreed had to have been one of the best Ocean Front Rooms at the resort. What made this 4th floor room so amazing was that our roomâ€™s location gave us great views of: All of the Pool and the Poolâ€™s bar, Mallory Square, 180 degree view of the ocean, and some of the pier, in addition we had double sinks and a large tiled shower, Jacuzzi tub, French Doors leading to the Balcony, and plenty of natural light provide by additional windows on the wall above the bedâ€™s headboard. The resort doesnâ€™t have a lot of open tropical space but they ingeniously incorporate the open parking garage under the resort and filled in lush foliage and greenery along with suspending above the open parking garage and common areas vines growing flowers. Every evening we came back to our room and the A/C kept our room nice and cool and the turn down service provided for the night was a nice feature. The hallways in the resort are outdoor balcony hallways, and the upper floor hallways benefit from the top of the foliage grown on the ground level. The heated pool and large hot tub were great, which we enjoyed for a midnight dip. Staff at the hotel were amazingly polite and helpful, starting with the valet parking your car at arrival, front desk staff, to the bellboy taking your bags and showing you to your room, or room service setting up your breakfast on the balcony. Some of the drawback of this resort are that thereâ€™s no beach access, onsite parking is expensive, and elevators are not air conditioned. Room Tip: Book an Ocean View Room on the Mallory Square side. Best rooms are 416 and 516, also order room service for breakfast on the balcony, stock your room with items from the pharmacy right next door. Hotel Management Suggestions: In-Room Safes would be nice, Turn Down Service chocolates on the pillows would be a nice extra touch, more drawer storage space needed in the room

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for couples, families or singles”
Reviews.Author: tracythall1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent! We stayed here with our 3 year old son and found it to be very family friendly and located in a great part of town. We thought the staff was very friendly and the rooms were clean and beautiful. Whoever said the beds were uncomfortable in past reviews must have the most perfect bed ever invented. The beds were comfortable and we all slept very well. Pros: The location, the staff, the rooms were beautiful, the bathtub was inviting. The photos of the pool give the impression that it's this tiny little thing, its not, its beautiful and big. Although there were mostly adults enjoying the pool, our son was not seen as a negative presence. We were able to really enjoy the pool and the bar (not our son) as a family unit. Cons: The balcony had the same issue I have seen in other hotels, the slats and spacing were wide enough that my son could fit in the slats (we obviously didn't test it), but it was concerning enough. The other negative I found was...nothing. The balcony thing gets me every time. I really thought this was a great hotel for couples or families.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: NikNik12
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I went to Key West to elope. When looking online, we found the Ocean Key and fell in love with what we saw. Fortunately, the hotel was just as beautiful in person as it was in the pictures. Everything was just perfect...the hotel and room were gorgeous, the restaurants and bar were awesome, the spa was amazing, the staff was always friendly and helpful, and the location was perfect for its' view and going out. It is walking distance to so many things. No need to rent a car! The only negative things I would have to say is that the cruise ships blocked some of our view because they dock right next to the hotel. MANY cruise ships came and went during our stay. It was not a terrible inconvenience, but it could block someones entire view on that side of the hotel. Other than that, we cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: cathieschafer
Reviews.Content: The Ocean Key Resort is beautiful with absolutely excellent service. We were on the top floor facing Duvall Street but had a view of the ocean. The room was beautiful although the open window between the bathroom and the bedroom was not my favorite feature:) The room was extremely quiet - no street noise and no noise from other rooms was heard by us. The bed was extremely comfortable too. We spent an entire day hanging out by the pool and the service was excellent there all day, from the wait staff to the guy who moved an umbrella to our chairs, then moved our chairs with us in them to get us perfectly covered by the umbrellas. Also, they bring around frozen washcloths for some much need heat relief. We ordered food by the pool -- admittedly scorching heat a few cocktails could skew my opinion -- but honestly I think my husband's burger was one of the best I've ever tasted and my peel and eat shrimp were huge and absolutely divine. Would not want to stay anywhere else I don't think -- although there is no beach access, you can make it to the beach pretty easily if you wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, older property”
Reviews.Author: ccndallas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and enjoyed our stay. We were in one of the larger 1 bed suites and it was a nice size, with a good setup and cute "Key West" themed decor. It is an older property, but from what I understand, there aren't any newer hotels in Key West. It's in a good location at the very end of Duvall St. and allowed for easy access to all of the fun stuff! The only negatives were the $20/night for parking and the lack of an in-room safe.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, Perfect, Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: CareyM623
Reviews.Content: You can't get a better location than this. Right next to Mallory Square off the corner of Duval St. The Sunset Pier bar is one of the most popular viewing spots for the sunset and it belongs to the hotel. The pool is amazing the view is the best in Old Town. Ask for Nate! The service you receive at the pool will shock you...We've never been so pampered and taken care of in my life. Our room (deluxe suite) was lovely...huge balcony and great view. Never slept better! I absolutely would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat. I can't wait to get back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but...”
Reviews.Author: tipandchimmy
Reviews.Content: While the hotel is in a nice location you should know that there is no beach access (unless you sneak to the hotel next door). More importantly the walls are paper thin and you can hear the couple next door fighting as if they were right next to you. The pool does offer a nice view of the ocean as did our room (by paying extra). Additonally the service was excellent; however, the common areas and elevators are not air conditioned and it is quite a maze to find your way through. There is no carpeting in the rooms but the more expensive ones are spacious. Overall it's nice but not quite up to the level of a top flight resort.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, pool and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: KMinDC
Reviews.Content: Just got done staying here for 3 nights on a girls weekend June 10-13th. What a great hotel!! Perfect location right at the end of Duval Street...close enough to all the action but still far enough away from the noise. The pool was great...a little bit small, but still plenty of lounge chairs and great service!! We stayed in a suite and it had lots of room for 4 girls and a huge balcony for relaxing! I will definitely stay here again while visiting Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and will definitely come back”
Reviews.Author: JosiePortSaintLucie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the best hotel that I have ever stayed in. It was clean, comfortable and the staff bent over backwards to assist us in every need. I would recommend they bring the prices down a bit. It is expensive. The property was clean, food was great and the hotel was very safe. Rooms were modern and comfortable and the bathrooms were just gorgeous! I will definitely visit this property again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: sharon54Ohio
Reviews.Content: loved the resort and pool. The staff very nice and caring .If you need the beach this place is not for you. If you want to be walking distance to every thing this the place to be. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing, close to everything, on oceanfront, and has own pier of the best view of sunset.”
Reviews.Author: babyblue01
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent. Clean, knowledgable, and helpful staff. Close to everything within walking distance. However, we did rent 2 scooters which is across the street, to tour the whole island. Its next to Mallory Square, some rooms overlook the square.Our room was beautiful and luxurious. We had beautiful view of Duval street and the ocean. Loved the pool area and the treatment given there. Cushioned lounges, towel boy, frozen towel girl ( which is new to me), barkeeper kept my drinks flowing. Considering the location it was very quiet and relaxing. I would stay again if I get the chance to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: keywest22
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay at the Ocean Key Resort. This time I had one 2 free night and $100 resort credit on facebook. I was so excited I decided this time I wanted to pick what kind of room I wanted. On previous vists I just took what was the cheapest and always ended up with a upgrade or a super nice room. I love the pool so I wanted a room that over looked the pool. When we arrived my husband was a little shocked that it didnot over look the completely but near the other room and you had to go to the balconly and turn to see the pool. I didn't care, I loved the room. It was very clean and I loved the size of the bathroom. The bed was comfortable and it is nice to have a living room and patio with a balcony. We were on the 4th floor so it was convient to the pool and other areas. We had room service one night and they were promt and the food was great. On the last evening we had dinner at Hot Tin Roof and it was fantastic. I love this resort and the pool area. We hung out for hours almost everyday. The staff is friendly and helpful, bringing you drinks while you float around in the pool. I don't think I could stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “The very best of eveything Key West”
Reviews.Author: KalolaHartford_CT
Reviews.Content: This is the third time my husband and I have stayed at Ocean Key in the last 2 years, and it just gets better and better. We have been treated to an upgraded suite on each trip and this time was over the top. We were told this was the Presidential Suite, which we took with a grain of salt, but it was flat out beautiful. Top floor, ocean view plus Mallory Square. Big balcony, a beautiful sitting room and dining area. And 2 gorgeous bedrooms to choose from. The rooms are very tastefully decorated, the beds are comfortable, and the linens terrifically soft. We arrived quite late and unfortunately discovered that the air-conditioning wasn't working and they couldn't get it fixed that evening. It was inconvenient to have to move to another room for the night, but the staff couldn't have been nicer about it, and we were suitably compensated. Although I would have been quite happy to spend the entire week right in our room, we did also enjoy the beautiful pool with the comfy lounges and frozen towels to cool you off, the terrific Hot Tin Roof restaurant, and the Sunset Pier which is the always fun. I didn't embarrass myself by crying and gripping the front desk when it was time to leave, but it was close! WE WILL BE BACK!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best in the Keys”
Reviews.Author: SydneyJean15
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at Ocean Key and had a wonderful experience. It was our anniversary, and the staff went out of their way to make sure we enjoyed every moment from check-in to check-out. Our room was lovely and immaculate, the restaurant was great and you can't beat the pool cocktails! Thank you so much, Ocean Key - we will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “'KEY WEST' WHAT CAN I SAY”
Reviews.Author: Houseofcardsathome
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for location, could do with a full length mirror and more drawers in the room. Outside space not that big but they have made the best of it. Great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Beautiful & Clean”
Reviews.Author: trees-2011
Reviews.Content: Ocean Key Resort is a wonderful place that is not the cookie cutter 5 star resort like the big box names...Ocean key is a smaller 5 star private & and very clean resort. The location is great and has control on noise levels. Ocean Key's resturant the Hot Tin Roof, great location and the food is excellent........ Cathy & Mark - Colorado

Reviews.Title: “Great location & service!”
Reviews.Author: lovindislands
Reviews.Content: Although the price was a little higher than we typically pay, the hotel was extremely clean, the service was excellent & the location was perfect! We were able to walk nearly everywhere we wanted to go, without renting a scooter or anything. The pool was great, along with great poolside service including drinks! When we go back to Key West we will definitely stay at this resort again. The bed was very comfortable, despite a few reviews I read to the contrary. The air conditioning in the room did not keep up with the setting, but I'm sure this was due to the heat outside being somewhere in the 90's. I would highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel experience of my life!”
Reviews.Author: wanderluster65
Reviews.Content: Exceeded my expectations as far as the room! The staff was the friendliest staff I have ever encountered!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: sporttke
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 day stay at the Ocean Key Resort and had another great time. The staff is unbelievable. I don't believe there was one time when I walked by a staff member and they didn't ask about my day. The rooms are great and the views are unbelievable. The location of the resort is perfect for anybody who wants to be around nightlife and Mallory Square

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Beds”
Reviews.Author: ericljennings
Reviews.Content: The hotel claims to have new beds. However if they could be new it would be classed as the best bed ever made of stone. The place overall fit my needs except for the horrible bed. Please consider this fact before booking your room.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: hilliap
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ocean Keys Resorts based on location and reviews from Trip Advisor and other travel websites. Since we've never been to Key West before, it was a toss up between staying here or on the other end of Duval. Looks like we chose the right place! Our check in was easy and smooth. Our room was impressive: very clean, decorated, with a view of Duval street and the ocean to our left. The bathroom was large, and we loved the whirlpool tub with the view to our room and large windows. The bed was very comfortable. The free Wifi signal was strong in our room and by the pool (important for those of you Skyping/Facetime back home!) The pool area was great, and that was the first thing we did after we put on our suits. Jen and April were friendly and made great drinks. Cheyne was helpful and attentive. The pool area had nice padded lounges and the view was perfect. The cabanas were a nice touch. We were told upon check in that the hotel was full, yet there were plenty of spots to lay out. A very relaxing time. We did have some appetizers that were tasty and a late dinner at Hot Tin Roof that was very good (we sat at the bar and the bartender was great! Forgot his name but he was from Chicago). Check out was easy as well. Overall, they helped make our trip to Key West an unforgettable vacation!

Reviews.Title: “We love this place,,,,”
Reviews.Author: BetseyBrown
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in Key West a number of times. We find it the best place on the East Coast to chill for a few days and the weather early in the year suits us perfectly. Ocean Key is our favorite place to stay because of the comfort of the rooms, the balconies overlooking Mallory Square, and the location of the hotel. Everything is within walking distance or a short cab ride. We've found lots of restaurants that we like in the area including Hot Tin Roof. The decor at the hotel is spot-on for the area and for the ambience they want to convey. The staff are beyond great. They can't do enough.

Reviews.Title: “Speechless”
Reviews.Author: mambuishu
Reviews.Content: this was our third time in the keys and second time at this hotel. It always books up rather quickly and rightfully so. Staff is always friendly and enjoy working for this hotel. The parking is automatic valet, but with limited parking available its nice to know that your car is in a safe place with all the crazy yet entertaining drunks. View of mallory square with loud roosters that cannot tell time. If you are a light sleeper close the french doors (but you will miss out on the ocean breeze and beautiful view)

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: LesleyFrances
Reviews.Content: We just had our wedding at Ocean Key could not have been happier!!! Everything surrounding our event and trip both before, during and after our wedding was smooth and professional. Our contacts at Ocean Key were ABSOLUTELY AMAZING! Extremely helpful, responsive, organized, accommodating...everything you would want in people that you looked to for help and advice with your wedding, and more! The guidance they provided before the wedding made us very comfortable and feeling at ease that everything was in order for the big day. When we and our guests arrived at Ocean Key the service was fabulous. Not one guest had a single negative thing to say about the rooms or staff. Everyone raved about the location and how beautiful, modern and clean the rooms were. (You know there is always AT LEAST one complainer in a group...not a single one on this occasion, everyone was completely satisfied). The staff was helpful, very friendly/professional and knowledgeable. And last but not least, the location was awesome!! If you are in Key West 0 Duval Street is by far the best place to stay. When it came to the wedding, it could not have gone better! I cannot say enough great things about having our wedding at Ocean Key. The pier location was a gorgeous and intimate setting for our ceremony and reception! I think that using the recommended vendor list our hotel contacts provided was key in working with reliable and great vendors. Anytime I let them know what were were looking for in a DJ, photographer, etc they gave great advice. The food provided by Ocean Key was AWESOME and all of the Ocean Key staff that worked during our wedding was great. I would recommend Ocean Key to anyone that is looking to have a memorable, fun and beautiful wedding!

Reviews.Title: “Best location on the island”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkKayakgirl
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5-day stay at Ocean Key and were very pleased with our experience. The location is perfect, right on the water at the western side of the island yet just steps away from all the action on Duval Street. We had a one-bedroom oceanview suite overlooking Duval from which we could see the Gulf on the left and Front Street/Duval Street on the right. I would have preferred to be on the Mallory Square side to see the sunset, so be sure to ask when making your reservation. The rooms were very clean and spacious, and the whirlpool tub in the bathroom was huge! Hotel service was great, the maids leave a card every day so you can choose what time is best for them to service your room (when you're out instead of while you're sleeping in!). We enjoyed the pool almost every day, it's a perfect location to watch the sunset since it's a few steps up from the crowded walkway below where everyone gathers. Hot Tin Roof was tasty and reasonably priced for breakfast, even for room service. I thought the Sunset Pier was too pricey for the food and atmosphere; $80 for two drinks and dinner for two? But the music was good and the view is terrific. Overall, a great stay and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cool.”
Reviews.Author: steve247
Reviews.Content: Our only visits to Key West in the past were day long cruise ship visits. Old Town Key West is such a cool, laid back spot that we decided to come back for a longer visit. My wife picked out Ocean Key Resort from online sites including TA. We booked a junior ocean view room and received a nice upgrade at check in. The buildings were built in the 80's as a time share vacation spot and converted to the Ocean Key resort a decade or so later. The rooms are not your typical cookie cutter hotel type room, which I consider a positive. The rooms have a nice key west vibe. FYI, they do not have room safes but the front desk will safeguard your valuables in their safe. The location is perfect if you want to be close to everything. The service was very friendly and helpful. Their restaurant, Hot Tin Roof, serves breakfast and dinner daily. We ate breakfast there daily and dinner twice. The ambiance is great, especially dining outdoors along the railing. The food is very good although louie's backyard and la trattoria were our favorite meals during our visit. That's not to take anything away from Hot Tin Roof. The pool area is on the small side but we could always find a lounger. Drinks were easy to get. Overall, I would be happy to stay there again and woul recommend it. It is expensive but worth it in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot at the end of Duval Street”
Reviews.Author: sandlake1
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived until the day of departure, we found the entire staff to be just about the friendliest, most helpful and most accomodating of any we've come across. You had the feeling they were genuinely nice people, sincere in their effort to make you feel welcome - not just because it was their job. The location at the end of Duval Street is both close enough to the high energy nightlife, and yet far enough away for those who want to avoid it. Sunsets at the pier are spectacular, only a short walk to Mallory Square for the nightly sunset celebration. Ocean/Gulf view rooms are a must, but depending on location, views could be partially obscured by the massive cruise ships that visit Key West. I'm sure there are other great spots in Key West, but why bother looking. This place was just fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend away for us!”
Reviews.Author: Sprauge717
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ocean Key in April, 2011 and it was amazing. Exactly what my husband and I needed - some time away to relax. The service was great, everyone was very attentive. The rooms were gorgeous, we were looking right to the sunset. The location is great too because you have all the action on Duval Street and there were stree performers in the evenings at Mallory Square (perfect spot to watch the sunset). Great staym would absolutely go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous! A Must!”
Reviews.Author: Rozydozy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our 32nd Anniversary with a five day stay at Ocean Key Resort. No accommodation in Key West can come close to this spectacular setting, extremely congenial pool, housekeeping, front desk ,and restaurant staff. Upon arrival, we were ungraded to the Presidential Suite(champagne included) on the fifth floor....three balconies facing full views of the Gulf of Mexico. Suite was massive with two master bedrooms and baths,living and dining room. Decor is British colonial with many island touches. Hotel grounds are immaculate and every employee had a smile on his/her face. Resort is located on 0 Duval St.,next to Mallory Square and Sunset Pier. All shops ,boutiques,and restaurants are within walking distance. Dined at Hot Tin Roof our first evening. Our waiter,Louis, was fabulous...extremely knowledgeable of the menu, personable,humerous, and highly professional. Please do not hestitste to stay at this fabulous Key West gem. It would only enhance your memories of this special island.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorites”
Reviews.Author: tml1
Reviews.Content: This was our third or fourth time staying at the Ocean Key. Every time we leave we cannot wait to get back again. Although we throughly enjoyed our trip and stay we were a little disappointed in a couple of things. First, in the past, the food by the pool has been phenomenal. This time we felt the quality was not up to what it used to be. Second, was the room. The room itself was wonderful but, for the price you pay per night, the beds slept very poorly. We were expecting a higher quality mattress. We would both wake with backaches in the morning. In addition, the pillows on the bed were flat and not plush at all....once again, expected a little more luxury. Also, we would adjust the room temperature to be cooler when we were sleeping and after a certain point the thermostat would reset itself to a warmer setting. We would wake up every night, a few times, and have to readjust the thermostat down. Felt we should have been able to set the room temperature to what was comfortable for us. We still love the Ocean Key and would stay here for a fifth time! Just a little surprised at some differences we noticed from the past.

Reviews.Title: “We had a Great View,and a very beautiful Room with a comfortable bed!”
Reviews.Author: lisastar82
Reviews.Content: I think this Hotel had a great staff and was very professionally run. Everything was AWESOME! Thank You! Lisa Starace

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Staff”
Reviews.Author: KHorn
Reviews.Content: We were in Key West for a Mother/Daughter weekend and had a lovely time. Location of this hotel is perfect for a long weekend and is in the middle of all the "action". Would probably pick a B&B if traveling as a couple or one of the beach front hotels if traveling with kids. Hotel staff was knowledgable, friendly, and made you feel very welcomed. If you like to hang out by the pool and be waited on hand and foot by attentive staff; then this is the place for you! The pool bar staff made you feel like family and was a higlight of our stay. Everyday they hand out frozen hand towels to help you beat the heat - they were fantastic. We had a suite with a king bed and pull out couch. The suite was very spacious with plenty of closet space. Key West Restaurants: "Sarabeth's" is a must! This was a restaurant located on a quite street in an old house and the service was excellent. Must order the homemade tomato soup. "Santiago's Bodega" is a tappas restaurant that was delicious and we would highly recommend. Try the white wine sangria and the flaming cheese dish. "Blue Heaven" is a restaurant we stopped by.....the kitchen was closed so we didn't get to eat there, but the atmosphere was amazing. Worth stopping by at least for a drink. "BO's Fish Wagon" - a great place for lunch - known for their group sandwiches and I thought had the coldest beer in town. Atmosphere is one in a million. "Jack Flats" - this is a local hangout (sports bar). Fine to drink and watch NCAA basketball tournament, but not a place to have a nice meal. Overall, would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and enjoyable time at Ocean Key”
Reviews.Author: spritzcat
Reviews.Content: Decided on Key West for a 4 night get-a-way after a brutal Midwest winter and we were not disappointed at the Ocean Key resort. Great location and the hotel itself is fun, clean, and mostly great service. Our check in experience was our only complaint even tho was really our fault as we arrived early. We didnt expect to have to wait 31/2hrs to get to our room, tho. We liked the room, nice enough view and very spacious. The combo jetted tub/shower was a bit dicey for us older folks as you had to climb over the tub sides to get to the shower. Once in, the shower was heavenly. We loved the balcony, facing west made the morning comfortable watching Mallory sqaure, ocean, and passing boats. The pool was nice, although small as others have noted. Good drinks and service. Didnt like that people were allowed to start saving chairs early am when they were not even there until much later. Cruise ships came and went, one day had one right by Ocean Keys pool. A couple days there were none. We also had room 420 with the notorious tree that blocks the sunset view. It was not really a problem as we had many other opportunities to see the great sunsets ( Mallory square, cruise, Lattitudes) Enjoyed breakfast at Hot Tin Roof-very nice staff there. Front desk staff helpful is recommending places and helping with renting electric car. We really enjoyed a sunset sail on the Adriondeck III--only 12 of us and good winds-would really recommend this. We would return to the Ocean Key perhaps when the prices were lower. In future visits we would consider other places for a different perspective not for anything wrong with Ocean Key. The location is certainly a big plus. P.S Loved the roosters in the morning!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and view but expensive.”
Reviews.Author: Snakeroni
Reviews.Content: Great location, next to Mallory Square and the bars on Duval street. Great view of the sunset. The room itself was decent size, but given the price, I wasn't too impressed with the room itself.

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous hotel, great location, magnificent views”
Reviews.Author: mcbnj
Reviews.Content: After the long drive from Miami, the Ocean Key was a welcome sight. Our room was a spacious ocean view suite. The wall of french doors leading onto a double balcony gave a beautiful view of the bright blue water and magnificent sail boats. We could open the doors and enjoy the music coming up from the pier. The hotel is right in the thick of things on Duval which was great. I had considered Southernmost, but was glad we stayed here because there was more happening right outside the hotel. The hotel itself was peaceful, with a lot to do just outside your door. We went on a fun jetski tour that left from the hotel marina. We left for snorkeling a couple of blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location. Friendly staff. Will return.”
Reviews.Author: chipmunkler
Reviews.Content: The best location in town. So much to do with children. Lots of good restaurants nearby. Lovely pool with spectacular views. Shame breakfast so slow, but that is the only complaint. Great meals at Mangia Mangia and Bistro 245 nearby. Spectacular sunset views.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: uptownwino
Reviews.Content: Excellent location at 0 Duval St. Clean, crisp rooms, ocean breeze, very good coffee in the morning. Walk to the sunset celebration, stroll the pier and watch the shows, they are amazing. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Gret Location”
Reviews.Author: lstaggers
Reviews.Content: The Ocean Key Resort is right in the heart of the action in Key West. It is located next to a pier overlooking the ocean and great viewing for sunsets. Everything is in walking distance from the hotel although scooters and bike rental places are everywhere. Couldnt get into the indoor restaurant because it was booked, but you can order room service from the restaurant and the pier has a nice menu too which can be billed to your room. The pool area is nice and you can order drinks and food from the bar. I recommend the rum runner! The food items on the pier menu and at the pool are cheaper than the indoor restaurant. The room was clean with a large bathroom a separate shower (w jet tub) and we had a balcony ocean view room which I recommend. Overall, had a good time.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: candychi
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Ocean Key Resort. The room was nice and spacious. The service was friendly and we really enjoyed our time by the pool. As the pool isn't very big, there were not a lot of children, which was nice. It was a chill atmosphere and the servers at the bar were great about checking in and getting us drinks. It was a very nice stay. Our room was facing Mallory Square which was fine. It was noisy in the square but it was quiet when the door was closed. No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place for a Little Break”
Reviews.Author: lksium19
Reviews.Content: I found Ocean Key Resort by accident when signing up for a boutique hotel rewards club called Stash Rewards. Ocean Key displayed prominently on one of the main pages of the site and I just had to click to see more. My husband loves Key West. We visited about 4 years ago for about a day and it didn't leave a good taste in my mouth. When I saw how nice Ocean Key was, I knew that for his birthday I would give him a surprise weekend trip there and we would stay at Ocean Key. We live in Orlando and took the one-hour flight down to save us some time and arrived at the resort which is literally situated right at the end of Duval Street. It was a perfect location for being close to the water as well as the excitement of the nightlife. The resort is so charming the way it is laid out with tropical and quirky, yet not tacky accents. We had a partial view of the water and if staying there again, would get a water view room because as the sun sets, it is a very beautiful sight! We had a couples massage while we were there and I must say, that my therapist listened to what I wanted and gave me a massage that left me feeling like jelly. My only complaint about that experience is the noise. We had our massage late in the afternoon.... probably around the time of normal check in I would assume, because someone was either checking in or something was being cleaned in the room above the massage room we were in because I constantly heard chairs being scraped across the tile floor. It was very distracting to say the least. On top of that it was right around the time I assume some kind of pirate reenactment was happening because cannons were constantly being fired. This was also very distracting. While I know the hotel can't dictate the noise of such events, it probably would have been nice to be told that, that event was taking place and that it might interrupt the experience and we probably would have chosen a different time to enjoy our massages. It was pretty chilly in December, as a cold front came in, but the hot tub was hot and the pool wasn't that bad. The bar at the pool was nice and made some very good pina coladas! The room was very nicely decorated, but the large Jacuzzi tub was a bit dated and took a loooooooooong time to fill up, so it wasn't even worth waiting for. The bed was probably my least favorite part of the trip as it wasn't very comfortable in my opinion, although my husband found no qualms with it. There was even a kitchen in the room, which was nice because we were able to go by beers and drinks to keep on hand when we didn't want to leave the room. There are several "add-ons" that you can get to the room package and one that I had originally signed up for, yet thought I had cancelled, was "make your own mojitos". The tray was left in our room, because we were not there and I was not expecting it. Neither of us knew how to make mojitos, I would have thought the person brining the ingredients to you would maybe possibly show you how, but since we weren't there I wouldn't know. It cost $40 and wasn't worth the money for me as none of the ones we tried to make really tasted anything like a mojito, so that was a bit disappointing. Overall, we had a great time on our 2-night stay and would recommend this resort to anyone looking for a prime spot in Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Would not consider staying anywhere else in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: pporteus
Reviews.Content: To escape the hustle and bustle of Duval Street - don't even consider staying anywhere else!! Fabulous location, clean and extremely friendly staff. Location, location, location!!

Reviews.Title: “Total gamble- not worth the price we paid”
Reviews.Author: hboyd4004
Reviews.Content: I am kind of heart broken because I really wanted to love this hotel. We stayed there 3/12-3/16 and basically everything was an ordeal. I booked a junior partial ocean view suite through the hotel's website for a romantic vacation with my boyfriend for his birthday. The room averaged about $480/night but it also happened to be Spring Break week down there so I understand everything was ridiculously expensive. I wanted a room that looked like THE picture on the website- the bathtub in the room overlooking the ocean. I started to worry that the room I booked was not the one in the pic so I called the hotel and was informed that the one bedroom suites had the bathtub in the bedroom and, even though they were booked solid, for an extra $50/night they would rearrange everyone to accommodate me. I was so excited! Got down there and low-and-behold, there was no bathtub in the room. I explained my issue at the front desk and was informed that they could not move me until 2 days into my stay, at which point they put me in what I believe was the junior suite with the partial ocean view- the same room I originally booked. The man at the front desk was very apologetic and even sent up champagne and chocolate covered strawberries, which I appreciated, but when we checked out, they charged me all days for the one bedroom suite. I explained the situation to the front desk woman and she agreed to adjust the price for only the days that we weren't in the one bedroom suite but refused for the nights that we stayed in the room... The same room I had specifically stated I did not want. By this point I was so tired of arguing and didn't want my boyfriend to think I was a cheep spoiled brat so I just let it go but I won't stay there again. My advice is if you happen to get the hotel at a bargain in the off season when, if they trick you into paying more for a room you don't want, you have plenty of options for room changes, go for it. It is in a great location. However, if it is one of those situations where you want everything to be perfect, this is not the place to gamble with $500/night. In addition, they lost my reservations to Tin Roof and, when I had explained that I had requested a table weeks before with an ocean view for a very special birthday celebration, they put us on the patio basically overlooking the bushes. Only one of us could see the ocean and enjoy the sunset. Just one thing after another. For the price, I really expected to be wowed and it was nothing but disappointment every time they were supposed to come through.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and upgraded room”
Reviews.Author: JenniferLynn
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our two night stay at the Ocean Key, and the location cannot be beat. It's right on the edge of Mallory Square and on Duval Street. We were easily able to walk everywhere. We were supposed to have an island view junior suite but somehow ended up with a two bedroom, two bath suite for just my husband and I. I don't know how, and we certainly didn't complain! Our balcony alone was the size of a normal hotel room! While we had plenty of space, I will admit that there are some things in the room that could be upgraded a little. The master bathroom for one is extremely small and consists of a rather large shower and a toilet, but it's extremely close fitting. The staff was okay - nothing about them was overly friendly, nor were they unpleasant. The pool was rather small and I wish there were more chairs. There was a convention going on when we were there last week and it was difficult to get two chairs. The drinks from the pool bar were also very weak - especially given that they were ~$10. The only downfall of our stay there was that on the last night of our stay they had a concert on the Pier - a band named Badfish played from 9 to 11:30. It was extremely loud and they rehearsed all afternoon, and when you have a clear view of the stage, it's extremely loud in the room - even with all the windows closed. I was just a little surprised that Ocean Key (what I consider an upscale hotel) would book a band that was more so a 'Spring Break' band that catered to a younger crowd. I had booked this hotel originally b/c I did not think that we would have any 'Spring Breakers' staying there. Fortunately for us, the band stopped playing by 11:30. Overall - the Ocean Key is a good hotel and if the price was right, I would definitely stay there again if I was in the area.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL - will definitely be back! Service and room was phenomenal!”
Reviews.Author: pamelakhb
Reviews.Content: Brought my daughters and friend for Spring Break. ALL the staff were amazing, cannot beat the location, the view and the room! Incredible stay for us - one that will leave a memory for quite some time to come - THANK YOU SO MUCH!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, relaxing and enjoyable vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: iggy0808
Reviews.Content: Hot Tin Roof restaurant staff....great!! Everyone made us feel at home...food awesome!! And we are from New Orleans...so we are used to great food....Cudos to the chefs. Hotel a bit pricey but thouroughly enjoyed our stay!!!! We definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Best Sunset Location!”
Reviews.Author: Ptourist
Reviews.Content: If you are into sunsets, while sipping a cool drink with some island music - this would be the ticket. Right at 0 Duval street - Mallory square and lots of shopping and restraunts within walking distance. We felt like we were in the center of everything but secluded resort all at the same time. We parked the car and walked to everything. The hotel staff was wonderful. The pool is small but it is right on the water and can see all the boats go by while taking a dip. Sunset pier is an awsome place if you want to skip the crowds at Mallory square and have a seat at an unbrella table with bar service. We really like the rooms on Duval street--you can see the street and partial view of the water.

Reviews.Title: “This is a winner”
Reviews.Author: Reklaw252
Reviews.Content: We booked in for one night and were so impressed that we stayed for two. We would have stayed longer but had to return home. The staff were outstanding. The room was great. The location is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: KeyWestSuns
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an Ocean view suite with a balcony. The room itself was amazing and very tastefully decorated. Love the spa tub! It was the best place to watch all of the activity in Mallory Square and the beautiful sunsets. Very relaxing and so easy to walk everywhere we wanted to go. This is my new favorite place to stay in Key West. Couldn't ask for anything better!

Reviews.Title: “I beg my company to let me stay elsewhere. Not a good place.”
Reviews.Author: DebPlunket
Reviews.Content: I travel to Key West several times a year for business and am lucky enough to be allowed to bring my partner. Ocean Key is not Gay Friendly at all. We were looked down upon even though I spent over $600 a night for 5 nights. Very loud atmosphere, employees smoking by the restroom. 10% of the staff at best speaks English and I don't speak Czech or Russian. Gift shop was well stocked and pretty but the worker smelled of alcohol. If I wanted an Econolodge experience I'd stay at The Econolodge and pay Econolodge prices. This was Econolodge service at Ritz Carlton prices. Trash and cigarette butts all over the common grounds, homeless people drinking in the parking area, little to no security, loud non-English speaking people, minimal amenities, loud rock & roll in the dining areas and rude service is not what I expect from The Noble House Collection. I guess every family has to have a red headed step child. I went to the front desk to complain but I ran into a brick wall with that rude Mexican dressed like a Mob Man wearing loud colors.

Reviews.Title: “Box seats for sunset celebration”
Reviews.Author: singaporemarsha
Reviews.Content: First trip to Key West, and we were smitten . . . Ocean Key resort is perfectly located at the end of Duval on the sunset side of the island. If you're in the Mallory bldg, almost all of the balconies would be considered "box seats" for the sunset celebration that takes place to the side and in front of the hotel with bands, busker-type street performers, etc. Highly recommend this hotel for first trip to KW . . . a little pricey, but worth it. Not sure how you can find out when the cruise ships come in though. The first ship that comes in parks in front of the KW Westin and blocks the view of the sunset. If there's a second ship, it parks near Ocean Key, but the one that came during our stay departed before sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Second Honeymoon, enjoyed every second!”
Reviews.Author: bc7981
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had not taken any more than a night or two without family over ther last 29 years. This experience at the Ocean Key was more then I could have dreamed. I cried when we reached our suite with a outstanding deck and view overlooking Sunset Pier. The two conceiges we worked with were out standing. We fished, jet skiied, took the sunset sail and wine tasting, ate great food off the beaten track. We always enjoy dining with the local recommendations rather then with the tourist.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!”
Reviews.Author: pump1013
Reviews.Content: Ocean Key is the place to stay in Key West. Right on the Gulf coast, next to Mallory Square and right on Duval St. It is perfect because it is walking distance from the major hot spots on Duval St. CVS is right next door which is so great for anything you need. The rooms at Ocean Key are very nice. The bed and pillows are so comfortable, I even asked them what kind of mattress it was bc it was so comfortable. The big bathtub is perfect for TWO! The staff is so nice. The pool area is very upscale looking with a bar and very comfortable lounge chairs. Its very nice to have a bar at night on the pier. The food is AMAZING!!! Room service is the way to go. Private dining on your balcony with great prices. Ocean Key does not jack up the prices for the in room dining experience which was great. We loved every minute of the time we spent here. When we go back, yes thanks to our experience we will be back, we will not even consider another place as Ocean Key is #1 on our list!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay while in Key West”
Reviews.Author: ken5353
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at some fabulous hotels, but when I am in Key West this is the only place for me. The staff here is the warmest and friendliest I have ever experienced and there isn't a better place to watch the sunset in Key West. Well done! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “COMING BACK”
Reviews.Author: Arlingtons
Reviews.Content: Well, I booked this hotel through Expedia and wasnt sure what I was going to end up with but I have to tell you --- BEST PLACE TO STAY HANDS DOWN! We absolutely loved our stay there. Everyone was kind and accomodating - we didn't want to ever come home!!!! Perfect location for the sunset (unless it's Monday and the cruise ships are in) but still lovely lovely lovely. Hot Tin Roof is pricy but the food was fabulous! If you want to feel special and pampered -- stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Man this place is fabulous”
Reviews.Author: NorcomGreyhounds
Reviews.Content: When it comes to selecting travel accomodations I am super cautious and therefore spend way too much time researching before making a decision. In this case I am glad I researched because this place is fabulous. My wife and I stayed Suite 217. Here is my list of things that made the Ocean Key a winner for me, in no particular order...spacious rooms, clean, big bathtub / jacuzzi that I could fit in (6'-1" 245) and relax, spectacular sunset, kings size bed with soft pillows, beautifully decorated rooms, huge bathroom, huge shower big enough for me and my honey, great room service (they set up our breakfast on our private deck), great location at the end of Duval (close to all the fun but without all the noise), friendly / professional staff. There were a few more things like the Museum and Butterfly Conservatory.Overall, I recommend highly and can't wait to go again. GUYS, I EARNED HUGE BROWNIE POINTS WITH THE WIFE.

Reviews.Title: “Great loction but---”
Reviews.Author: 09Raleigh
Reviews.Content: Great location. Give valet the car (no choice) and walk to most sights and tours. The Jr. Suite with king bed and partial water view was big. Had terrace. Could see the water and the town. But: 1. Sinks were a few feet away and in sight of the bed. No privacy nor sound containment. This might be a little "European" but is not a comfortable set-up. 2. Toilet in small area enclosed by louvered door. Does not contain noise. 3. Don't know where the car was parked by the valet for 19 hours ($20/day). Was told it would be under cover. Might have been but got covered with dirt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot. So So Service.”
Reviews.Author: Coal110
Reviews.Content: Ocean Key Resort is in the best spot on Key West. From there you can stumble back from Captain Tony's, Sloppy Joes, etc. The facility is getting a bit aged but updated have been occurring. The staff, for the most part, was very sub par. They all seemed to be pissed that they had to work that day. Maybe it is the typical resort town mentality.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait To Go Back”
Reviews.Author: jamstl
Reviews.Content: Did a lot of research for our first trip to Key West and am very happy to say we made the right decision. Ocean Key is fabulous in every way. Close enough to all the action, yet private enough to get away from it as well. Service was exceptional and the pool was great despite not being very large. Spring for the oceanfront rooms. You won't be sorry, and you'll forget there is no beach. Summer visit was great as the area is not crowded and the environment not as crazy as in the winter months. Counting the days until we get back there. But PLEASE put ice machines on every floor.

Reviews.Title: “The right choice!”
Reviews.Author: TLGAS
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Key West. We looked at a lot of hotels here on Trip Advisor and picked Ocean Key,and glad we did! Great location, fantastic sun sets, great service, very nice rooms we could not have choosen a nicer place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KateR1981
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I and two of our friends stayed here in May 2010. I've never written a Trip Advisor review before but as the four of us religiously scroll through the reviews before deciding upon which hotel to book for our holidays I thought I should help others make their decision. Although we did contemplate keeping it our little secret!! Our trip started in Miami where we spent a couple of boozy evenings. We then drove down to the The Keys for the bulk of the holiday. We initially decided to stay at The Casa Marina Hotel which is part of The Waldorf Astoria group. We were a little worried about some reports we had read that discussed a cruise ship being docked near the pool at The Ocean Key (totally not the case!!!!!) so we didn't initially choose it. As soon as we arrived at Casa Marina things weren't as we expected. It was a very bland hotel with no real character. The rooms were very average and the pool area was poorly laid out with cheap plastic sun loungers. The plus point was the lovely beach and I can see how if you had children this would be really good for them. We also had a nice lunch by the pool. We had booked everything independently so drove up to see The Ocean Key on our mopeds and the following day checked straight in. The Ocean Key was fantastic...... LOCATION The location of the hotel was superb, right at the end of Duval Street where all the bars and restaurants are located. This meant we could take a simple stroll in the evening or whizz to wherever we were going on our mopeds. If you can hire mopeds whilst you're there definitely go for it. They came in really handy and were great fun. ROOM We went for a deluxe oceanfront room and it was spectacular! Really roomy, loads of Florida Keys character, lovely terrace and a huge bath. POOL Fabulous! The pool itself isn't huge but we much preferred it to The Casa Marina. The whole pool area was infinitely more luxurious. Fantastic sea view, white wooden loungers and a great pool bar. SERVICE The service was first class and the staff were very attentive. The service around the pool was particularly outstanding. The pool girl (whose name I annoyingly now can't remember) couldn't do enough for you and she constantly came round to serve us complimentary water and provide us with cold towels. On checkout I actually got wrongly charged by the hotel however they dealt with it in the right way. They got the hotel manager involved, returned the money and discounted my stay and offered me reduced rates for my next trip - cannot wait!!! RECOMMENDATIONS Whilst we were at Ocean Key we went to some great restaurants along Duval Street. Two noteable experiences were breakfast at Pepe's Cafe and dinner at 915. Get yourself to Mallory Square to see the gorgeous sunsets. The boys would recommend taking some jet skis out - they had a great time! Finally I'd recommend if you can do it hire a boat for the day. We did this and it was a fab day out - take the sun cream though!!! Hope this helps - have a fabulous time in Key West! x

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot to see and do all of Key West”
Reviews.Author: staceyvols
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ocean Key for a birthday weekend. We did use points so the value was great for us. Our room would have cost $550 and I would not have done that. But it was worth every point! You just can't beat the location. We had a ocean view/Mallory Square view with a sitting area. The view was perfect. Cruise ships did come and go but only one day did a ship actually block our view, there were 3 in that day. The hotel is right at the heart of the tourist area, 1 1/2 miles to Southern Most Point, nice walk. Service was great. Front desk very helpful. We got room service the last morning. It was good and not too over priced, but it was room service so maybe a little. But they bring it in and completely set it up, not just set the tray. On the counter. Huge jetted tub on the room was great. I was worried about the roosters, but for us, I could only hear them when awake, they didn't wake me up. I loved this hotel, completely lived up to my expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Everything I expected and more!”
