Reviews.Author: mep413
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my trip to Ocean Key Resort. I had a free upgrade I received just for signing up for an email. I travelled for Spring Break with just my mom and we were looking for a relaxing get away. We got exactly that. We had some issues with our flight and could not make it the night we were supposed to check in. I called frantic hoping we wouldn't lose our room, they were very accomadating and did not charge us for the night we were not there. When we did get there they took our luggage and upgraded our room for us. My mom and I had a HUGE! room. It overlooked the water and the street. We had a giant bed to ourselves and an extra sitting room and large bathroom. The ladies in the spa were very nice and when I got burned from sitting out by the pool they gave me all sorts of lotions to help my poor skin. The people at the bar by the pool were very good too. They came around taking orders and refilling drinks all the time and on our last day the lady working the bar was very friendly and made me feel comfortable. Over all our trip went really well, the only downfall I would say would be my dad sent us some flowers and assortments while we were there and they did not arrive in our room when they were supposed to. The platters were different than my dad had ordered but that wasn't a major issue. Also I would not recomend going to Key West in general if you are not over 21. A lot of things shut down after 9 which was fine because we just went to bed but there was only a lot of shopping to be done and of course the pool and the deck. I really enjoyed our trip and I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your credit card!!”
Reviews.Author: becsinthepeaks
Reviews.Content: I dont normally write reviews but felt compelled to after reading all the good reviews about this hotel on this website. We stayed in April, a few months ago now I know, but the fact this is still on my mind ought to tell you something! We stayed for a week so upgraded to a deluxe room with a sea view - I have attched photos to show our 'sea view'. Also, just below our room was the staff smoking area so if we did want to sit out on the balcony we got the smell of smoke drifting up and surly staff looking at us. We complained but no other rooms were available so we had to wait a couple of days to be moved two floors up, We were told our bags would be taken up to our room but when we returned later in the day we past the room to find the door wide open and our bags still sat there so took them ourselves - nobody asked any questions, good job they were our bags! The first room itself was OK, could have been cleaner and we found an empty rum bottle in the cupboard, the biggest problem was the mechanics for the lift were right outside our room so we didnt get a wink of sleep as that was all we could hear all night long. When we moved it was obvious that this room was used a last resort as our new room was much more worn although thankfully you couldnt hear the lift. My biggest problem with this hotel is on checkout, the receptionist tried to charge me over $1000 for the room upgrade. I told her we had already paid this and she quickly refunded my card, however, when i received my next credit card statement the money had been taken again! I had to phone the hotel and get it refunded on my card again which it was but this still cost me money as my bank charges for foreign transactions. Not at all impressed with this hotel and certainly not the 'paradise' they try to make it out to be! Not worth the hefty price tag and will not be staying here on my next visit to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “So glad we chose Ocean Key!”
Reviews.Author: itssnowtime
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying in Key West and we loved this hotel! We traveled with our college age sons & girlfriend the week before Christmas. The location for us was excellent and the hotel staff extremely helpful and courteous. The "kids" could go off on their own as everything they wanted to do was within walking distance. We had two rooms next to each other on the 4th floor that were clean and spacious and overlooked Mallory Square. The first night we watched the sunset at the Square as there was a cruise ship outside our rooms and for the experience, but it was gone the next day and we were able to view the sunset the next 2 nights from our balcony with beers bought from the CVS across the street. The downside, as mentioned by others, is the wake up calls of the roosters at odd hours in the a.m. (I thought they wake up with the sun?) But that's our only complaint and certainly not anything that can be prevented by hotel management. Oh, and the sofabeds weren't that comfortable (as is usually the case) and in one room was broken, but the king beds were very comfortable. Loved the Sunset Pier....waitress we had was friendly and quick. We did jet ski tours right outside the hotel which were a lot of fun and it was great to be able to take our wet selves straight into our hotel rooms for showers or the heated hotel pool. Great experience was had by all of us and we would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Great staff. Great location”
Reviews.Author: wnitz
Reviews.Content: Overall this was a great choice of a hotel. The rooms were clean and large with a great view and balcony, staff was very helpful and welcoming, and the Spa was great. The only recommendation I would make is to make sure you have a white noise machine since the roosters on the island are up early making a lot of noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for exploring Key West”
Reviews.Author: BostonMAC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in between Christmas and New Year's last year (knowing from previous experience that we did not want to be in Key West for new Year's itself!). Overall it's a good spot. We took the ferry to KW from Fort Meyers, so did not have to worry about a car; it was about a 15 min walk from the ferry port to the hotel. Here is what we liked: - Great location right on the pier, with beautiful views of the famous Key West sunset, away from the noise of Duval street - Nice pool area with bar - Very cool outdoor bar on the docks - Comfortable, beachy rooms Here is what could have used improvement: - Front row seat for all the cruise ships docked at the pier - Pool area was very small so we found it hard to find chairs unless we were down early - Pool area gets very crowded during sunset

Reviews.Title: “Don't pass this place up!”
Reviews.Author: Daab7
Reviews.Content: Recently helped plan a wedding that was held at the Ocean Key Resort. The Wedding was supposed to be held at a larger Chain hotel but the Bride and Groom received such poor service that they moved the location. They were lucky enough to meet Stephanie Happ the Catering Director or handled every detail of the event. She was incredible to work with due to her fast replies and her wealth of information. From the minute our group hit the hotel we were treated royally. The food was amazing but was beat by the service. The rooms were large and very clean. Every part of the stay exceeded expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: Orange424
Reviews.Content: Outstanding service, gorgeous property, perfectly located. We felt like a King and Queen for a week, we felt waited on hand and foot, all our requests were met flawlessly. It's evident the staff has a lot of pride in their property! We are already looking forward to our next visit back! We are hard people to impress and we were simply blown away by our stay. The spa was also fantastic, the facial and massage I had was the perfect compliment to our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: megfoesch
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here two nights on our honeymoon. It was amazing! The room was so nice and the view was breathtaking!! The servie was excellent and took care of everything for us. The pool area was very nice and service there was just as good. The location is perfect too! We had an awesome time and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but a great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: stanton0918
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on an anniversary trip. The room was beautiful, the decor made us feel like we were in a tropical paradise. The view from the balcony was breathtaking. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful with anything we needed or wanted. We ordered room service from Hot Tin Roof one night and it was great (for room service food ). The wait staff at The Pier was great too, our glasses were never empty. The only thing I would have changed was perhaps the time of year we visited. There happened to be a biker poker run/rally the last few days we were there. I will know to look at the events calendar for Key West before we book another trip, but I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Key to the rescue!”
Reviews.Author: kgerickson
Reviews.Content: Four moms traveling from the Northeast for a long-awaited and much needed break arrived at our private rental and found it completely unsuitable for five nights... We immediately went "hotel shopping" and wandered into Ocean Key Resort's lobby. Upon hearing our story the woman working the front desk managed to find a last minute suite for us that suited us perfectly - and, at a price we could manage to report to our husbands taking care of the children back home :) She was wonderful - as was the very friendly porter who showed us our room. The service we received, the comfort of the room, the view, the spa and the location made us feel like pampered women instead of simply moms on a break. We LOVED it! Special thanks to Nic & Jennifer, the bartenders at the "Liquid Lounge" pool area where we spent most of our days. They really knew how to take care of us. We plan to return with our husbands at some point!!

Reviews.Title: “Very NIce hotel at a price”
Reviews.Author: STRATH11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and on booking in were hit with a $20 per night Valet parking!! There was no other alternative due to the location of the hotel. The hotel staff were really nice and always helpfull. There was no Internet access if you did not have a laptop, if this is the case go to the library nearby for 30 mins free usage We spent a couple of hours at the pool / large hot tub outside in the afternoon. However it appeared the old habit of putting an item of clothing onto a sunbed in the morning claimed that bed for the day, even if it was never used. However the pool staff did their best to stop this and there were always beds free. Poolside staff were always attentive and if you wanted a drink / food you only had to catch their eye and they would be over, it was the guests that were the problem. Our room had a balcony and the bathroom had a jakuzzi tub. Lots to do in key west and this hotel did mean you did not need a car for your duration here. It was right at the end of Duval street so you were located at the best place for Key West In summary a very nice hotel, however with other hotels nearby offering free parking there are other options going

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend Ocean Key Resort”
Reviews.Author: PaulaBelfast
Reviews.Content: We so enjoyed our stay at Ocean Key Resort - a great experience. The hotel is situated in a perfect location for a stay in Key West. Duval Street and Mallory Square are on your doorstep. The staff are very friendly. The hotel is quite quirky - very much a part of its charm. Our room was very big overlooking Mallory Square. There was a kingsize bed and a big living area. The bathroom was small but more than adequate although we did have a bit of an ant problem but it did not ruin our stay. The furnishings were New England beach meets Florida beach. We had breakfast in the hotel one morning and again I would highly recommend the experience. The pool area was lovely, and we enjoyed many cocktails sitting on the hotel's sunset pier. Would I stay again - yes definitely! We also loved Key West a fabulous place to holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel, Spectacular Service”
Reviews.Author: houndsbury
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a few days at Ocean Key Resort for our combined birthday celebration. From check in to check out we could not have been treated better. On check-in we were upgraded to a Ocean View Boutique Room with oversixed jacuzzi tub and rainshower that opened to a view of the ocean. The bed was fantastic as well as the lovely sitting area and flat screen TV. Our view from the balcony over looked the Sunset Pier where we were treated to nightly concerts and balcony dancing. The staff accepted a surprise cake that was delivered from a local bakery and had it stored in their hotels main refridge until we arrived from our day of sightseeing. They also went out of their way to make sure we had plates and forks to indulge ! The food at the resort was amazing, the chef has a superior sense of preparation and presentation not to mention an unbelievable sense of imagination ! You have got to try the HOT TIN TOAST ! I have been to many "luxury spas" but this is one that surpasses all others. This will go down as a wonderful birthday memory and trip and we have already began planning a trip back to our same room in a few months. Thank you Ocean Key Staff, you are definitely exceptional people in a spectacular setting ! We promise to see you soon !

Reviews.Title: “Treated like dirt at check in and it only got worse”
Reviews.Author: DebPlunket
Reviews.Content: My partner and I arrived to find they had us in the wrong room even though we paid $200 more to have the ocean front room. The front desk clerk was about the only person who treated us nicely. She got her boss to come see about getting us into the room we paid for. A very aggressively rude Mexican man came over and had the charm of Hitler. He rudely told us there was nothing he could do. We were stuck with the room looking down on the parking lot. I think his tie was cutting the oxygen to his brain. We get to our room and wait over 30 minutes for our luggage. I asked the bellhop if he could send up extra pillows and he said yes as he was sticking his hand out waiting for money. I tipped him and he left. Our pillows arrived an hour later delivered by a woman who spoke no English just like half the staff. How many of them do you think are illegal? I have called ICE to comment too. The room was Econolodge Quality at Four Seasons prices with loud colors and nasty de core. There was trash all over the parking lot walking to the pier lounge. One nice thing I must say is the pool area was beautiful and the sunset bar was fun. The location is perfect. The fine dining restaurant was slow, expensive and very poor quality. The hotel was very understaffed. I saw far more homeless men around than staff. The last night was the topper of it all. We came back from a night out and stopped in the front lobby to use the bathroom. A homeless man was taking a bath in the ladies room. I told the desk clerk about it and he didn't seem to care. I will never return there and suggest you don't either.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel070801
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location in Key West. It is a beautiful property with an even more beautiful pool area overlooking the water. The rooms were absolutely gorgeous and the bathroom was amazing. All of the staff was helpful and extremely nice, breakfast on the balcony couldn't be beat. Loved every second of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “can't wait to back again”
Reviews.Author: pmoscow
Reviews.Content: Older hotel but very clean. Staff was great, could not ask for nicer people. We loved the frozen towels at the pool. We will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great room & Great food”
Reviews.Author: ilynk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ocean Key for my husbands 50th birthday. We booked the Presidential Suite which was beautiful. It had two bedrooms with real nice bathrooms. It had an amazing view and big balcony with great loungers. The AC did not work well and they immediately came to service it. The one bad thing is that the sun beats on the master bedroom windows and makes it hot. They came and fixed what they could and it did get better. At least we could sleep well and kids room was perfect. Pierre was a great service person who fixed it as best he could. He also got us a credit for one night which helped tremendously considering the room was pricey. Our boys are 10 and 12. They loved the location. Easy to get to Duval and A&B lobster area. The room service food was incredible. They made your table with white linens and you felt like royalty. The pier area was awesome and the live music was great. The pool was great. Our kids like to run around and be kids. The people in the pool were relaxed and the bar service at the pool was great. Their linens are fresh smelling and clean. The bathrooms are marble and nice. High ceiling rooms and just a great location. I loved the hotel, the people were friendly. Would stay there again but would make sure they added another AC unit to that suite. I believe they mentioned They were going to do that... Also did the glass bottom tour which was great for the kids. Great time. Can't go wrong with Ocean Key in the best location Key West has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “are you kidding me”
Reviews.Author: picky35
Reviews.Content: This was probably one of the worst hotels to stay in when in Key West. Travel to Key West 2-3 times per year, wanted to try something new. HUGE mistake. Rooms are outdated and dirty. The bathroom was dirty as well as black marks on the balcony. This is not a luxury resort. The only good fact was the staff was friendly but the hotel is way understaffed. Will not stay hear again. Oh, if you ever have a complaint with them good luck trying to reach them. They do not have a dedicated customer service department.

Reviews.Title: “Great place time after time!”
Reviews.Author: travelgirlKW
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Aug 17-20th and had a fabulous time! We travelled with out two kids who were there for the first time in awhile. The staff was more than accomodating, Upon arrival, they did not have our reserved room ready so we were given an upgrade so that we could get settled - nice touch after travelling all day. Our room overlooked the Pier and the band in the evening. Lovely view of sunset and great entertainment. The staff remembered everything about us from day to day and no needs were left unmet! The room was well kept for us in a timely manner each day - with lovely added touches like the towells being made into shapes etc - which our kids loved.... We ate downstairs two of the mornings for breakfast. It was good.... can't beat the views. We went to the pool one day in the evening for about an hour. However, it was alot of adults hanging out just trying to relax - we didn't want to disturb them with splashing etc from the kids. So we spent the rest of the days over at Ft. Zach's beach - had a great time. As always - top notch accomodations!

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Key West and very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: L0veCr0atia
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and the hotel was comfortable and we enjoyed staying there, especially since the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but expensive”
Reviews.Author: mcsunshine
Reviews.Content: First time in KW, and read all the Trip Advisor reviews before hand. The comments are consistent. What I liked - the room was very nice. First class towels, bed, soaps/shampoo, decor, etc..... pool area is very cosmo chic - overlooking the water is really great. Breakfast at Hot Tin was nice - food was good and view is great. Loved that we had our choice of Pier bar, pool bar, dining bar, all with food. Even had room service one afternoon. What I didn't like - I reserved (and paid for) an ocean FRONT room. Check out the rates - they are expensive. Now, to start, there is water everywhere - but off my balcony was the pool area and to the right side was a white roof from the restaurant. Not what I would consider ocean FRONT, especially for the price. After a day, I did go down to the desk and asked what they could do considering my rate and the view was not inline with my expectations - they gave me a $100 credit. Not that thrilled. The only thing that helped me justify the rate was during the month of August, the special was a $300 credit toward all incidentals. Which we used gladly. Another thing that I didn't like overall was the service. It was hit or miss everywhere. Also, I don't think there was a conceirge that could actually recommend something that was "good". Seems like they just recommend what they are paid to recommend. I sum it up as - the hotel is very nice with lots of options if you want to hang out there. Location is nice and close to everything. However, the hotel's hospitality does not match the rates they charge.

Reviews.Title: “could not have choosen better”
Reviews.Author: cedco
Reviews.Content: 50th Birthday trip...location just fabulous. swift check in on arrival and taken to room..512..requested high floor and this was much more than we had anticipated... top floor, opened doors to look down on sunset pier and small "annex" of key west harbour with balcony view to die for. stayed 4 nights..ate on balcony each evening watching sunset and listening to entertainment on the pier--one of the most fabulous things we have ever done! mallory square just around the corner. hotel pool and sunset pier excellent . staff attentive in extreme...if hotel management read this we think we were lucky to have paul on room service the first 3 evenings..(please let him know!) I will never forget his face when he laid our balcony table to perfection. opened the wine ...and lifted the lids on our main course to reveal....another persons starters!! boy can he move!!! seriously it was unforgetable service. only slight blip during the stay was that on checking out i was charged at a higher nightly rate than i had booked at (i booked on the hotel website) ..on questioning this while everything was polite i was glad that i had brought a printout of reservation details. i was surprised that my booking rate details did not seem easily accessable to the front desk. after being charged at the higher rate i was given a refund ..--no probs but only after that did i realise that i did not get the extra tax that i had paid back !. (am I nit picking?) That slight --and dealt with --hiccup notwithstanding I would say to anyone going to Key West....stay here.. or miss a bit!!

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Key is always a great stay”
Reviews.Author: wethiker
Reviews.Content: We had a two night stay August 8 & 9. Great access to the city of Key West. We have been here several times before and love the staff and location. Rooms are top notch and the resort is right next to the sunset celebration. Monday night, Hot Tin Roof, the indoor restaurant at the resort had a scallop on polenta to die for. Pool bar margaritas and mojitas got us ready for the "Duval crawl.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful”
Reviews.Author: minNewark
Reviews.Content: iv stayed in quite a few hotels on my travels but this was extra special from the car attendant who meets you as you arrive to the maids who see to your room every one was so friendly and genuine, we stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and wished we had booked for longer, there is so much to see in key west it suits all ages.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place in Key West”
Reviews.Author: satuaki
Reviews.Content: 14th anniversary for first timers to Key West. Stayed 4 nights. The location was absolutely perfect for hanging out on Duval St and right next to Mallory Square. The pool is so "chill". Only 3 cabanas so get there early. Hotel employee Hasting was the sweetest. She gave us frozen towels to cool off and great suggestions for restaurants and bars. Our room had a separate living room with a pull out bed and there was a jacuzzi in the bedroom. The shower was tiled w/ a nice shower. Checked in to room 227 w/ a view of parking for Mallory Square. We had an opportunity for an upgrade but we loved our room so much we stayed put. So romantic.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: lindsayandbryan
Reviews.Content: Ocean Key was a great hotel from the moment we made it to the end of Duval Street. The hotel is really in the perfect location for daytime activities as well as Key West's nightlife. The staff was attentive and super helpful. We ended up staying on the top floor, which was awesome because of the high ceilings and great view. We were able to see the ocean as well as Duval St. We went to one of the sunset celebrations the first night, and it was interesting. The street performers are a little crazy, but the sunsets from Mallory Square are just perfect. The restaurant Sunset Pier right next to the hotel also has a great spot to watch the sunsets. The food at the hotel was overall very good. It was expensive but they definitely gave you more than enough to eat. This was our first time ever to the Keys and this hotel made it so much better. Also, because you're at the end of Duval, there's really no need for transportation because everything is right there. We still rented a scooter to explore the quieter parts of the island. Overall, this hotel is definitely worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was exactly what I expected and more!!”
Reviews.Author: Shelley027
Reviews.Content: The rooms were picture perfect, staff was very, very friendly and helpful. Sean, Ali, Chris and all were very attentive. The cleaning staff, excellent as well. The room was beautifully appointed and the balcony overlooking the ocean, spectacular. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for relaxation, great service and comfort!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, everything else was average”
Reviews.Author: Yatesy77
Reviews.Content: It has a good location being right on the waters edge and on the main street, so is close to the shopping, marina and restaurants. The resort/hotel has a Caribbean feel to it, which was a little bizarre. Room: very big rooms, which were more like a suite to be honest (including a kitchen). The room is quite basic but has everything you need, including a massive fridge which was useful. Activities - there is a small pool but it was nice to have a pool in such a centrally located hotel. Restaurant/bar - we did not each at the hotel but this because we chose to go out as there are so many options and it is more fun to go out (we think). General: as is normal in the US you have to pay for valet parking which was the only parking option at the hotel, particularly as this is a city centre hotel. Personally, I would only recommend staying in Key West for 1 night (unless you like doing day fishing trips) and move on to you other Keys. In terms of the other options in Key West (located centrally) this is the best value for money. There is a Hyatt round the corner but you will pay a lot more for this.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Vacation”
Reviews.Author: PlantationHouse
Reviews.Content: Our stay was beyond wonderful. Central Air in fantabulous room, incredible views of the sunset over Mallory Square, Sunset Pier, and Duval St. The crystal pool was designed for relaxation where all the beautiful people gathered. The 4 star restaurant "Hot Tin Roof" room service set an in room table with linens and flowers for our private pleasure. Need I mention the jacuzzi tub that one can sit up right and still get neck deep in the corner of the bedroom? The spacious balcony was one of my favorite places to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Check the Room Before Accepting It”
Reviews.Author: morebeerplz
Reviews.Content: If you want a westward facing room (either overlooking Sunset Pier or pool & Mallory Square), you will shell out $150 more per night. For that price, you should check the room before accepting it. Having read the reviews on TripAdvisor, I knew there was a room with view blocked by a tree, so I asked to see the room first, and sure enough they tried to put me in a room blocked by a tree (room 217). They happily put us in 417 (king bed & sofa sleeper). The tree hasn't grown that high, yet, so Mallory Square, sunset, and views of cruise ships coming and going was superb. Room had a private balcony where several hours were spent vegitating with adult beverages and watching the sunsets. The roosters are part of the Key West culture, and you'll hear them in the morning even on the higher floors. I slept through it...and most everthing else! If anything, I think the rooms are about $100/nt over-priced, but would definitely consider staying again. Food on Sunset Pier was good, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: qtraveler99
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at Zero Duval street and you can't beat the location. As for the hotel itself, it's very nice and clean. We had an Ocean room which had an amazing view of the gulf. The rooms were pretty spacious and clean. They have a nice pool and the restaurant seemed very nice but we didn't eat there. The staff were all pretty friendly, but sometimes a little slow at the front desk. It was a nice stay, but a little pricey. However, it was nice that there were no hidden charges or resort fees added on.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: dadloveserin
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this resort. The rooms were amazing, with incredible water and sunset views. The suite that we stayed in was large, clean, breezy, and elegant. The pool and outdoor bar overlook the water, and offer a terrific retreat from the summer heat. And you can't beat the location - right along the Key West boardwalk and next to Mallory Square. The Ocean Key is on the more expensive side of Key West hotels, but worth every penny. Take someone you love for a special occasion. I did, and it's a memory we'll have for the rest of our lives. Just consider it a down payment on Happily Ever After.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Spa”
Reviews.Author: mariesgrdn
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Doubletree, only to find that the hotel is not on the water. My mother and I attended the SpaTerre for waxing services. After incredible service and hospitality at the spa, we found out we were welcome to use the facilities of the hotel. We spent the day lounging at the hotel pool. Incredibly relaxing!! Fantastic view!! The bartender was more than happy to mix special drinks, even though she seemed quite busy with a group of rowdy men. Found the pool area to be serene and relaxing after the men decided to call it a day and head up to their rooms. Wish we had booked our rooms here as well. The spa and pool staff were incredibly hospitable.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here! A wonderful hotel in a terrific location!”
Reviews.Author: HLC2010
Reviews.Content: The Ocean Key Resort is a really nice place to stay in Key West. It is located right next to Mallory Square at the end of Duval Street. They have a great bar, the Sunset Pier, with sunset views and live music every evening. The pool, though small, was lovely. Good cocktails and service around the pool. The chairs fill up quickly but the staff does a good job of putting out fresh towels as soon as guests leave. We got married while in Key West and the staff made our week extra-special-- we were upgraded to an ocean-view room and many of the staff remembered us throughout our stay. The spa was nice, as were the staff providing treatments. It was a great trip and we will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Key Resort and Spa, Key West”
Reviews.Author: alkANDcbk
Reviews.Content: Recently visited the Ocean Key resort and Spa in Key West Florida! A great hotel along with a PERFECT staff. Everything was in an armâ€™s reach. Food was fantastic. My boyfriend decided to surprise me with flowers for our anniversary, the concierge had a beautiful arrangement of tropical flowers delivered to our room with no issues. Hot Tin Roof is a must for a beautiful dinner (will not disappoint). We will return!

Reviews.Title: “more than we expected”
Reviews.Author: fromsocal
Reviews.Content: Perfect vacation was had when we stayed at the ocean key. The location was the best you you could get in the area. We overlooked the gulf from our balcony and listen to to the music from the sunset pier each night. It was like having our own band playing. We will look forward to our next time there. Dont forget when in Florida by the way that tips are included in most bills. We made that mistake a couple times before figuring it out so they got a 40-50% tip :( . That was something not used to being from west coast. We drove down from Miami airport to see the sites, but would next time fly directly to key west. No need for a car while there and parking and hotel has a steep daily rate. Plenty of place to rent bikes and scooters if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, best hotel I have every stayed at in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Irisheyes348
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Key West many many times. This was, by far, the best hotel we have stayed at. The staff are the best, most courteous, overly helpful we have come across. The location can not be beat. To sit at the pool and watch all sorts of boats go by in the Gulf while sipping a nice cocktail is pricless. We found the prices at the hotel restaurant and pool bar very reasonable. We got upgraded to a junior suite with a gulf view which was magnificent. The room was huge and beautifully decorated. I could not recommend this hotel more highly and will find it hard to stay anywhere else in Key West again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations!!”
Reviews.Author: keywest22
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at a bed and breakfast when we travel to key west, but it was our 10th anniversary so we decided to spend at little more than usual on accomdations. I booked a ocean view junior suite. When we arrived Sean promtly walked us to the front desk where Front Desk Manager Hugo informed us we were upgraded to a two bedroom two bath on the fourth floor. Sean unloaded all of our stuff from the car and helped us the room and at the same time gave us a quick tour so we knew where everything was. Our room was awsome, it had a full kitchen, living room, huge balcony and a gaint four person tub. We were there for 5 days and it was nice to have all the space along with a kitchen. We had breakfast on the balcony one morning and dinner in the room on the last night. When our full size frige was not working they brought us a new one. The bed was super comfortable, we did not hear any noises or problems. The pool is big for key west and it was so nice to have drink service, I felt like I was on a cruise. You can charge things to your room. The staff everywhere was so friendly and knew our names. There were kids in the pool one afternoon you don't usually get that at B & B 's . They were loud and stuff but that wasn't going to effect our stay. I can't tell you how amazing the service is and it was the best stay we have ever had in Key West, or anywhere for that matter. They have customers for life!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: short-break-fan
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel as my daughter was getting married there on Sunset Pier. The whole experience was perfect. Location was ideal, right on the tip of Key West with wonderful views of the sunset.. My husband & I had stayed in Key West before but not in this hotel. Expensive, but great for a special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort”
Reviews.Author: sportsnut926
Reviews.Content: Not only do I highly recommend the Ocean Key Resort & Spa... I plan on going back again and again... the hotel is located in the perfect spot on campus if you are looking for Tours, Mallory Square, or Duval St... there is a CVS right next door for snacks and water. The view of the sunset is breathtaking... The staff was unbelievable... our flight got in at 11 am... they held our bags and called my cell phone when the room was ready...we checked out early and they held our bags all day on Sunday since we had a late flight out... every person we walked by held open the door and said hi... The room was beautiful and the porch amazing... I highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: doctkc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days and absolutely loved it. The location was perfect so it was worth the high price. The pool is small but we had no problem getting a chair, even late in the afternoon. The service at the pool was incredible and we never had to wait to get a drink from the bar. There were no kids at the pool which made it even more perfect! The rooms were small but you're in Key West so why are you sitting in your room? You can walk to all the restaurants and attractions so we never had to get our car from the valet. My only warning is the bathtub/shower. It had a weird design and you had to take a huge step to get in and out of it which would make it difficult for older people. Sunset Pier and Mallory Square are right there so it's a great location to watch the sunset. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “OMG the roosters!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sweetcheeks_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a lovely hotel, the staff were welcoming and the bellboy gave us a little tour of the amenities prior to taking us to our room, the room was of good standard but was lacking in storage facilities, there were no drawers to store your clothes only hanging space, the whirlpool bath was a nice touch but please beware donâ€™t put to much bubble bath in or you could end up with bubbles all over the bathroom â€“ as my husband did. We were awoken every day at 6.45am by the roosters roaming around Mallory square doing their wake up calls and I canâ€™t believe nobody else has mentioned these noisy birds. The pool area was nice if a little small and some of the beds are quite close together, but the staff couldnâ€™t have been more helpful with frozen towels, watermelon.

Reviews.Title: “Simply lovely”
Reviews.Author: hustlelancaster
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in May. Only intended to stay for the one night but was taht impressed I stayed an extra night. Booked one of the lower priced roms but it was terrific, far better than the room i had in Miami. Will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “forget about sleeping. noisy staff, noisy rooms, contruction going on on roof.”
Reviews.Author: sunnning
Reviews.Content: The hotel is overpriced for what it is. The pool is tiny. The location is nice and the rooms are OK but forget about sleeping!! You can virtually hear anything going on from all sides, the room walls are too thin. You will be woken up by footsteps/heels everytime a guest around you return to their room in the middle of the night (in key west is can happen all night long), tv, all sorts. You can hear everything. The hotel noise starts around 7:30 with trays being pushed through the first floor to the pier bar, maids screaming at each other or at the cell phone, chairs being dragded during the room cleaning, and the worse was the banging, drilling, construction going on the roof (at 7:55!!). It's hell!! No chance of having a peacefull vacation or at least 8 hours of sleep without constant awakening. Next time we will stay at a B&B!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice suite, good view of sunset”
Reviews.Author: Katherine-Liao
Reviews.Content: A great hotel, room very spacious, service very good, free parking for guests, good location, easy to reach the nightlife spot, can enjoy sunset just on the balcony. Like the swimming pool with a bar, can enjoy the sunset by the pool sipping a martini. What a life.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in the midst of the action”
Reviews.Author: ButtonBarley
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon (first of 3 hotels that we stayed at). I would definitely stay here again. It's at the very end of Duval Street in the heart of the action. Duval Street, which we didn't know prior to going to Key West, is where all of the bars, restaurants and shops are. We had a great sunny Key-West style room. Tropical colors, comfy couch and chairs, sort of Banana Republic. The staff was very young but seemed pretty friendly. We had a waterview and we could see the pool from our room. Just a very relaxing atmosphere. And again, so close to everything. Also, my husband says that the Key Lime pie at the Tiki Bar was a 9.

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed room w/incredible sunset views”
Reviews.Author: funtravel4466
Reviews.Content: Loved our three days at Ocean Key. This hotel has a trendy look and tropical feel. Had a suite overlooking the pier side. Room was beautifully decorated and very spacious with heavenly bed. Bathroom was huge w/jacuzzi tub and Bath and Body Works amenities. Wanted to check in early but room wasn't ready so we were given drink coupons to use to pass the time by the pool. Pool area is also beautiful with lime green canopied cabanas. So close to Mallory Square and downtown action. Tin Roof restaurant serves delicious food and our waiter was top notch. He couldn't have been more accommodating. Only negative was when I ordered breakfast the night before to be delivered at 9:00 and at 9:40 I called to find out where it was. They never received my order. However, they made up for it by delivering it within 10 min. of my call. Great service. Would definitely stay there again. OH, and they ordered up the most stunning sunsets I've ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “It has so much potential but needs a management change”
Reviews.Author: tucsondood
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great part of Key West, but it suffers from a few problems. I stayed in a suite with my family and they told us they needed two hours to clean it before we could check-in. Upon check-in I saw huge, and I'm talking huge globs of dust hanging over my bed and all on the fan. The jacuzzi tub in my room was decrepit and from the 70's it looked like, as well as the light fixtures etc. Each night was like $1500 and it is NOT worth it. On top of that, early in the morning an excursion boat pulls into the harbour like RIGHT next to everyone's rooms. Who cares you ask? Well said boat is usually blaring the most annoying music ever with a guy on a loadspeaker talking to lines of tourist! When the maid cleaned our room, she obviously put too much soap in the mop bucket and made the floors so slippery that my aged mother almost fell and killed herself! When I spoke to the manager he was helpful, but I couldn't help but notice that his fingernails were long and had debris under them and his overall appearance was unkempt. I know we are in Key West and all put if you are gonna charge the price you gotta act the part. There are much better hotels in Key West with good locations as well.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect location in Key West.”
Reviews.Author: notrobin
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect location in Key West at the very end of Duval next to Mallory Square where the sunset is celebrated every night. Almost all attractions are within a few minutes walk. We had an ordinary room but it was spacious and overlooked the ocean and Mallory Square. It had a King Size bed and sofa bed. The bathroom was good. The provided cosmetics are excellent. We had a good sized balcony overlooking Mallory Square. The service was good. We had no time to test the hotel facilities as there was so much to do in Key West. I would recommend the hotel without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Key Resort Key West”
Reviews.Author: Tlcorsones
Reviews.Content: Loved the location, the accommodations and the free drink tickets the staff carry around! Food was excellent also!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location Top Notch!!”
Reviews.Author: Franic1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ocean Key Resort Feb 28 thru March 5th. Even though the price was a little hefty for us ($399 per night) It was our 30th anniversary and it was worth every penny. Our room was gorgeous. It was the Oceanfront 1 bedroom Jacuzzi Suite. Beautiful view and I think what has to be the best room in Key West. Room 416. The only problem was that we only got to use the Jacuzzi 1 night. It was leaking down thru the room below us. The manager offered to move us to a larger suite with a whirlpool tub but I loved our room so much I didn't want to move. They offered us $200 towards our bill but I thought they should allow us the difference between our room and a room without a jacuzzi. They did end up taking $100 off per night which I thought was fair. Everyone that worked there was very friendly from the desk clerk to the maids and the bartender (I do not know her name) at the pool who also doubled for the waitress was very friendly and always remembered us the next day. I loved that you could leave a time on your door as to what time you would like your room cleaned and you could also leave a breakfast request and they would deliver it at the time you requested.We Loved our vist to Key West and had a blast. We walked everywhere we went you don't have to rent a car, bike or skooter. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: ABayerSyracuse_NY
Reviews.Content: We had a 'partial ocean view' jr. suite overlooking Mallory Square. We booked at the last minute and were a bit apprehensive, having always stayed at the Pier House previously. From the moment we arrived the staff was great. They found us a room we could check into a few hours early so we could dump our luggage and stored it several hours after our checkout so we wouldn't have to worry about it before we caught the KW Express back to Ft Myers. The room was large, clean and comfy, and all of the staff were friendly, courteous and helpful. There is a nice large hot tub and heated pool. Overall we were pleasantly suprised and would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Weekend once again!”
Reviews.Author: travelgirlKW
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I stayed here for my 40th birthday and had a fabulous time. We stay here about once a year (for the last 15 years or so) and have never been disappointed. The room was one of the base ones (as it was high season) but it was lovely! Newer amenities all around - rainfall shower, full hottub, lovely furniture, etc... nice view (even with the palm trees - which made for interesting pictures!) of the gulph and Mallory Square. The staff once again couldn't have been more eager to please. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MopsyBooft
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed here for a night - beautiful hotel with gorgeous bedroom and balcony. Great character throughout the hotel. Excellent central location. Valet parking was a rip off though at $20 and we weren't told that it would be that fee. Plus we waited 40 mins for staff to get our car for us after they forgot to get it, we had to remind them twice we were waiting. Staff need to be a bit more organised or there needs to be some central manager. Remote control wasn't working which it should be for the price of the room. Lovely pool but did find a fag butt in the jacuzzi which wasn't what you'd expect for a place like this

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: wherever60
Reviews.Content: Ocean Key location was perfect, within walking distance to everywhere we wanted to go. The staff was extremely friendly and always helpful, they made our stay most pleasant. The Jr king suite was great, plenty of room. We sat on the balcony many times and enjoyed watching people and the water. We will definitely go back. The Tin Roof Restaurant was very good. Had great breakfasts there every day.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Sunsets Loved Ocean Key!”
Reviews.Author: MdBeachBum
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ocean Key from January 14th to Jan 17th 2010 for our anniversary. The view was awesome from our 4th floor balcony. The only draw back is that there are cruise ships that come in and dock right in front of Mallory Square a few days a week. When we arrived on Thursday and walked out on to our balcony and saw the cruise ship right in front of our $$$ view I called the front desk and complained they told me that the town ordence say that they are supposed to be out of port just before sunset so that you can actually see the sun set from your balcony. The ships did leave just before sunset on Thurs evening but at 6 a.m. on Fri. morning another cruise ship came pulling in. It was gone by 2 p.m. that afternoon and we had a unobstructed view for the rest of our stay. We booked a One Bedroom Ocean View Suite. We were not disappointed with our room. It has a huge 2 person jucuzzi, coffee maker, mini bar, nice shower large enough for 2 people. In addition to our balcony we were in room 416 which is a corner room so we also had a huge window above our bed with a breathtaking view of the water and Sunset Key The hotel is located right in the perfect spot on Duval Street. It is with walking distance to everything. We really enjoyed having coffee and roomservice on our balcony every morning. They put a nice white tablecloth and flowers on the table and it is the best view on the Island for breakfast. The sunset pier is a really fun laid back way to unwind in the evening with live music, great food and drinks. You have to try a Liquid Jelly Monkey Luv at the pier bar! The pool is heated and overlooks the water. The food, drinks and service were really spectacular through out the resort. We parked the car on Thursday and didn't get back in it until it was time to check-out on Sunday. We didn't have Wi Fi but the front desk was more than accomodating in printing out our boarding passes for us. We really loved the resort and plan on going back each year to celebrate our anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Slice of paradise at the end of Duval”
Reviews.Author: pirate40
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 restful days at the Ocean Key Resort...Couldn't have had a better experience..all the staff, from front desk, room service,bell staff, waitstaff at the Sunset pier, were are all excellent...April at the Sunset pier really stands out..(hello from the Champange drinkers!)..it is apparent that Ocean Key values its' employees, and is evident in their treatment of their guests....used to just make it to Ocean Key just once a year, but I am going to change my other plans and return more often....Thanks again Ocean Key.......

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ajaxwrigs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Key West and stayed at Ocean Key from 1/17/10 through 1/22/10. We decided on Ocean Key after reading reviews on Tripadvisor that described this as a nice resort that was close to everything. We could not agree more. We arrived at the resort around 6:30 p.m. and they provided us with an upgrade to a Boutique Suite, Ocean View, 5th floor. I refuse to believe that there could be a better room in the entire resort - our room directly overlooked Sunset Pier and the ocean. Each evening, we watched the sunset from our balcony with a cheese and cracker plate and a bottle of wine, both from room service. The room service was super fast. Everyone at the resort was very friendly and they could not have made us feel more welcome. The reviews about Ocean Key's location were spot on. It is on Zero Duval, across from Pier House. We just walked out of the resort, turned right and made our way down Duval each day. If the buzz of activity annoys you, then you might not want to stay in room 511 but we loved it! and I am sure that there are other rooms that are a bit quieter. We had our own balcony to listen to the live music each evening at Sunset Pier, starting about an hour before sunset until around 10:00 (later on the Sunday before Martin Luther King Day). On our second full day, we discovered the electric car and scooter rental place across the street. I believe it is associated with Pier House. After driving the car for a couple of hours, we decided to keep it for the entire week. Ocean Key has a special place to park electric cars and scooters, both free of charge. The parking spots for the electric cars have charging stations - parking and charging was free. Our room had a king bed, a sofa, desk, a desk chair and a comfy chair. The room had lots of storage space for clothing; no need to live out of our luggage. The bathroom was huge and if you liked, you could open shutters that closed the shower off from the rest of the room and look out on the ocean while showering - a really neat addition. We had breakfast one morning at Hot Tin Roof. My husband had an omelet and I had a breakfast sandwich. Both were great. We would have eaten at the hotel more but were anxious to try other restaurants in town. The rooms were very clean. The hotel allows you to designate the time you want for housekeeping and they keep to the schedule. The housekeepers came again in the evening for turndown service, if desired, and to see if we needed any more towels, shampoo, etc. The entire resort was clean and beautiful - lots of greenery and flowers. People were working all over the resort at all times. Another thing about Key West in general and Ocean Key in particular - we felt safe at all times. I left my wedding ring and diamond earrings in the bathroom each day and they were never touched. That is something that I never would have considered doing at any other place we have stayed. There is a great gift shop included in the resort and we visited it quite frequently. I spent a day at the pool while my husband went fishing. The Liquid Lounge at the pool had great food, great drinks and great service. The pool area was pretty crowded but all of the people were really nice. All in all, we had a great time and will stay at Ocean Key the next time we go to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous way to see in 2010”
Reviews.Author: Katrina500
Reviews.Content: Stayed here late December and over New Year until 2nd January. The room was fabulous overlooking the pool and bar (full ocean view), the staff are beyond reproach and room service was just fantastic. I had asked for a quiet room, but I think at the end of Duval Street, it's imposible to get one! Having said that I wasn't bothered with noise at all from outside, but was with a fellow guest's TV, but when I complained they ensured it was turned down pronto. The jacuzzi in the room is great too, though I didn't really rate the spa massage treatments and wouldn't have those again if returning. All in all though, a great stay and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: jstallings0801
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at the hotel and planned on showering and going out to Duval. We both had very cold showers and let the front desk know there was a problem, they were up within minutes. The water heater ended up being broken, so they offered to upgrade us. We got a wonderful room overlooking Mallory Square, with a hot tub and they gave us vouchers for free breakfast at the Hot Tin Roof. The resturant was wonderful! We loved the resort. It has a wonderful location, very convienient to most anything you would like to do one the island. The staff was also very frieldly and helpful. Though it was a little pricey, it was well worth it and we found most of the other lodging to be just as expensive. We do plan on going back with a larger group next time and not over a high season, but we will plan on staying here again and have already recommended it to our friends and family. THANK YOU OCEAN KEY RESORT!

Reviews.Title: “Great location questionable value”
Reviews.Author: derbycityvisitor
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here the week between Christmas and New Years. We usually stay at 4 and 5 star hotels. This hotel has a 5 star price but it is a low to average 4 star property. There are other hotels in the same area that I would check out first before opting for Ocean Key. That being said, our suite was very nice with a great view of the ocean and Mallory Square. However, unless you get a room on the 5th floor your views of Mallory Square and the Ocean are likely to be obstructed by the ever growing palm trees. The bedroom had small non flat screen television not consistent with a 4 star property at 500 bucks a night. We did hear our neighbors from time to time. I think the walls could use some sound proofing. The staff, all young people under 30 were very helpful. The Hot Tin Roof, the hotel restaurant was outstanding. The Sunset Pier and Bar, also part of the hotel is a fantastic place with terrific live music. No question, you are in the center of the action at Ocean Key, I just didn't think it was worth the $2,200 for the 4 night we stayed there. There are other nice hotels nearby which have lower rates and which would still allow you to visit Mallory Square, view the ocean, hoist a view beers at the Sunset Pier and dine at the Hot Tin Roof.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we had expected!”
Reviews.Author: SteveBishop.
Reviews.Content: We knew this was an expensive hotel when we booked and as we were staying in a few places around Florida we decided to make this hotel our special treat for the holiday. We were not let down. Thanks to Tripadvisor we looked out for some of the complaints on here and have to say that we didn't experience any of them. We arrived a few minutes before the booking in time and were given vouchers for drinks in what must be one of the best hotel bars anywhere! When we returned, there was a problem with our room and rather than keep us waiting whilst it was fixed, they upgraded us to a larger room on the fourth floor. It was fantastic, clean, spacious and with wonderful views from our balcony out over the harbour and ocean. Our dealings with the staff were always met with a polite, friendly and professional attitude and they all seemed to know there stuff. This is a great place to stay. The room we had was quite, clean, spacious and well appointed. The hotel is perfectly placed for all the main attractions of the area and is within easy walking distance of some of the best bars, restaurants and shops on the Key. The functional parts of the hotel are well hidden away behind all the greenery and the hotel bar and pier are a real treat. It was nice watching the sunset with a long cold drink listening to music in a great location. There is no self parking but as everything you will need is so close, then let them park the car and forget about it while you go out and enjoy the fantstic bars of the area. We would recommend this hotel to anybody and feel safe that they will enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally located hotel...clean and nice rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: lgreen1984
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Ocean Key during Xmas break 2009 and it was a superb experience. People are friendly, rooms are very clean and nicely furnished. Our room had a breath taking view of the ocean and we had a chance to watch a few romantic sunsets from our balcony...while enjoying chilled champagne. I hope we will come back one day!

Reviews.Title: “Jersey on the Gulf”
Reviews.Author: MarvinTheB
Reviews.Content: A perfectly serviceable hotel. For the price we paid, one might expect more. If this is truly the 6th finest hotel on the key, I pity the others. There's no reason other than location to recommend this hotel. The facility is poorly-kept and could stand some renovation. Rooms are small. The staff is surly. Requests we made to the front desk were never communicated to the rest of the staff. One choice moment: we requested a morning cleaning, using the helpfully-provided cards. They didn't clean in the morning; instead they decided to phone us in the afternoon after we'd put out the "privacy please" sign, waking our daughter during naptime, and ask if they could come in to clean. Brilliant. Walls are thin. For well over $500 a night one might expect privacy, but you won't find it. Here are a few choice moments from our neighboring room (around 10pm), all heard loud and clear through our living room wall: <stagger, stagger, bump, door slam> "Honey, are you OK?" "MMM.... bleaaghhhhhhh!" "Oh dear..." "OK, turn off the [expletive deleted] phone. Pull it out of the wall. I don't want that [deleted] thing ringing..." <TV blaring for the rest of the night>

Reviews.Title: “We will Be Back”
Reviews.Author: mac1969
Reviews.Content: If its beach you are after this is not the hotel for you.If its a wnderfull sunset and ocean view this is the 1 for you.The staff are wonderfull and very help full.Try and get a room on the 5th floor if posableAll the room are on the bigger side with plenty of room to spread out..We were in the block facing duval street.All rooms have free high sped internet.If you get one facing the dock you may get a rude awakening at 4am when ships are docking.There is also some constryction on that side of the dock.The food is great.Great locatinon to sunset pier.The room service is also amung the best.If you want to wathc NFL try the Hogs breath Just 1 block down. Cheap drinks and great food.THe pool area is nice and clean and great bar staff.If you are a water sports fanatic the dock is just out side the front door.All the bars are open till 4am.They do not open till mid day on a Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “I cannot wait for next year same week...met the nicest people!”
Reviews.Author: ro_june
Reviews.Content: I always read trip advisor prior to booking, and it did not let me down. The photos were awesome and the hotel looked exactly the same. The pool was the best location on all of key west. It sat literally within 10 feet of the turquoise water of the gulf ....the outside pool decor was lime, yellow and white along side the lower level bar area w/turquoise umbrella's, the 2 colors together were gorgeous. We found the other guests to be so friendly, I've never made so many friends on a vacation in my life, and everyone we spoke to had been returning guests which tells a lot about a place. People keep returning for longer stays each time as will we! Each day we'd hang by the pool and talk with others about where they ate for lunch or breakfast and where they were going that night and exchanges tips of what to order and what eateries we HAD to try. I think we will return next year same time too. We arrived early on a Sunday, our room was not ready, they promptly took our bags and we took a cab to Louie's backyard for a awesome brunch of Lobster benedict....and within an hour I rec'd a call from the hotel that our room was ready. They upgraded our room to a gorgeous suite at no extra charge, Huge bedroom and livingroom with table and kitchen...double length balconly. I was traveling for a girl's escape and it was perfect. We had our privacy from one another, we had seperate doors to the balcony huge bathroom. There was a band playing at the sunset bar almost every night. We were walking distance to everything...and not to mention right next door to Mallory Square for evening sunsets and vendors. The pool was the best, delicious lunches and drinks, bartenders were great, wonderful food, music, fresh towels all the time, we'd get there around 10:30 each morning to fresh white towels on the lounges with rolled up bright yellow towels for your neck or back. Mid afternoon they'd come around with complimentary skewers with fresh fruit. Later on as the sun got really hot, the "cabana boy"...we liked to think of him as that...lol..he came around with a tray with rolled up wash clothes soaking in ice cubes! It was the best. surprise. Each day we would walk past the spa and then see that gorgeous sun, that heated pool beckoning us and that turquoise ocean just 10 feet ahead of us...and we 'd pass on the spa...if it had rained one day, we would have tried some treatment, but just could not do an indoor thing when the sun was out - it was 85 and gorgeous and at home it was snowing - icey and 18! Each night as we walked out we asked the front desk where to go for dinner or drinks and each time, it was on the money. One guy told us to try Alonso's if we hurried we would make happy hour...1/2 price drinks and appy's til 6:30...omg the best mango margarits...if planning a trip, don't miss them. Huge and only $4. It surely was the best deal. I've read these other reviews and cannot imagine how anyone could find anything wrong with this place. Soooo clean, so spotless, not a piece of paper on the grounds anywhere. Friendly people. If I had to find a fault...one person was right, the elevators were not air conditioned, and with the humidity, it was very warm. Also we tried to reach the front desk and the concierge and anyone that would answer a phone one nite, but had to resort to calling the restaurant and they called a service person for whatever it was we needed. The place was wonderful, beds great, and actually we faced duval street and we loved it. We came home from dinner around 9:30 or 10 and then watched the real show from our balcony, The keys disease hitting the tourists....a few overly tipsy patrons trying to drag one another home...It was a riot. We had the best time. So quiet at night for sleeping, yet lively enough ...we did try the pier house for dinner one night, thinking perhaps it was a nicer hotel..well NO way. The food was good, but the restuarnt was on the side of the hotel and did not have a view of the sunset, the beach (they had a beach and a pool) was about 25 feet wide if that, pathetic looking and the pool was in the middle of the courtyard so did not have the view we had at our hotel. Even our restuarant was better because we could see over the railing for an unobstructed view of the water..Pier House had high railings and looked at the water but from a weird angle. Not to mention the pool out on the pier right next to the water..you cannot beat that view, lying on a chair and seeing the tall ships go by. So relaxing. As for all the complaints of the parking...just leave your stupid cars home, Cabs are right there, and only about $6 to anywhere or walk, it's only 12 blocks wide! The Place was great, and we would like to go back every year the same week and meet all our same friends we made next year. I never ever say I want to go to the same place. We stayed at La Concha once before and that was nice too, the beds were really really soft, like sleeping on a cloud and the roof top bar was cool but this Ocean Key was just the best. All the open walkways with the lush palms brushing the walls, It was just wonderful. .

Reviews.Title: “Great View of the Gulf and Old Town Key West - though check your bill”
Reviews.Author: cdsrm43
Reviews.Content: I spent a little over 3 months reading reviews and checking amenities/prices, etc before making the reservation here to celebrate my 39th birthday. We arrived late and the original room we were assigned was undergoing maintenance when we got there. The front desk was very quick to respond and upgraded us to a Jr. Suite, when that room did not have the view we had anticipated and a few other anomalies, again the front desk responded in a timely manner and again upgraded us. The room was lovely, views of the gulf and we could look up Duval Street into to town. The jacuzzi tub in the room was big enough for two. The ladies at Spa Terre were wonderful. and the Balinese Massage is worth it. They do not skimp on the alcohol at the pool/Sunset Pier, and the Mojito's and conch fritters were great. The staff was very friendly, and overall went above and beyond to provide a wonderful guest experience. Though check out time was 11:00 am it was not a problem to have our car loaded up and leave it in the garage while we wandered around town. The only real issue was upon check out when we were going over the charges. There was a charge for the mini-bar, though we did not partake of any of the mini-bar items. They were good about crediting it back to my account but it took over a week. I will definetly stay here again, next time with a full ocean view, it would be worth it. Beautiful hotel, great staff, awesome spa experience. Drove all the way back to Orlando flaoting on a sea of relaxation and Mojito's!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “LESSON LEARNED-LOOK OVER YOUR BILL BEFORE LEAVING”
Reviews.Author: merrylandMd
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying this is a beautiful resort. Very clean, nice area all the things it should be since it is pricey. Loved it here except we checked out early in the am. and I just glanced at our bill. We were overcharged over $ 2,000.00 on our credit card. I called Sunday when I returned home and compared my confirmation with the actual bill. It is now Friday and they said they credited my account on Monday, but nothing shows up. All they have said is "Sorry, did you go over your bill"? Like it's my fault. Next time, if there is a next time, I will go over it. And they also informed me it will take about 4 days before I see my credit on my account. I would have given it an excellent rating, but due to the fact I had to find the $ 2000.00 overcharge myself and bring it to their attention and talk to 3 different people in the process, still waiting for credit, I would have to give this high end resort a poor rating.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully appointed rooms, great view and excellent service after slight problem”
Reviews.Author: catack
Reviews.Content: We checked into the hotel yesterday afternoon and we were very kindly upgraded to a Boutique Suite overlooking the water as we wanted something with an ocean view and a little quieter than a street view. Sean at the front desk was terrific, very helpful, welcoming and friendly. The room was spectacular - spacious, very nicely appointed, lovely balcony overlooking the ocean and the bathroom layout is superb. There are sliding glass doors on one wall of the bathroom that are next to the whirlpool tub that you can open to enjoy the view of the water while you take a break in the bathtub. The outdoor pool area and jacuzzi are really very nice, and directly overlook the ocean with boats passing through the area all the time. Here is where we had a little problem, which I'm sure is the exception to the rule, but how the hotel staff handled the issue is very telling of their level of service and care for their guests. Basically, we were at the jacuzzi for about an hour. Some other people joined us and one of the women in the group was talking about how she wasn't staying at the hotel. They left after about 30 minutes or so. We had been the only ones in the area - when we got out my sandles I'd walked down in had gone. We spoke with the staff in the area - Sean from the front desk immidiately came up to the room to speak with us and make a note of the incident. We were fine about it really, as sometimes these thing happen and it wasn't his fault. However Sean asked, what can we at the hotel do to make up for this. My friend, somewhat jokingly said, well if we could stay a secod night that would be great. Without hesitation he said - I think we can make that happen for you - and he did. The staff here go out of their way to take care of their hurts and make everyone comfortable and feel welcome. I truly beleieve this is the mark of a real four or five star property. Would absolutely visit this property again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Old Florida decor with a prime location”
Reviews.Author: JB729
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Junior Suite with a partial ocean (gulf) view. The rooms were large, decorated in old Florida motiff and somewhat dated but very clean. We had a private dining area on a small deck that overlooked the gulf and the cruise ship dock. We were on the 2nd floor so did not hear noise from the cruise people. The location, 0 Duvall is right across from Mallroy square and the curise ship dock. The noise from Mallory picks up about an hour before sunset and the subsides. Great location with easy access to many attractions and at most is a 20 minute walk to the far end of Duvall.

Reviews.Title: “ocean key simply fantastic”
Reviews.Author: 1coach10
Reviews.Content: Celebrated 40th birthday in Key West at the Ocean Key(along with 15 friends and family).Upon arrival we were upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite with a double balcony that overlooked the ocean.Pretty awesome for our thirteen year old son to have his own balcony.Also 3 other parties we were traveling with were also upgraded to 2 bedroom suites. The following day my brother and sister in law arrived with their 12 yearold and 6 month old baby (she also is my god daughter and soooooo cute),and were also upgraded. Special shout out to Matt the general manager, thank you for the hospitality you and your staff showed to our large party. The suites were well appointed and clean(a huge plus for me cause I am a clean freak). Hot tin roof restaraunt was awesome for the early morning breakfast which my son and his 13 year old friend did partake in every morning. Pool area was very clean and a fun place to hang during the day. Robin at the Liquid Lounge was so very cool and a high light for us .Our drinks were always full and yes the boys virgin daquiris never ran dry! Sunset Pier restaraunt was surprisingly good too> Tuesday night shrimp special was awesome and i hope Ocean Key keeps up this practice. Ocean Key is located at 0 duval, but you feel as if the place is miles away from the craziness of duval (i like to say the fun). The grounds were lush and the colors vibrant and well maintained . The fitness center is very small, no problem because i lifted enough drinks to keep them biceps pumped lol. Thank you Ocean Key and Matt (the general manager). The staff were awesome and that is a direct reflection of the management of this first class resort.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: lynnecam
Reviews.Content: We decided to get married at Ocean Key after having visited here a couple of years ago and loving it. The second time we loved it just as much and I would recommend to anyone to stay here and definitely get married here. Yes, I have read the previous reviews where reviewers think the hotel could do with a little work but I didn't feel this at all. To us the hotel was still magical. We had a gorgeous suite with views over Mallory Square. We had our wedding on Sunset Pier and we were so impressed with Stephanie, the Events Organiser at Ocean Key and the staff at Hot Tin Roof, where we had our wedding meal. If only I could do it all over again. With any luck maye on our first wedding anniversary!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, updates needed”
Reviews.Author: Mike75205
Reviews.Content: Ocean Key is in the center of the action and shopping in Key West. However, it is getting a little rough around the edges. In our room were 6 light dimmers, only 2 of which worked as they should. Floor tile in the room and hallways was scratched, chipped and scared. Closet was inconveniently located in the far back of the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are amazing, location...the best!”
Reviews.Author: LBLINY
Reviews.Content: My husband and I originally booked a bed and breakfast in the middle of town. Upon arriving we were instantly upset about our choice so we went for a walk and saw all these fun people having a blast poolside at the Ocean Key. We were jealous immediately. My husband went in to see what the prices were...much less than where we were staying! We immediately switched hotels (losing a nights rate at the original). It was well worth it! For less money, we got access to the beautiful pool, perfect locations, tons of activities, great restaurants (including the one in the hotel) and our hotel room was HUGE with a bed room, living room, dining area, balcony and a hot tub. Ocean Key turned what could have been a bad trip to Key West into an amazing one. We would recommend this hotel a million times over.

Reviews.Title: “How Soon Can We Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: LuvItHere
Reviews.Content: It was great! Location, view of waters, restaurant, pool, room, and staff. We have been to Key West before and always wanted to stay by Mallory Square. This is the place to be. Cant wait to go back again! This time I want a room overlooking Mallory Square instead of Duval.

Reviews.Title: “Made the Trip !!!”
Reviews.Author: kkemrk
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, Service, Food, Beautiful Rooms ***** Stay again in a second

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: pondgurl
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay and truly enjoy and experience Key West. We got an awesome upgrade upon our arrival and had a huge deck overlooking Duvall Street . Always something going on for great people watching. Staff was great and very friendly. We loved the pool...beautiful setting! Can't wait to go back again! Would love to do it every year!

Reviews.Title: “ocean key- ok but not really worth the money”
Reviews.Author: beachsiders
Reviews.Content: we travelled to key west after the swine flu chaos in mexico and it was really not what i expected- i thought olde world charm -in an american way -we got drunks vomiting in the streets. the hotel is on party central in key west , it is really in need of a good clean up and staff training. the bedrooms are big and comfortable with huge beds, bathroom was nice but for some reason contained the wardrobe, the bath was unusable for the whole stay , i reported the problem every day and no-one even came to look at it. breakfast was really good and the views lovely, pool is small but nice , restaurant food is good but you can get better.cruise ships dock just outside the pool area so you can feel a little like a zoo exhibit when sunbathing

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced but you get LOUD construction”
Reviews.Author: jim3instuart
Reviews.Content: Look, here's the deal. This was my second time staying at the Ocean Key Resort. I had originally stayed almost 15 yrs ago and loved it. Had an island view room with seperate bedroom and was told that this was a mini suite. This time booked another mini suite and was told that they had a special on their partial ocean view so booked the room. Upon arrival we were taken to our room. It is a little outdated but decent. No seperate bedroom so everything is in one room. Nice bathroom and everything is clean. Walked out on our balcony and this is the view of Key West that everyone comes here to see, except we had a huge construction barge in front of our view. We also were woke up every morning by the construction barge driving pilions into the ground (very noisy) which also shook the building. At least they waited until 8:30a.m. to start. Upon arrival expect to have you car taken from you, but you get to pay 20.00 per day for this priveledge; and getting your car back is about a 25 minute ordeal. My first stay at this resort we were given a card and allowed to park on our own. So long story short, for the 300.00 per day that we payed to be there we would probably go elsewhere next time. The general vibe that we got from the staff just put a bad taste in our mouth. Room service was very good but no one else made us feel welcome. Make sure to ask if construction is ongoing when making your reservation; also don't pay attention to what price is quoted online per day be sure to look at the FINAL price there are resort fees plus 20.00 per day to have your car impounded which add up about 80.00 per day.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD BUT NOT GREAT!!”
Reviews.Author: AttractiveTraveler
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect!! Walking distance to almost everything. We have stayed at Ocean Key before just for this reason. The rooms are colorful, fun & really comfortable as long as you don't have to sit or sleep on the pull out sofa. The furniture seemed very worn this trip.
