The beds are comfy & the bathrooms are spacious. We were disappointed in the service. Our car wasn't brought around when we asked and we ended up being late to meet relatives for dinner (valet has to park your car & retrieve it). Housekeepers were great & so was the bar staff...there was just something missing. For the price, there should been a bit more attention shown to the little details like helping guests with bags, opening doors for guests when appropriate and generally going out of their way to help guests enjoy their stay. I guess this experience was not as good because of the economy. Not sure. It's going to be awhile before we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been any better!!! GREAT STAY!”
Reviews.Author: iwannagoeverywhere
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to the Ocean Key resort for our honeymoon. We stayed for a week and could not have asked for a better stay! Everything was perfect! The staff is very helpful, and was always happy. The staff seems to care about there job and how the hotel looks. I think they take a lot of pride in there job. The room was huge, and beautiful! We stayed in the one bedroom ocenfront suite. The room had a large LCD tv in the living room area, and another smaller tv infront of the bed. Our favorite thing about the room was the BEAUTIFUL balcony!! I can't stress enough how perfect the balcony was. I think we spent about 3 hours a day on it. The bathroom was about the size of a normal hotel room, it was very large. We ordered room service a few times and it was very reasonably priced, and was very good! They bring your food, water and a nice table cloth with flowers each time. The outdoor pool was cool at all times, but not to cold. The bar at the pool was very reasonable and again had very friendly staff. The location is perfect right in the center of everything that you need and want to see. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that wants to enjoy there time in Key West. I know we are already planning our second trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: jmdtrip
Reviews.Content: My brother recommended this hotel because of its location to Duval St.- its a quick 30 second walk and you are standing in front of all the bars. We got to the hotel a couple of hours before check in and walked around till our room was ready. They called us an hour or so before check in to tell us it was ready. We purchased a junior suite island view and when we walked in we were upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite with a gulf view. It was beautiful! Overall the stay was great. Very comfortable and a great location. The only negatives I could say about it was that we could hear the band on the pier in our room so they might want to invest in soundproof sliding doors. Also there was a weird fish smell when we walked out of the room into the walk way - I guess from the restaurant nearby. But the pool was nice and relaxing and the staff was great. I would stay at Ocean Key again.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing two weeks!”
Reviews.Author: r0amingtraveller
Reviews.Content: We spent a wonderful two weeks at the Ocean Key resort in Key West. The hotel is nestled right at the end of the very busy Duval Street but takes advantage of some fabulous sea views and bustling Mallory Square. The staff were incredibly friendly and obliging...upgrading us twice during our stay once on arrival and again a couple of days into our stay. The pool is well maintained and there were always plently of fresh towels for the sun loungers. The staff at the pool were very attentive and regularly asked if you would care for a drink or snack. Paul from Room Service politely and efficiently provided us with champagne and room service. He is a real credit to the hotel and I know that other guests were suitably impressed by his impeccable service too! Housekeeping was very flexible and would accomodate servicing your room to the time of day of your choosing. They also stocked up coffee and bath supplies on a daily basis. The bed turn down service is a nice touch but perhaps staff should be aware that if there are only 2 people in the room (certainly 2 on their honeymoon) that perhaps the sofa bed should not automatically be turned down...this was something which consistently happened despite our communication on several occasions that there was no need. Finally it might be adviseable to check your bill on check out carefully though as there were two charges for mini bar on our bill which referred to the night prior to our arrival. However, Reception were very apologetic and removed the charges immediately! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and really do recommend the hotel highly to all people. It deserves to be one of the very best hotels in Key West! We will be back one day for a second honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff, great place, simply one of the best.”
Reviews.Author: RPete
Reviews.Content: From the moment we pulled up to check in we felt welcomed and relaxed. Robert, the Bellman was great. He was very helpful. Hastings, who is at the front desk was awesome as well. We had a small issue with our room and she took care of it instantly. I will be staying here for years to come. You have made me a lifelong client and we appreciate all that the staff did for us. The maids were excellent. I can't say enough about this resort. Thanks and we will be back again as soon as we save up some money. It's not cheap but often times "cheap things become expensive". This place is worth every penny. The restaurant is excellent Hot tin roof I think. The only issue some guests had was the noise due to an uncontrollable by Ocean Key. The city was using a pile driver next to the hotel for a Pier/Dock I believe.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with value pricing”
Reviews.Author: Lonstarhusker
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ocean Key for 3 days at it was great. The location on Duval and next to Mallory Square is great. It is in the center of the Key West action. The rooms are a little old but the price reflects this and it is a great value. We got upgraded to a junior suite, which is oddly shaped with a hot tub in the middle, but the regular rooms are just as good unless you have childre. Room service was great at an affordable price. Sunset on the deck was magnificient. The Hot Tin Roof is a hidden gem. Beware it is hot there and the pool was inviting and pool service was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vleyden
Reviews.Content: The Ocean Key Resort and Spa is centrally located in Old Key West and is right in the end of Duval Street. Everything you could want is within minutes of walking out of the building. The property is beautiful and the room (we stayed in a Junior Ocean Front Suite) was perfect, has lots of amenities and was spacious. The best part of the room was the Jacuzzi tub and the balcony that overlooked Mallory Square. Great in the evenings to watch the sunset and festivities in the park. My only complaint was that the town was doing construction on the pier and woke us up at 8:00 AM on a SUNDAY! The staff at the hotel was GREAT, especially Hastings who really took command of the situation and offered us several other rooms in lieu of the room we had. None were as nice as our room, so she gave us a resort credit as well as a voucher to visit a local Country Club/Pool house. Overall she offered us a significant amount of service to make up for the disturbance. I did NOT like the Hot Tin Roof, the hotel restaurant was terrible for dinner, but breakfast was always good. The staff at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. I will go back and I recommend to friend - but I'd ask about construction being done by the town.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone should be pampered like this at least once in their life.”
Reviews.Author: DonnaV3
Reviews.Content: Had a terrific time. The room was beautiful and the view overlooked Malory Square. The staff was friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, friendly, and attention to detail here”
Reviews.Author: Marlajr
Reviews.Content: So glad we stayed here! Wish we had known about the crane operating adjacent to the pool before we checked in, but we still made the best of it. Staff is great, rooms are VERY nice, spa is a real gem, restaurants are great. Pool area is kept sparkling clean and fresh towels are readily available. I would LOVE to go back after the construction next door is complete!!!!! Wonderful place in Key West.......clearly the nicest property there!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location BUT ask about dock construction”
Reviews.Author: candyrae3
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel's location and the super friendly staff. The rooms are very clean and spacious. Be sure to ask about the new pier construction if you are getting an ocean/Mallory Square view as it can be noisey. I really believe they should offer a discount on the ocean view rooms when jackhammers, etc., are so loud. I was very surprised when we were not told about the dock demolition and construction and no discount in price was offered or given when I complained about the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Beautiful Room, But Beware Top Floors”
Reviews.Author: RichChapman
Reviews.Content: The only minor drawback we had was light flooding our room in the early morning hours. Perhaps all rooms are not the same, but our room #529 had a skylight window with no curtains, so there is no way to keep the room dark in the morning hours. During the day and evening hours the skylight was beautiful, but our advice is to try and avoid the 5th floor rooms if you do not want to get up with the roosters!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Large Rooms, Slightly Run-Down”
Reviews.Author: WeRroadtripping
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Key West for a special anniversary. Ocean Key is PERFECTLY located and we never had to use a car. We had a wonderful view of the square and the ocean. The room was nice and large with bright decor,great balcony with an excellent view, great AC and a ceiling fan (important if you are in Key West in June!!), the on-site restaurant had an amazing breakfast menu. The property was built as a timeshare, so it kind of feels like an apartment complex that has been converted into a hotel. The interior hallways are through the car park. The elevator that was closest to our room was out of order for the entire length of our stay. The other elevators seemed to be unventilated. They were HOT. It was 95 degrees outside and we opted to take the stairs to the top floor instead of getting in the stifling elevator for 1 minute. Service in the restaurant was perfect, and at the front desk it was very good, but a warning about the concierge. I've used the concierge at other high-end resorts and the service is part of the hotel. This is not the case at the Ocean Key. The concierge is a separate vendor and seems to make suggestions based upon where she will get the best commission. Overall, the hotel is very nice, but I don't think that it is comparable to a "luxury" resort.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, Central Location to Nightlife”
Reviews.Author: TravelinMAV
Reviews.Content: This may be a little biased because this is where I got engaged, but I love this hotel. Very nice accomodations. Really cool, funky furnishings in the inside, we had a balcony that overlooked Mallory Square, and the staff was very friendly. The best part was that we were right in the thick of the Key West night life, without being in the thick of the noise. They were doing construction when we stayed, but I believe they are finished now. The elevator was extremely hot & stuffy which was the only bad part.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Anywhere Else But HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: keezgrl
Reviews.Content: I live in the Keys but still like to get away to Key West for some relaxation and fun. I cannot express how outstanding this place is. Service Staff were nothing but accomodating, personable, professional and helpful. The room was wonderful, clean, fabulous view and had plenty of room. The dining experience was wonderful. It was at the end of Duval St so you can be near the action but not right on top of it. I would recommend this place to anyone locals or non locals alike. I was SPOILED to no end by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “A slice of paradise”
Reviews.Author: karmenA1
Reviews.Content: Ocean Key completely lived up to our expectations. The staff were very friendly and helpful and service was amazing. Our room was spacious, clean, and had a great view. It was a great retreat to get away from reality for a few days. We were close to the action of Duval Street without being in the middle of a circus. There are dozens of restaurants within a 5 minute walk and being right outside the door of the most incredible sunsets I've ever seen was icing on a perfect long weekend getaway with girlfriends. We would definitely stay at Ocean Key again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: mdj4945
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about Ocean Key Resort! My family and I enjoyed our trip so much I am sure we will be back very soon!! Excellent service, friendly staff, clean rooms with a beautiful view, was so much more than we all expected!! Thank you so much for such a wonderful experience!! Would recommend to everyone going to the Keys.

Reviews.Title: “That's really the Key West Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Johannes50
Reviews.Content: If you are really interested to get carribean feelings and to celebrate the sunset at Mallory Square take a room in the Ocean Key Resort. A junior suite with partial ocean view overlooking Mallory Square and the Ocean is the best value for your money! And don't forget to have your breakfast in the waterfront restaurant, the views are marvellous. The well known Duval Street and the Mallory Square is next to your door. The service is very friendly and supportive. But you should know the Ocean Key Resort is not quietest place in Key West, it is right in the middle of all.

Reviews.Title: “loved the spa”
Reviews.Author: kw09
Reviews.Content: I went for a pedicure - it was wonderful. very relaxing atmosphere and staff were super friendly

Reviews.Title: “Tatty with poor service”
Reviews.Author: LeeJW
Reviews.Content: My partner and myself stayed at the Ocean Key Resort for two nights at the end of our road trip from Orlando via Miami. At first look every thing was fine although we did have to wait until 4pm until our room war ready. The hotel was in a good location and the bar at the rear of the hotel was great with fantastic staff. When we did get into our room on the fifth floor over looking the ocean we found our room was a very good size. On closer inspection the fictures and fittings were very tatty and not at all well kept. Most of the light switches in the room did not work and the two phones in our room were also on the blink. On our second and final day I went ot the room for a knap as it was so so hot outside and I was tired. Half and hour later the defening high pitched fire alarm I have ever heard started to ring out for about 30 seconds. I called Reception as I was worried there could be a fire. The reception staff told me it was just a test by the Fire Marshall and that it had now ended. A little warning would not have gone a miss me thinks. For the next four hours this alarm rang out every two mins. Both myself and my partner called reception to find out what the hell was going on. We spoke to different people and both said that they would call back with information on when this incencent alarm was going to stop. Niether bothered to call back. It all comes down to respect at the end of the day. The reception staff had none. There are plenty of hotels in Key West and in ther middle of a secetion one would think the liesure industry would be fighting tooth and nail to keep business. I will not be going back to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “The best place for watching sunsets!”
Reviews.Author: sweetT13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ocean Key resort for our 10th anniversary and enjoyed the penthouse suite. The views were incredible; service fantastic and food great. Hot tin roof had super breakfasts. Pool is small, but nice in the evening when everyone has gone out for the night. Good pool bar-thanks, Deb!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Great Location, Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: onemilehigh
Reviews.Content: Got a great price using hotwire and had never heard of Ocean Key. It is located at the very end of Duval ST and the sunset pier is directly behind it. Upon check-in, they had upgraded us to an ocean standard room (unusual when using hotwire, priceline, etc.). The room was spacious and overlooked Mallory Square and the Ocean. The bathroom was big with a jacuzzi tub and walk in shower. Every staff member we came across was very helpful and friendly. The pool has a stunning view and a bar. The day we were there the pool had a spring break atmosphere, but it wasn't too over the top.....just people having fun. We had an outstanding experience and would not hesitate to recommend this for anyone looking to be in the middle of all the action.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful experience”
Reviews.Author: DareToLive
Reviews.Content: one of the hottest (the hottest?) spots in Key West, lovely pool, charming decor, great views. staff seemed far too friendly at times but they did their jobs well, breakfast not included, live entertainment right by your balcony nightly if you get an ocean view room.

Reviews.Title: “Size, Views, Location & Service ... But Noise Issues Spoil the Show”
Reviews.Author: WilliamHWilliam
Reviews.Content: Couldn't tell where the noise was coming from, maybe a vibrating roof fan or electrical room transformer, but it sent a constant throb through-out our suite from inside the walls. It wasn't noticeable during the day w/ the TV on and central A/C rattling - but it was very annoying at night for my wife and myself. Unfortunately, the problem was in both our original suite and the larger, higher one the staff graciously moved us to after we complained (both in the building adjacent to the lobby/Duval). The suites were a mixture of sorta lux furniture and comfy beds - and relics from the '80s construction boom: ancient appliances & creaky (but working) Jacuzzis, mismatched marble in some of the baths, kitchen lights that don't work, etc. Big suites, though, w/ nice natural light and potentially spectacular water views. And the pool area, housekeeping & service were great. Location is ideal, as you know. If you are looking for a giant suite to prime the pump before your Duval crawl, and come back blind drunk to collapse in, it would be ideal. If you value location & water views above all and aren't noise sensitive - go for it. If you want a serene place to rest your head - beware of the east wing.

Reviews.Title: “Another great experience at Ocean Key.”
Reviews.Author: CamFinCar
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at Ocean Key with four other couples and we had another great experience. Even had dinner at the onsite Hot Tin Roof one night and breakfast one morning, and both meals were fabulous. The service around the pool was excellent each day, and Robin and Elin were especially helpful and made excellent frozen drinks. The rooms are very large, and the couple celebrating a 40th b-day was upgraded to a room with a full kitchen and living room, which was great as an evening gathering spot before hitting Duval. Definitely would recommend spending the money to stay at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location Part II”
Reviews.Author: bobrxlex
Reviews.Content: i also stayed in room 202 as did tamaralea on the april 15, 2009 review. I booked the least expensive room and got a one bedroom suite aprox 700 sq ft. I believe this is the room perfect escapes.com web site books for you. there is not much of a view but the suite is fantastic. location cant be beat, just one and a half blocks from all the action but the hotel is so quiet at night, you can get a good nights sleep. if the view is not that important, you can get a great deal on perfectescapes.com which includes a great complimentary breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise and an Awesome View”
Reviews.Author: gianabanan
Reviews.Content: I took a chance on this hotel, and I'm glad I did. Not only was the hotel everything we needed it to be, we got upgraded, which was AWESOME! The staff is attentive, the rooms nicely appointed, the location is great if you want to be in the middle of it all, and the pool scene was relaxing but well-serviced. The Hot Tin Roof Restaurant was very good as well. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Key West”
Reviews.Author: tamaralea
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with our teenagers and had another hotel booked, when I checked back on this hotel. They lowered the rates substantially about a week before we were to arrive so I cancelled the other hotel and booked Ocean Key. We booked an Jr. Suite for $220/night, but when we arrived and they saw our teens, they upgraded us to a 1 bedroom unit. We arrived early, but our room wasn't ready until 4:30. That wasn't a problem, as there is so much to see and do in the immediate area. We never used our car when we were there. I heard them telling someone later that the had been "upgraded to a Jr. Suite", but Jr. suites are typically their lowest priced accomodations. I have the feeling that no matter what type of room you get, you'll be happy. Our room, #202, overlooked the lobby roof and Duval Street. Someone warned me about these rooms, but it was fantastic. Even though our unit had a kitchen, they kept it locked off. It wasn't a problem for us, as I had no intention of cooking. The cofee-maker is inside the televison cabinet. The unit was nicely decorated and very large. The patio was huge, with 4 chairs and a table. It could be accessed through the living room or bedroom. We also had a dining table and 4 chairs inside. The bath was large, with a huge whirlpool tub and a separate travertine shower with the best rain showerhead. We had a double porcelain pedestal sink that was beautiful. The furniture was rattan with a few colorful accent pieces. I loved the decorating. Wait until you see the pool area! It's decorated in lime green and white and is stunning. We were there at Easter and never had trouble getting loungers. They brought out pineapple kebobs one afternoon for all of us. Right next door is a CVS pharmacy, with reasonable prices on everything. Our unit was very quiet at night, as the Duval action starts about 1 block up from the hotel. Mallory Square is on one side of the hotel, but that's only wild for about an hour each night. There are literally dozens of restaurants within 6 blocks of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Key Resort - It was ALL True”
Reviews.Author: mtiffis2cute
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, Perfect, Amazing. Went for my Husband 47th B-day. I did tons of research and was hoping that I picked the right place. I DID. The views are amazing, The balcony is large, perfect for your own nightcap. The location is amazing. The dockside resturant has amazing views and you have all the water activities at your doorstep, No trying to find where a boat leaves from because its a stone throw away from your room. We wanted to Celebrate and we wanted Romance. We acheived Both. Ocean Key gives you the romance and the proximity to the fun gives you the party. Sign, A Former Key West Virgin.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have asked for more! Awesome deal/location!!”
Reviews.Author: apharoahz
Reviews.Content: Me and my spouse decided to go last minute. Packed our bags 1am in the morning and drove out there from ft. Lauderdale with no reservations and no clue what to expect. (we've never been there). When we got there, we went to every hotel, motel, resort u could think of and no one had a room avail or no answer by the time we got there. It was 5am and running out of luck when we called Ocean Key Resort. They answered the phone and had a room available. The service was excellent, the room was beautiful, the sunset at Mallory Square off the balcony was astounding, and the party outside was worth it. Overall it was a great mini getaway with me and my hubby...!!! Ps. Try spa terre its sooooo relaxing

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: jc_kfc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a wonderful position right at the beginnng of Duval Street. Don't be put of by the hotel layout, the car park in the middle isn't its best feature ! That said the rooms a very good, the pool area excellent and the breakfast are something to behold. Would recommend Key West as a great place for a break and the Ocean Key resort as the ideal place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Too much noise from the hotel staff at 6:30am in the morning”
Reviews.Author: Babo92
Reviews.Content: After a night out bar hopping the last thing you need is the hotel staff making a ton of noise outside your hotel room at 6:30am in the morning. After trying to get back to sleep, they were at it again at 7:30am moving equipment around the floor (a little grease on the wheels of their carts would have helped). A great location but a little consideration from the hotel staff would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel, Almost the Best location”
Reviews.Author: advancedone
Reviews.Content: We have been to Key West several times, and I have always wanted to stay here. This time I went for it. From the time we arrived to the time we left, the staff we interacted with were nothing but smiles and helpful. I consider myself a low maintenance traveler, but I do like nice things, and would have certainly spoken up if not happy, but the whole trip was smooth. When we arrived, we were attended to right away, and given a tour of the hotel on the way to our room. There was a mild fish smell in the lower hallways that stayed throughout our trip, but not near our room, and it really did not bother us. We booked the Junior Suite, partial oceanfront and have no complaints about the room at all, it was not on the sunset side, but we got a good deal on the price, and I knew that going in. I can see where the people that pay the extra, and go for the sunset rooms can be upset, because when the cruise ships are in, you are not seeing anything. Mallory Square is right there, and on that side, some people can be bothered by the noise, but not us, we were good the whole trip. The pool was awesome, the pool bar, and Lauren the barmaid there even better... she was great, and I know we were a little drunk and rowdy at times when we were together with some friends. Overall a great hotel and I think a good value. Will definitely go back

Reviews.Title: “Savor the Sunset”
Reviews.Author: tropicalfan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great choice in Key West. We booked a junior suite partial ocean view. Our room was on the 4th floor, overlooking Mallory Square and the water. We had a lovely balcony where we could see the sunset and all the action on the square. The room was spacious and comfortable, with lovely â€œKey Westâ€� furnishings, very tropical and colorful. The bathroom was large, with double sinks, a spa tub/shower, and soft bathrobes. A nice feature was the glass shower wall, you could see the ocean while taking a shower! The location of our room was nice because even though it did not face the ocean head-on, you could still see the ocean and not be blocked by cruise ships. You can walk to many bars and restaurants, and a CVS is right next door for necessities. The only downside was the noise level â€“ light sleepers beware. We could hear noise from the room above us, and in the parking lot on Mallory Square. Overall it was a great place to stay in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: KWGP
Reviews.Content: It has been two months since my husband and I stayed eight days at the Ocean Key Resort and we can't stop talking about it. We have stayed at other upscale hotels in Key West before and this one blew us away. Every staff member was courteous and went above and beyond on every request. The Hot Tin Roof is a must for breakfast and the view of the Gulf while sipping your morning coffee is heavenly. The pool area was perfect and a wonderful place to view the sunsets after spending the day lounging under the sun. You can see the sunset right from your loungechair if you so choose. Agnes at the Liquid Lounge at poolside was unforgetable and the sweetest ever at making us specialty drinks all afternoon. The poolside salads from the Sunset Pier were the perfect light lunch on gorgeous Key West days. The front desk staff upgraded us to a two bedroom suite and handled us as if we were the only ones there throughout our week-long stay. They made us feel like it was a pleasure to take care of whatever we needed. The resort itself is impeccably clean and there was always someone keeping up on everything. The coco-mango bath amenities were wonderful and full sizes are available in the giftshop to bring home. The location at Zero Duval can't be beat. An easy place to stoll back to after a wonderful dinner and many drinks out on the town. I cannot think of a single downside to staying at the Ocean Key. I would give ten stars if I could. Thanks to everyone who made it our best vacation ever. See you next year.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise at the end of the world”
Reviews.Author: englishhack
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the last two nights of a cross-America road-trip honeymoon, and while it was pricey, we couldn't have chosen a better place to end it. You're in the heart of the Duval Street action, yet the size of the hotel gives it a seclusion and peace rare in Key West. Highly recommended...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ThreeRivers75
Reviews.Content: Great staff, wonderful location at the 'end' of Duval Street at Mallory Square. Clean, well kept property. Walk to all locations along Duval Street, historic seaport, and more; no need for a rental car. Quiet location yet close to everything. CVS Pharmacy next door has anything needed including groceries and beverages. A great location for a Key West stay!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: NaMacD2
Reviews.Content: My two teenage daughters and I stayed four nights in a 1BR oceanview suite, Room 502. Apparently the Ocean Key rooms were condos at one time, and this room's design was kept the same. It was 900 sq feet, with a living room with fold-out couch, kitchen with coffee maker, fridge, stove, microwave, dishwasher and even a washer/dryer. Big windows to the balcony. Nice big fresh bathroom with marble tile, two sinks, a large jacuzzi and large shower. King bed with quality linens, and another door to the balcony. We LOVED the balcony. There was plenty of room for four chairs and a table. We really enjoyed watching the comings and goings on Duvall Street, and we had a grand view of the water too. We ordered room service twice, and Paul, our server, was very friendly and professional. The dinner arrived promply, and was delicious. We ate breakfast one time at Hot Tin Roof. While the view was beautiful, I had had higher expectations of the food. The special banana bread french toast was just warmed, not toasted, and the other warm items were room temp. The pool was fantastic, especially enjoyable for early January. The pool is heated, and very pleasant. Plenty of comfortable chairs and tables, good service for food and drinks, and a great view of the water, especially at sunset. We enjoyed hearing live music in the late afternoon that wafted over from the pier. Suggestions: Take the Conch Train tour that leaves a half block from the hotel. It's two hours long, very instructive and amusing. The girls and I thought we might be a bit bored on a sunset cruise, but we really enjoyed the "Commotion On The Ocean" cruise with Fury. They offer unlimited drinks, apps and best of all, live music. The catamaran wasn't too big or crowded, and we had a wonderful time. And they leave from the dock at the hotel. We didn't feel we needed a car for most of our stay in Key West, but one day we have Enterprise pick us up at the hotel, and rented a car to drive to Bahia Honda State Park. I highly recommend you visit this gorgeous beach! Yes, there is seaweed on the beach, but it's soft, and there is plenty of sand to lay your towels and bods. The water was beautifully clear and turquoise, and warm enough to swim even in early Jan. A wonderful day. When you drive in, there is beach with water sports and snacks to the right, but I suggest turning to the left for a more private natural feel. The best meal we had was at Sarabeth's - Sunday brunch. We also enjoyed El Meson de Pepe near the hotel. If we return to Key West, we will be staying at the Ocean Key.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Claudine100
Reviews.Content: I have awaited more of this hotel. The staff was friendly but for the rest, I found it disappointing. We booked a large room and received a small room. When we complained, they said it is a mistake of the travel agency (our travel documents said a superior room and descriped it as a large room). After some discussions we gave up and stayed in the small room. It is a nice hotel in a good location but in our view, overprized for that what you get.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous resort, right on Duval!”
Reviews.Author: RandR-London
Reviews.Content: Ocean Key is just perfect! The room (suite!) was massive - a large living area with a sofa and flatscreen television, connected by a corridor to an oversized bedroom with a king sized bed and a jacuzzi in the room. There was a small bathroom with a shower and two sinks too. We had a partial oceanview - which is definitely worth the few extra dollars. Sitting out on the balcony in the early evening was great. The pool area is truly fabulous - its almost right on the seafront, and you can see a great sunset just lounging by the pool. The resort has a pretty sophisticated air about it - few children in the pool, and lots of people posing! Service was excellent - the concierge booked us a wonderful meal at Commodores seafood restaurant for Christmas Day, and the front desk staff were always really helpful and friendly. And the hotel is amazingly well located, right at the bottom of Duval Street, next to Mallory Square (where there is a daily sunset festival). We were a bit worried about noise - but there isn't any - the loud bars are about a five minute walk away and that seems to be enough to guarantee a peaceful nights sleep. There is compulsory valet parking, but you really don't need a car in Key West - so we just dropped out car at the Hertz at the airport when we arrived, and picked up another one when we left. We would definitely go back to Key West, and when we do, Ocean Key is clearly the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Not value for money”
Reviews.Author: helen94
Reviews.Content: Sadly, the first impression of this incredibly expensive hotel continued,throughout our stay which is that the hotel is mostly staffed by young college students who have no real idea how to treat their guests and that it plays on the fact that it's in a fantastic location for Key West.. We arrived late in the evening, 10.00pm, after being delayed by bad weather on our flight. We were tired and hungry. The young man at reception barely looked up from his computer and made no real effort to welcome us. He told us to wait with the car while a porter came down, and left us standing in the street outside for several minutes. The porter came and took us to the room. We had booked an expensive suite for 2 nights., (this was our Christmas treat) and it all felt a little too worn for the high price we were paying. The kitchen was tatty, the lights didn't work, the microwave, fridge and cupboards were all definitely old and knocked around. It was grubby and made us feel like we didn't want to use it. We were really hungry so went down to reception again to see if we could get some food. The guy told us we were too late for the restaurant, there was no room service and was really unhelpful with any positive suggestions. We ended up going next door to a CVS and buying soup and crackers, which we heated up in the dirty kitchen. There were not enough spoons for 5 of us. The following morning, walking to breakfast we passed several staff members none of whom said good morning or even smiled. The breakfast was incredibly expensive, and not very flexible. The waiter was not great and forgot things we had ordered. The pool area is small and people had saved their sun loungers without using them, so it was hard to find one out of the breeze. This was not value for money. and not even luxurious indulgence. Ridiculously over priced and poorly run. Even when we checked out the porter said he would pack the car up while we went out for a last walk up the main street. When we came back we discovered he hadn't locked the car up, and it had all our passports, computers and luggage inside. The car was accessible to the street and anyone could have walked in. Don't waste your money on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our time at Ocean Key Resort”
Reviews.Author: cmmonaco78
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our X-Mas vacation at the Ocean Key Resort & Spa. We usually go home to NY for the Holidays but this year my wife and I decided to have some fun instead. If you are looking for a nice hotel with above average service and great rooms in a party town full of drunks and cruise ship tourists this place will suit you fine. We booked through perfect escapes and got a free room upgrade and three free breakfasts at the hotel restaurant. The room itself was pretty. It was nicely decorated and appointed with a mix of traditional Key West styling and modern amenities. It had a great View; two flat screen TVâ€™s and a great bathroom with a jetted tub and marble everywhere. We had a balcony that looked out over the Gulf and Mallory square where the sunset fair goes on every night. The pool area of the hotel was also well appointed and decorated. There is a nice view of the gulf from the pool deck and the minimalist key lime accented furniture and towels add to that luxury hotel feel. The poolside bar whips up made to order tropical drinks and food from the hotel restaurant can be ordered as well. The best thing about this place is the location. It is at 0 Duvall St. You can walk to most anything in the town from there. Sloppy Joes is 2 blocks away. Hogs breath is maybe 50 yards from the hotel. The Mariners museum and ship wreck historium are right outside your door. Greene St. is also a stoneâ€™s throw away and you can walk to the wharf. I thoroughly enjoyed my Christmas holiday in Key West and would recommend staying at Ocean Key for people that are looking for a luxury style resort without breaking the bank.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: lehardee
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoyed our stay at the Ocean Key Resort. We switched our reservation from the Westin a few days before our trip based on reviews we read on TripAdvisor about the construction there and some recent issues with Starwood. We may have had a wonderful stay at the Westin had we gone there, but we were pleased with our decision to stay at the Ocean Key. The Ocean Key is in an awesome location in Key West. It's right on the water, right beside Mallory Square, and right on Duval Street. You can walk to pretty much everything Key West has to offer. We booked our room through Travelocity, and there was a slight problem with that when we checked in. They didn't have our reservation in their system. Fortunately, I had printed out my Travelocity confirmation since I was charged in full at time of booking (in retrospect, I should have called in advance to confirm my reservation). The front desk person took the printed confirmation and said he would go talk to his manager to sort out the problem. It only took about 10 minutes, and he came back and said everything was taken care of and gave us a complimentary upgrade to an Ocean Front room (we had paid for Old Town view). I've done a lot of traveling, and this was one of the nicer rooms I've stayed in. We had a great view of the water and could even see the sunset from our balcony. There is a large sitting area with a flat screen tv (no HD but we didn't spend much time in the room watching tv anyway) in addition to the bed area. The bathroom was roomy as well with a large tub and double sinks. One neat thing they do that I haven't seen at other hotels is that they let you choose the time window for getting your room serviced. There are 5 or so time slots during the day that you can choose and you just hang the form on your doorknob before going to bed. The pool area is nice, though it can be blocked if there is a big cruise ship docked there. You can google the cruise ship schedule to see when ships will be docked there. It is also not that big and can get crowded during the day. We had a great time in Key West. There are a lot of great restaurants to choose from. We also enjoyed biking around town. It's a very bike-friendly place since there's not a ton of traffic and it's really flat. I would also recommend a sunset sailing cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Jr. Suites Are Not Good!”
Reviews.Author: trey772
Reviews.Content: Nearly all of the reviews appear to be discussing the ocean view or upgraded rooms. My wife and I were not upgraded --- we were put in the basic Jr. Suite I reserved. It was dirty, dated and smelled funny. The bed was good. The bathroom was dank and horrible. The sitting area was in 1980s style with a nice flat screen TV. The room as a whole needs a serious update. We really did not care for the used Q-tip on the floor when we entered the room. One definite high point --- the staff was courteous, attentive and helpful. Also, the location is great. I can only assume that you are paying for the location when you book a Jr. Suite. Otherwise, it is not at all worth it. For the price we paid, we could easily have stayed at any number of nicer hotels on the island. We left after one night and moved to the wonderful Hyatt Key West three blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “The Way To Go in Key West”
Reviews.Author: myvicisslow
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a wonderful stay in this resort. Great service from check-in to check-out. I reserved an Oceanfront Guestroom but upon arrival we were given a complimentary upgrade to an Oceanfront Suite! I was actually hoping for this prior to our arrival because of the number of previous reviewers that also received free upgrades. We were shown to our room by the bellboy just minutes prior to the sunset. Our view from the balcony was beautiful but slightly obstructed by some palm trees. We were on the fourth floor above the spa. The room itself is nicely put together. Furnishings are new and the bed was comfortable. Walls are pretty thin as we were able to hear kids laughing next door but they quieted down pretty quickly. Other reviewers have complained about the roosters outside. I did hear them early in the morning (3am ish) but it wasn't loud enough to keep me from falling back asleep. I'm sure that also depends on the location of your room. We only dined at the resort's Hot Tin Roof for breakfast because it was included in our package. I have a separate review for this but I'll just say the food and service were good. We also had some drinks at the Sunset Pier and enjoyed our time there too. We didn't have enough time to lounge at the pool but it sure looks nice and relaxing. I saw the staff cleaning the pool every morning from our balcony. We also took advantage of SpaTerre on their property. My wife and I had a couples massage medley which felt really good. My therapist did a good job of rubbing out some muscle knots. My neck is always very tense and felt great afterward. A few points to mention. Depending on your room location your view may be obstructed by a cruise ship. This was something I was aware of thanks to previous reviewers. Don't let it ruin your mood though because all the cruise ships leave the same day and chances are if there is a cruise ship the next day it won't be docked at the same spot. Besides if you want to watch the sunset Mallory Square is just around the corner and it's the same view. Also, if it's windy in Key West it will be especially windy at the resort. Even more so at the Sunset Pier. This actually dissuaded us from eating there on one occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: emm1204
Reviews.Content: We just came home from a wonderful stay at the Ocean Key Resort! It was awesome.... When we got there they gave us a COMPLIMENTARY upgrade!!!! They said that the room was available and they gave it to us. The room was amazing, where do i start...... full kitchen, two bedrooms, two bathrooms, jacuzzi, huge front room and dinning room, && Washer & dryer! It was perfect it was everything we needed! The balcony was located right over the pier we could sit outside and hear music. Perfect place to stay, everyone was sooo nice! We highly reccomend this place and would stay there again! Ohh yeh and the pool was great! It overlooked the water and you could swim and watch huge crew ships go by. The bartender at the pool bar was super cool too! I really loved this place!

Reviews.Title: “Okay but not 5-Star”
Reviews.Author: Broder
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights in early November. The front desk supervisor who checked us in (Eddie) was excellant, as was the bellman, Ron. Very effecient, friendly and accomodating. The rooms we had on the 4th floor had good ocean views, overlooking the pool. When we arrived we could not see anything except the cruise ship docked directly in front of the hotel balconies, but it departed on the evening of our arrival. Definitely check to see if there will be a cruise ship docked at the hotel before you pay for an ocean view room. The rooms were nice, but not fabulous. Our room had a great bathroom, which was very large, had upgraded toiletries and the bathroom was very clean. The remainder of the room was certainly acceptable but we found it moderately appointed. It has the "funky" Key West syle, which is great, but it looks a little tired. We traveled with another couple. We had one room in between the two rooms each couple had. The people in the room between us had a very loud domestic disturbance on one of the evenings. We did speak to the hotel staff (Catherine) who were very understanding and the staff did address the issue with the other guests and we had no further problems. The remainder of the staff were not overly engaging or outgoing. We had an issue at check out where both couples were charged for valet parking the same car. When I inquired, the staff seemed to dismiss that this could have occurred until we insisted that they compare the bills, at which time they acknowledged and corrected the mistake. It was an enjoyable stay but nothing spectacular. The rooms all open to the outside, rather than a hotel hallway and the elevators to get to our room were in the parking garage. Nothing wrong with this hotel, but if I was going back to Key West I would probably explore other options.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: admg1963
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited the Ocean Key a few days after tourists were allowed back after the evacuation for Ike was lifted. The staff at this hotel are without exception very friendly and genuinely keen to help. We didn't once walk in to the lobby without receiving a friendley greeting - whatever the time of day or night. The hotel is extremely well located, right at the end of Duval Street and next to Mallory Square. However, this proximity whilst convenient never once caused us issues with noise or disturbance. The pool area whislt small is very nice, and superbly located. It's also an incredible sun trap - thank goodness for the attentive bar service! The Hot Tin Roof is also highly recommended for breakfast and dinner, though the hotels great location means that all of Key West's bars and restaurants are within easy walking distance. This is definitely a "must return" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Kick Back & Relax In Paradise”
Reviews.Author: PADMIESTA
Reviews.Content: This was the place that we stayed at the end of our 3 week Florida Honeymoon and it was the icing on the cake of a fantastic Honeymoon. This place oozes charm and character and if you like the nice things in life then stay here, you will not be disappointed I can assure you. Me and my wife were very impressed indeed..... we have stayed in many hotels and guesthouses all over the world, we are quite well travelled, but this place is truly magical and will remain as one of our favorites and one day we will definitely return.. We arrived the day after the mandatory evacuation had been lifted for hurricane â€˜IKEâ€™ and you would have never known that this place had just been pounded with strong winds etc as it was â€˜Business as Usualâ€™ when we checked in the reception saw that we were on our Honeymoon and without prompting they upgraded us to a beautiful room as per the pictures that I have put on here. The room was faultless, all the mod conâ€™s but with a touch of class and a vintage feel to the room, which is what we love. We had a private balcony that overlooked Mallory Square so we could watch the street entertainers in the square or watch the sunset from our balcony if we wanted. It is lovely by the way that you are treated, all the staff are super friendly and helpful and make you feel really welcome and canâ€™t do enough for you, thus ensuring that your stay with them is a pleasurable one... nothing is too much trouble The room came complete with a T.V minibar and refrigerator, along with the nicest furnishings to make you truly feel at home. The pool area is outstanding and is directly next to the ocean, I even saw dolphins swimming in the sea whilst I was laid next to the pool. It was nice to hear people walking past the hotel saying WOW look at that hotel it looks lovelyâ€¦. And I was on the right side of the fenceâ€¦ heheâ€¦ :-) The pool is a good size, the pictures on here are a little deceiving as I thought the pool was going to be a lot smaller than it actually is. The Jacuzzi is excellent and hot!! Another good added feature is that the pool is open 24/7 I saw people sat chilling in the pool and the Jacuzzi after midnight and it was still all lit up and heated. This is the kind of hotel where that is not a problem due to the clientele that it attracts, there is no danger of idiots being in the pool at all hours. One of the staff members sorted us out with discounted tickets to go on the â€˜Furyâ€™ water sport adventures which is based directly outside this hotel. We went on commotion on the ocean and the ultimate adventure and I would recommend both. It cost us $300.00 for both of us, which was an absolute bargain. If there is anything else you want to know about Ocean Key Resort & Spa then please ask and I will try my utmost to assist.. If you are planning a trip to Florida or just the Keys and you can get into Ocean Key, then book it you will NOT be disappointed I assure you... Paddy :-)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in the heart of Key West”
Reviews.Author: Chrisb321
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ocean Key Resort for 2 nights during August of 2008. We had been to Key West before so we knew we wanted to be in the heart of the action. This hotel is located at the fun end of Duval street but it is just far enough (2 min walk) to not be affected by the bar noise. We knew this place would be more money than some hotel at the other end of the Island but it was worth every penny. Check in was straightforward and they were very polite. They gave us a tour of the facility as we walked to our rooms. The room was amazing (see the pictures). We didn't have an ocean view but our balcony overlooked Mallory Square, which is the main assembly point for the nightly sunset event. The pool at the hotel was great as well. Very well staffed and a great view into the ocean. There was a little bit of work being done on a new outside tiki bar but it didn't affect our stay at all. We will be returning to this hotel again for sure. If I had to be pushed for negative points or improvement oppotunities I would suggest upgrading the old tube TV's to some nice new flatscreens (not that we ever watched it!) and we also had a few ants in the room (which they made note of an and told us it would be dealt with after we left)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: davidge
Reviews.Content: You never know what to expect when arriving at any hotel but this place far exceeded our expectations. The location could not be bettered. Right at the "right" end of one of the world's most famous party streets, Duval Street. Close enough to see where the action starts but far enough away to not be disturbed by any noise. Not only that most of the rooms overlook Mallory Square, or have a decent sea view. When we arrived the staff in reception were some of the friendliest we have experienced. We were quickly shown to our room which was a good size. The bed in our room was a four poster and our view was looking out to sea and the lower end of Duval Street. The bath was a spa type and had some novelty value in as much as making for a spectacular amount of bubbles. Key West is only small any way but the hotel in terms of location could not be faulted, the main tourist areas/facilities were more or less right outside. Would we go back? Can't wait. But................ Valet parking was an eye watering $21.50 per day but to be fair the four days we stayed the car stayed put.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, good food”
Reviews.Author: GLM123
Reviews.Content: I love this resort. You can't beat the location. Everything was also very clean. It's pricey, but it's worth every penny. When I visted, I walked around the island from that location, and had a blast. That's a great hotel. The drinks at the pool were really weak, but 2 Drunk Friends is down the street, and they have great meals and drinks there.

Reviews.Title: “a great stay”
Reviews.Author: sportfisherman
Reviews.Content: In traveling to Key West for several years this was the best hotel we have ever stayed at.Our room was upgraded upon check-in without us asking, The staff was super friendly, the Hot Tin roof was awesome.Everything there is perfect pool ,location,room not one thing could have been better.We will be staying there on every trip to Key West in the future. John B. Winslow Maine.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sunsmile72
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ocean Key for 3 nightts and loved every minute of it! We had a Jr Suite with an Ocean View! The staff was wonderful We will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: LibWalesUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days, from the moment we arrived the staff at reception were friendly, helpful and were so happy they lifted our spirits after a long, hot drive. The room was lovely, bright and colourful and overlooked Mallory Square so we could watch the etertainers and more importantly the sunsets (although thanks to Gustav we didn't managed much of a sunset) the last day Gustav hit quite a bit but it really didn't spoil our experience, we ordered room service and watched the lightening show. You couldn't get a better location and I can highly recommend the Rum Runner cocktail

Reviews.Title: “1st time @ Ocean Key”
Reviews.Author: tonyCharleston_sc
Reviews.Content: Have been to Key west 3 times with the previous 2 visits staying at the Hyatt Marina. We enjoyed the Hyatt and tried to book it for this most recent vacation but they were filled up so we started looking around. Of course the 1st place to look is this website and we went ahead and booked Ocean Key based on the reviews. The Hyatt is very nice but we liked Ocean Key much better - had a real key west decor and enviroment vs. a more "hotel like" demeanor at the hyatt. We had a room on the 2nd floor overlooking the water and the pool. I was very concerned when we got there that we were so close to the pool but it turned out to be a great location. You could run to the bar very quickly and grab drinks for the sunset, the fitness room (which was pretty decent IMO) was very close as was the restaurant. We had the ocean front king suite and it is an awesome room! Having the suite made it feel more like a nice condo. The cleaning service was excellent as well - all of the people we dealt with at the hotel were very friendly. we will definitely book this spot again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: winwardtraveler
Reviews.Content: The Ocean Key Resort in Key West was awesome! All of the folks couldn't have been more helpful and the resort itself is worth the extra money. The sunset pier gives you wonderful views of the Gulf and the rooms are beautifully appointed, very colorful, beautiful bathrooms, great balconies. I checked trip advisor before going and they did not steer me wrong. Try to get a room on the water side( a little more, but worth it) Great hotel, wonderful staff, beautiful views!! What more could you ask for! Enjoyed immensely!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Location in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: jtindover
Reviews.Content: This was a romantic get away for us. We booked a JR Suite and received a upgrade upon check in! They even allowed us to check in early since the room was ready! Staff was very very attentive to our needs. We had a partial view of Key West Harbor and Duval St. Even though the street can be busy it was not very noticeable at all! We loved the shower and never had chance to use the whirlpool tub. The pool is perfect mid day when it is hot. I reccommend a frozen drink while watching the boat traffic from the pool! The Sunset Pier is probably the best venue we found to view the sunset. The pier had live music nightly! Our personal favorite was Joel Nelson. We will stay at this resort again well worth the money and close to everything. Also just rent bikes no need for a car. They run about $15 a day and allow you to see more of the sites and hit some of the restaurants off the beaten path.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay anywhere else! AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: VacationNowPlease
Reviews.Content: Ocean Key is located at Zero Duval Street..at the very tip of Key West. If you went any further you would be in the ocean. All I can say is that I will ALWAYS stay at this resort when visiting Key West. The location is in proximity to all of the action. We booked the junior suite with the partial ocean view and was right over Mallory Square. It was awesome! The restaurants in the hotel were great, all had ocean view dining. The staff was courteous, the room had a big screen TV, the balcony was perfect for 2. It's a very romantic place. Its a great place to shop, or just walk up and down Duvall Street to relax. Mallory Square has music each night and street performers. This is also a great place to watch the sunset! The other restaurants around town are great too and my boyfriend said the cigars are awesome in Key West. The price was a little high, but it's worth every penny! I can't wait go back and book a room at Ocean Key Resort!!

Reviews.Title: “Engaged @ the Ocean Key Resort”
Reviews.Author: soon2bmav
Reviews.Content: I know I'm writing this review almost a year after I stayed there, but I just had such a great experience that I have to share. Our room was beautiful. It didn't have the best water view, but we did get to see Mallory Square which had excellent people watching. The balcony was small, but comfortable for two people. Also, the bathroom was really nice AND spacious, which is always a plus when getting ready--especially a priss like me. As for location, you just can't beat it. We walked EVERYWHERE. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The restaurant upstairs, The Hot Tin Roof, was wonderful. We ate breakfast there every morning. Also, the chef came out and made us an appetizer that wasn't on the menu and I loved it. I don't know if I'm biased though, because I didn't know it, but my fiance had planned the trip to propose to me. I just thought we were taking a mini-vacation. At the time that we went, the elevator was HOT but hopefully that has been taken care of. That was our only real gripe about the place.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location!”
Reviews.Author: raisinette
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Ocean Key and had a blast. From the moment we arrived, we had the very friendly staff help us and give us suggestions for everything. We booked the junior suite which had it's own living room with a fabulous large screen TV. Just down the hall was the bedroom and a big jacuzzi. The room also had a balcony. Ours overlooked Duval St. and the Glass bottom boat tours. The rooms are beautiful-but you can see it's a little worn form over the years. The pool is a great place to relax-you just may have to hunt down the towels or bring your own from your room. From the pool you can see Mallory Square and the cruise ships arriving(which by the way-their horns are a bit on the loud side). There is also a pretty big hot tub that compliments the shape of the pool. The thing that i loved the best about this resort was the location which is '0 Duval St.'-so just down the road is anything and everything. There was a CVS right next to the hotel which was very convenient. We brought our own bikes to ride around town,(they do have rentals as well) which i recommend because it gives you a chance to see quite a bit of the city and just stop anywhere to grab a drink or take a picture:) This is a great romantic place to stay if you are planning a trip to Key West and want to be just a hop skip and jump from the action:)

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic time”
Reviews.Author: kieranfox
Reviews.Content: The Ocean Key is a wonderful hotel at the end of Duval Street. We had a Junior Suite which was a nice size, comfy beds with a great view of the ocean. Special mention to Carl on the front desk who was always very attentive and friendly - he definitely contributed to making our stay as great as it was. Really couldn't fault this place. Will definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time”
Reviews.Author: nyctraveler222
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ocean Key over July 4th weekend for 3 nights. The location is amazing (right at the very end of Duvall Street by the water), and everything is within arm's reach. We did not have a car - just walked everywhere. You can also rent bicycles, scooters, or electric cars. The hotel was very romantic and service was great. The staff was very friendly and went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed. Our room was cleaned every morning and then again in the evening, just in time for bed! Had breakfast at the Hot Tin Roof, and it was delicious. The concierge also helped us book an all day cruise/adventure trip through Fury - which was tons of fun and a great deal. I definitely recommend it, as it comes with food and we got to go snorkeling, jet-skiing, and parasailing!

Reviews.Title: “Just like the pictures on their website”
Reviews.Author: Gayle74
Reviews.Content: We were on a family trip to Florida with my brothers, sister and dad and I wanted to treat my husband to one night on our own and chose the Ocean Key Resort. It was expensive but worth the money as we had a really relaxing time which was needed after the drive down! Our room had a great view out over the pool to the sunset so we could just sit on the balcony and watch the sun go down. We followed this by dinner at the Hot Tin roof restaurant where the food and service was great. If you are like me and suffer from heat rash the air con in the rooms was amazing to the point where my husband wanted to go to bed with all his clothes on whereas I just felt chilled. Obviously this was my choice of temperature so you don't have to be cold! For the final luxury we had room service breakfast on the balcony. Food was good and worth the cost and service quick. If you want one perfect night in the Keys then this is the place to go and as I said everything looked exactly like it does on their website.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay! Wonderful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Arnie67
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend stay at this beautiful hotel and had a wonderful time. We had a 5th floor ocean view room that looked over the Pier, Marina and Sunset. You couldn't get a room any closer to the water. It was beautiful. The room had a 2 televisions (one a flat screen), a big king size bed (one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in) and a nice indoor sitting area with a couch and chair. It also had French doors that opened to a nice sitting area on the balcony with 2 chairs and a table. The bathroom was huge. It has 2 sinks, dressing table and a closet. The bathtub/ shower was also a Jacuzzi and overlooked the bedroom (see pictures). All very nicely decorated. Maid service was always prompt and efficient and turndown service was a nice touch. On a side note the toiletries we really nice - much nicer than what I find in other hotels. We ordered room service one morning and it was quick and the food was good. They set it up on the balcony, white table cloth and all. They also brought up a newspaper with it. We used the valet several times and never waited more than a few minutes for our car. The hotel staff was great and we were always greeted with a smile whether we were coming or going. They were all very cheerful and greeting guest seemed to be the norm. Very nice touch. Its easy to see why this hotel is so highly ranked on this site and others. It is easy to recommend this hotel to anyone. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again and I hope to do so again.

Reviews.Title: “A Top-Notch Resort!”
Reviews.Author: YoItsHawkes
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just returned from an exceptional 3-night stay at the Ocean Key. We both had a tough time leaving! Upon arrival we were taken to our room by a very polite and knowledgeable bellboy (note: a Key West bellboy entails shorts and a Hawaiian shirt and "right on" affirmations) that described all the hotel amenities and local recommendations. Our room was very spacious & bright but still had a homey feel to it. The bed was extremely comfortable (we opted for the King) and the balcony provided privacy with relaxed seating. We were also intrigued by the shower, which offers a glass pane to see thru (with the option to close off with sliding closet doors). The bathroom is also nice with his & her's sinks but the toilet is not seperate from the main bathroom (no door). In the living space there is a separate couch and chairs in front a large flat-screen TV (there's a 2nd smaller TV in the closet in front of the bed). The closet & drawer space was somewhat limited but ample. But what's best about the Ocean Key is the LOCATION! Our room looked right down onto Mallory Square with a tiny view of the ocean. It's the first address on Duval St. and is seconds away from the hot spots (we recommend Irish Kevin's for a good crowd with humor, RICK's upstairs for a younger dance crowd, Sloppy Joe's for live music and sports). The pool also looks out onto the ocean and is absolutely gorgeous. I had read some reviews that it could get packed but we experienced no such crowds (a few scattered couples relaxing). There was one cruise ship on Tuesday morning which did limit the view and really flood the town with fanny-pack wearing tourists - I would call and see when cruise ships come in to try and avoid those days as much as possible. We also rented a scooter RIGHT across the street from the main entrance. The grounds at Ocean Key are kept in pristine shape and all the greenery looks really lush. We hardly saw any of the groundscrew and the ones that we did encounter were very polite internationals. We had an issue with our billing which was taking care of very quickly and politely and they gladly held our luggage until it was time to fly out. The only MINOR issue we had was one night when some loud (and presumably drunk) people in the room next to us were carrying on and we couldn't sleep (1:30AMish). They said security would take care of it (I believe they called their room but didn't actually come up). Needless to say, the walls are pretty thin and we could hear every word being said. It was a bit pricey (avg. $315/night) but well worth it for accomodations and location. I would recommend the Ocean Key to anyone visiting Key West for the 1st or 1000th time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ocean Key!”
Reviews.Author: sunhshine
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at this fantastic hotel. It is in the most perfect spot in KW. The staff are all 1st class - nothing is too much trouble for them. The reception area smells absolutely lovely from the spa - sort of coconutty!! We were allocated a room overlooking Mallory Square on arrival and asked if we could be moved to a room with an ocean view? Within 20 mins they had upgraded us to a lovely suite with a huge balcony on the front of the building with views over the ocean and on the corner of Duval (right above where the glass bottom boat leaves from). The suite had a huge lounge with massive flat screen tv, lots of furniture inc a dining table and french doors out to the balcony. We had a seperate kingsize bedroom with a really good/deep jacuzzi in the corner and french doors out to the balcony. There was also a 2nd tv. There was a dressing area with twin washbasins and dressing table. And finally a shower-room with lovely toiletries. The pool and sundeck area are fantastic and the perfect place to watch the sunset. A lot less crowded than Mallory sq. We actually sat in the outdoor spa one night and it was very relaxing. The waitress service by the pool was also 1st class. Sunset Pier was great, but very busy. The Hot Tin Roof restaurant (outside) for breakfast was very good and the view has to be the best in KW!! When I return to KW I know where I will be staying!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NJ_BND
Reviews.Content: We had a great time here, the hotel was fantastic and you can't beat the location. The staff was the most attentive I've ever come across. Proposed to my then girlfiend, now fiance' while we were there and the staff found out. Later that evening we had a bottle of chanpange show up in our room compliments of the staff. It was a really nice experience. I would absolutely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - saved our vacation!”
Reviews.Author: HBW08
Reviews.Content: After discovering our first hotel was not what we expected, we were lucky enough to find an affordable room at Ocean Key. We were able to check in within 15 minutes of booking the room over the phone. Upon check in, they upgraded our room from a queen room to a king room with a living area. When we entered the room, we found a nice bathroom, a comfortable bed and a small tv, a sitting area with a couch and a 2nd huge LCD TV, and a small balcony with a great view. The location is excellent - within easy walking distance to all the great sites in Key West. The hotel restaurant Hot Tin Roof was great, and the Sunset Pier Bar was alot of fun with a great view. The hotel has a great Concierge service that will have a bike or scooter delivered to you or set you up with a tour. At check out, the staff was very nice, and stored our luggage for a few hours before we had to catch our flight. This was a great hotel with wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “The Ocean Key Resort Is Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: thedeb
Reviews.Content: I went with two friends for four nights to celebrate one of their birthdays. We chose it for the location and the water views. When we first arrived the man at the desk said they had already upgraded us from a Junior suite and that we had a great view. When we got to the room it was on the second floor and looked out on Mallory Square, past some parked cars. We would have been ok with this if the guy at the desk did not get our hopes up, but since he had, we told him we were not happy with the room and wanted something with a better view. WOW, did they come through! We went from a Junior Suite which was one big room with a living room area and balcony, to a two bedroom two bath suite with a full kitchen, a washer and dryer and a view of the Sunset Pier bar, with turquoise water and boats! In the late afternoon we would just listen to the excellent singer on the Pier while having drinks on our own terrace balcony. We saved money by having a kitchen and having our coffee there and drinks and snacks in the afternoon. The pool was lovely, but small- only one of us used it, and only one time (crowded). We had breakfast at their restaurant "Hot Tin Roof" and the food and view were great- service was slow. The housekeeping staff was wonderful and attentive. The one drawback (and there is nothing anyone can do) is the rooster under our window crowing from four AM. If you get a room higher up that would likely help. There were very nice high-end toiletries in the room. They had a spa but we did not use it. We did have drinks and appetizers on Sunset Pier and that was great. There was very nice landscaping, it felt safe there and above all, we were thrilled that we got upgraded for my friend's 50th birthday! They even brought her up a piece of Key Lime Pie for breakfast that morning. We would all stay here again- I have stayed at the hotel right next door, the Pier House, (also nice) but I preferred this one for the view and the location. The young, international staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Everything perfect !”
Reviews.Author: itsbeeroclock
Reviews.Content: Ocean Key Resort has many things going for it. It is in a great location at the end of Duval Street - the main street in Key West - right on the ocean with wonderful views of the sunset. It is just far enough away from the bars etc so you don't get any noise at night. My room was fantastic - a suite with kitchenette, big open plan sitting room with a balcony, a great big bed and smart bathroom with jacuzzi. Very clean and comfortable. Nice pool with good poolside service. The staff were really friendly and helpful. The spa was good although a bit pricey. I think this is the best part of town to be in too - you can walk to everything easily. I hired a bike to look round the island. This is not the cheapest hotel on the island but you very definately get excellent value for you money here and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ocean Key”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeDe
Reviews.Content: Booked this on short notice on lastminutedeals.com because another resort didn't have us in a room without stairs. Called ahead and asked if they could give us a room with min walking to elevators and they not only did so, but upgraded us from a Jr Suite to a double bedroom. Very nice and huge room overlooking Duval street. It is expensive, but the great rooms and excellent location justify the cost Othewise, I can only say location. location, location. This resort is right on the water at the foot of Duval st, so it is right next to Mallory Square, about 3 blocks from Sloppy Joes, and a couple of more blocks to the seaport places. They do charge for vbalet parking, but everything is so close you can skip the car. Take the Conch Train Tour or Rent a scooter for a day if you want to see more of the area. Don't miss the Turtle Races at Turtle Krawls every Mon and Froi at 6PM.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Ocean Key and can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: Olivia035
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the last three nights of our holiday after visiting other parts of florida and loved the Hotel and the Keys. We arrived early after a long drive and were allowed to check in straight away. We had booked a junior suite but were given a 2 bedroom suite which was amazing. Our children had their own bedroom and bathroom and the views overlooking the ocean were wonderful. The hotel was expensive but we felt it was worth it. Apart from the accomdation we used the pool, restaurant and Sunset Pier. All the service was very good and reasonably priced. We loved seeing the cruise ships from the pool and did not experience any noise from our room from the ships. There was so much to do in the keys and we found it very lively and we would stay at the Ocean Key again as the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Seems it hasn't changed a bit!”
Reviews.Author: PatNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ocean Key several years ago and after reading some of the reviews, I see that not much has changed. It is a nice hotel at a great location but it does have a lot of issues. I went with my boyfriend and my nephew. We stayed in a room with a king-sixed bed and a sofa bed for my nephew. Well, for almost $500/night, we had to make the sofa bed. All the linens were inside a trunk in front of the sofa. I think for that price they should have made the bed for us. We also had an "ocean view," which was really a view of a cruise ship. Mercifully, after the second day the cruise ship left and we had our view back. When I booked the room, we had some sort of package that included a bottle of champagne. On the third day, I realized it was never delivered and ordered the champagne about 5 o'clock and asked if we could have it around 7 before we went out to dinner. It showed up way after we left for dinner. When we got back it was sitting in an ice bucket with melted ice. The location is spectacular with great views, but that is all you are paying for.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Joestrata
Reviews.Content: Let's get one thing out of the way. This place does cost a lot of $. If your going to stay here I would say definitely make sure you get an ocean view. We stayed in room 516 and the view was absolutely awesome! We had the pool right below us, all the action of Mallory Square right behind and we we're practically right above the ocean! The views we're just amazing! There were cruise ships as someone stated on some days, but by no means hampered the beautiful views. As for the location. Everything was literally just a couple minute walk always. Also very convenient was having a CVS right next door in case you need anything in particular. Which you will, believe me. The room is stocked with beverages and snacks but at a very steep price. We bought our own needs and used the refrigerator which they had no problem with us using. Room came with a Jacuzzi which was very nice and a bathroom with a beautiful stand up shower. Only complaint which is a small one is was the pool area. They have three cabanas which are used by the guests and plenty of lounge chairs which are accompanied with towels. Not that this is the hotels fault but something could be done. Some people like to go down and throw a book or whatever on a chair to save it in the morning and don't actually use it until the afternoon. It's rude and maybe should be monitored by the hotel. Not a big deal. Cocktails and food very good and the staff was very helpful our whole stay. Like I said, this place is pricey, but it was our first trip to Key West and if your going to come here on vacation, do it right and try this place out. You won't regret a penny spent!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with some issues”
Reviews.Author: travelmeMaine
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ocean Key resort for 5 nights in April and had a reasonably good time there.
