This hotel sets the bar really high for itself with its glossy web site and eclectic vibe it tries to give. Unfortunately they really didn't meet our full expectations as we had hoped they would. We arrived early in Key West and pre-arranged for an early check in and a high floor, but that didn't happen as the rooms were not ready yet and we were never put above the 3rd floor. I say never because we ended up switching rooms twice. Our first room was an awesome open floor Junior suite with a brand new big screen LCD TV and it overlooked Duval Street. Even though we didn't plan on watching much TV we were impressed that a hotel would have them. We loved this room, but it had some issues. The hair dryer did not work, the shower handle fell off and the air conditioning did not work properly. We were forced to move the first day due to no AC. They were nice and gave us 4 free breakfast coupons at the Hot Tin Roof for our trouble and we were very impressed with that. We were then moved to another room on the same floor. This was also considered a Junior Suite but was laid out very differently with a cramped living room area, mirrors all over the walls and a bedroom down a narrow hall. We were happy to also see a new big screen LCD TV in this room as well. It had a hot tub (surrounded by mirrors as well) in the bedroom and a very cramped bathroom with only a toilet and shower. The sink was in another narrow hallway on the other side of the hot tub from the hallway that led from the living room area. The hair dryer was broken in this room too. We stayed there one night and did not enjoy it. I called to see if they had the same type of open floor suite available as we wanted to move. Also a higher floor would be nice. They did have one on the other side of the hotel overlooking Mallory Square and we were quickly moved to that side of the hotel. I noticed I was charged for using the minibar in the second room and I had not. I called and they researched and took the charge off. Very wise to check your tab on the TV while staying there and make sure it is accurate. The third room was again a very nice suite like the first one we had but still on the third floor. I kind of had the feeling too that the hotel was not at capacity and they could have easily moved us higher but did not because we booked on Travelocity and got a fairly reasonable rate. Palm trees blocked most of the view in the third room. It was also missing the large LCD TV which was a bit of letdown but we were fine without it. Also the door to the balcony did not lock which could have been a security issue but we did not complain as we were on the third floor. We remained in this room for the rest of our stay. Housekeeping did a good job and the entire staff at the hotel was very friendly. Only two ice machines exist on the property and they are very hard to find as they were hidden behind lattice work. The breakfast at the Hot Tin Roof was excellent. When we left we were very impressed with the night manager who sensed we had some issues and comped our parking charge. The staff definitely made up for the room issues. The location of this hotel is the best in Key West with many activities going on. I would stay at this hotel again but might check a few other places as well. This hotel is nice but doesn't live up to it's own high expectations it sets for itself.

Reviews.Title: “cruise ships ruin trip”
Reviews.Author: Venturagal
Reviews.Content: We paid 800.00 a night to stay in ocean front in room 417. We were so happy when we arrived at check in. The suite was large, clean and lovely. We had a lovely ocean view and large balcony. The next morning i woke up to what i thought was a looming cloud and thunder. No, it was a HUGE cruise ship that we were told later carried 5,000 people parked literally 20 feet away obstructing any view of the ocean. EVERY DAY the cruise ships pulled up at 5am and honked their horns loudly and left at 4pm. Since the pool is beach front, that is what you also see all day. The pool is also very small for a hotel this nice. There were 40 chairs (i counted). Albeit, very nice and comfy chairs with great poolside service and an above average pool side food and bar grill. But still, with 40 chairs, things fill up fast. The room itself is nice with comfy linens, a large bathroom and great room service; i love the room. Unfortuntely there is more to a vacation than a room. Room service was fantastic and housecleaning will come at the time that you ask which is a nice touch. This hotel is located within walking distance to all of the stores and restaurants, although i found the nicest and most upscale store to be in our own hotel. The 2nd day, frustrated with the cruise ship thing, i went downstairs to shop in our hotel store. The nice woman warned me of the constant credit card thefts that locals businesses do. Here is the scam. You buy a teeshirt worth 20.00. They somehow are able to add extra numbers to your bill. So a 20.00 bill can turn into a 200.00 bill. I thanked the woman and used cash the rest of the trip thinking that nothing like that would happen b/c i was shopping at reputable stores on the main street. Well, guys, she was right. I was taken for 600.00 and now have had to cancel my debit card, etc. What a nightmare. Key West is beautiul with Neat bars. Great food. Weather to die for. But beware of all of the local scams that seem to be prevalent. After complaining to the hotel manager Syd about the cruise ship thing, he concurred and said that he understood and would try to get us some sort of compensation. Since we booked through a travel agency, we could not get reimburse that second. So buyer beware. I am not saying do not stay herel it is a lovely hotel. Do not stay in a room with an ocean view as there is none. I would think long and hard before staying here again and I would never pay for anything with a credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location but ...”
Reviews.Author: beachboundblonde
Reviews.Content: The Ocean Key Resort is located right on Mallory Square and has gorgeous views of the Gulf. The rooms decor was fun and bright & the restaurant Hot Tin Roof was amazing and had excellent food and service. We had a lovely view from our balcony. The support staff from housekeeping & room service were helpful, professional & very nice. We did have some problems with our room. The kitchen appliances were very dated yet all but the dryer seemed to function properly. We had a 1 bedroom suite and our kids slept on the fold out couch. This was the worst mattress I have ever seen. It sagged in the middle & some of the springs were sticking out. I called housekeeping and asked for a new mattress, they didn't have one, but brought up extra blankets. The next day I called again & then later spoke with someone at the front desk and asked if it could be replaced. We came back to the room & a mattress was in the hall next to our door. We thought this was the old mattress because it looked so bad. This actually was the replacement! At this point we gave up. We also had a problem with one of the windows whistling due to strong winds. I really was disappointed because the hotels did not meet my expectations, and we were paying over $500 per night. I felt the the front desk staff could have been more helpful & could have had better follow up. I hindsight I should have asked to see a manager. Ask before you book to see if they've replaced the fold out sofas' mattresses.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ocean Key!”
Reviews.Author: From Swanzey
Reviews.Content: We originally booked a room at the Banana Bay Resort in Marathon. I think we were there about 5 minutes and started looking for somewhere else! Found the Ocean key in the phone book and had no idea what to expect. When we arrived I was thrilled! Gorgeous...beautiful hotel! We had a room overlooking the the pool and Mallory Square...had a great view of the sunset! The service was great and there was lots to do within walking distance!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect position and staff, less than perfect rooms”
Reviews.Author: WesK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here March 4 â€“ 6, 2008. We booked through Virgin Holidays and were given a fifth-floor room on the East side with an indirect ocean view (507), which meant you had to lean over the small balcony rail to see the sea. The best sides are the North or West sides which have views over the sea, Mallory Square and the sunset. The staff who greeted us were friendly and throughout our stay the staff were great and very helpful. Note that they have valet parking which costs $20 a day. Youâ€™re unlikely to use your car if youâ€™re only staying a few days. The room was small but with a massive bed and you really had to climb up to get in to it. The wardrobe/closet was painted in garish stripes (green, pink, yellow etc.) and looked like a carnival tent or Punch and Judy show tent, if you know what that is â€“ rather strange. The table and desk were also painted like that. The bathroom was clean but to get into the shower/bath you had to climb over a ledge/step that was at least 18 inches high and 18 in. deep so it is not for larger people or anyone with mobility difficulties. The shower was fairly feeble and the TV was old. We were not over-impressed. On our last night we upgraded to room 523 on the Western side. This was a considerably larger and nicer room with a view directly over Mallory Square, the quay and the sea. We much preferred this except for two things: much of the paint and dÃ©cor in the room was peeling and discoloured and it needed a makeover; and secondly, there was a trail of tiny Florida ants running down the wall, across the desk, across the bed, over the washbasins and beyond. I killed a large number and when we were going out for the evening we asked reception if they could send someone up to the room to spray it. They were very apologetic and insisted on giving us a free breakfast the next morning. When we returned to the room later nothing had changed and the ants were still on the march, which prevented my wife from sleeping properly that night. We reported this again when we checked out and again they were very apologetic and waived the parking charges for our stay, which was good of them. As I said the staff were at all times friendly and helpful. We only had a continental breakfast but the restaurant it was in was beautiful with fantastic views over the ocean and the staff were fine. A tip if you stay here. In the evening when everyone gathers on the quay to watch the sunset, go to the rather nice but small pool area of the hotel. This faces West and is only a few feet from the sea but is raised about 4 feet over the rest of Mallory Square so you get a good uninterrupted view of the sunset. In summary, we loved Key West and this was a good hotel but with strange dÃ©cor in the rooms and some rooms need a makeover.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location”
Reviews.Author: captdave_8
Reviews.Content: We've visited Key West at least every other year for 25 years. Tip: If you are older than 30, avoid the 6 week period of "Spring Break" during all of March and half of April. This Hotel could not be located at a better place for tourists! All the fun and great restaurants and the "Sunset Ritual" are a short walk ! The hotel staff are generally friendly and helpful however there are some short comings not expected at rates in excess of $320 nightly. When the hotel is full you will have to run down maid service to get towels,etc. The ice machines are not at all convenient. The sinks in the Jr. Suites do not hold water, I asked for a stopper so I could shave, which never arrived. The suite had a ton of room but the design was not optimized. A room this size should easily accomodate a fridge,microwave, safe and kitchen sink ! Would we stay there again ? Absolutely Yes ; David M. St. Simons, GA

Reviews.Title: “Romantic”
Reviews.Author: vestlendingen07
Reviews.Content: Came to Key West and did not have a hotel room. Came to this hotel, and got excellent help, and a good price on a room with ocean view. For me this was a fantastic hotel, where spending valentines day was PERFECT. The room was clean, and the view was fantastic. We absolutely loved it, and thought it was worth the price!!

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay...a little pricey tho”
Reviews.Author: IRISHGIRL767
Reviews.Content: We booked our vacation through our travel agent. So she picked this hotel and we booked it 2 wks before we were to leave. So we had take what was offered. Our stay was during Feb Vacation week 2/18 - 2/22/08. This wasn't our first time in Key West but the 1st time we stayed in Key West. Zero Duval St...you can't get a better location. Your to the right of Mallory Square. Right at the beginning of Duval St. Bars, shops and restaraunts in abundance. We were booked for an island view jr suite. Upon check in we were told we were upgraded to an island view 2 bedroom suite! SWEET! My 10yr daughter had her own room, tv and bathroom...I never had a vacation like that when I was 10...lol. The suite was quite spacious, with a nicely funky decorated living room/dining room that had french doors open onto a patio with very comfy furniture. We had a kitchen, which we didn't really use. Our room had a king bed and double bowl sink/ a section with a vanity and then the "bathroom" had a toilet and shower stall. We had a whirlpool tub in our room. One thing you have to understand is that in Key West, cats and rooster run the streets. They are everywhere. So if you have an issue with either, this (Key West) is not the place for you to vacation. We laughed on our first morning when we had some rather windy and rainy weather in the early am. A rooster found refuge in the bushes outside our patio with his woman and woke us at 7am. We thought it was funny. Through the Palm trees you could see Christmas Island and Sunset Pier. I thought it would be noisy because they had live entertainment but it wasn't. We closed the doors anyway. (air conditioning aaahhhhh) We had an end suite, so the only noise we could hear was from the people on the floor above...which I thought was weird. Never noticed that anywhere before. The staff was great except the pool area. We had to sit on chaises farthest from the pool and the girl that was supposed to be taking orders ignored us. Only issue I had with that hotel. They are stringing up plants to block the view of the parking garage on the ground level. We had great service and great food at the Hot Tin Rest. for breakfast. Same for the Sunset pier. We did however get robbed out of one night of the sunset, due to clouds, which is no fault of the hotel...lol ;-). We are considering heading back there next year too. And will probably stay at Ocean Key again. I don't however want to pay $600 a night. But I think I will stick with the island view rooms as they seem to be on the quiter side of the hotel from other reviews I've read. In my opinion, overall, it was a very nice hotel. beds were extremely comfortable, staff (especially bell hops) were great. Great attitudes. But I wouldn't rent a car. We didn't use ours and it cost us $21.50/day just to have them park it in the garage. There is enough things to rent that you don't need a car. And most things are within walking distance. We actually walked to the southernmost point from our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK, not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: mooneysox
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ocean Key Resort for one night. Booked a "Love the one you're with" package through AAA. Great location, nice pool, nice deck and great pier. Their service is very good and the food in the restaurant was very good with a great presentation. Stayed in a suite that was just renovated and had a cool Bahamian motif. It overlooked Mallory and the ocean with a great sunset view. So, what's wrong. Firstly, it was very noisy. Not just Mallory Square revellers, but anyone that walked down the hallway who seemed to be speaking in a normal tone, the people above walking or flushing their toilet, it could all be heard loud and clear. Match that the with local flavor: roosters that start up at 4 AM and continue every few minutes until after dawn, and their sound echoing through the center of the hotel buildings and into our room, it was a bit hard to sleep. They could probably make some changes in the hallways or doorways that could help this alot. The second thing that's less exciting is that it just has the feel of a cheaper hotel, from the cars parked below with no effort made at screening them off from pedestrians and the spackled hallways, it's nice, but just isn't at the level of styling and service that you expect when spending the >$750 a night they want for a suite. There are many better options in Key West for much less.

Reviews.Title: “luxury”
Reviews.Author: jojopstar
Reviews.Content: We paid a lot for this stay, but it was a case of you get what you pay for in this instance. Great service from all members of staff, spacious room with quirky fun decor, balcony which overlooked the water (although obstructed by trees so be careful to check that out), lovely pool area right next to the sea, efficient valet parking, great location at the end of Duval Street - an ideal base for doing some exploring on foot. The Sunset Pier bar is right next door - well worth a visit for some food on the water. We had a room next to the celebration square & were originally concerned it would be noisy, but it wasn't at all. Enjoyed staying at this hotel very much.

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you don't pay too much”
Reviews.Author: sandid
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights in a partial oceanview jr suite and paid $249 per night. I felt like everything was just ok there. Nothing was outstanding. If you are going to book an oceanfront room, be warned that the cruise ships block the view on some days. If this is important to you, stay at the Hyatt which is down far enough that the cruise ships do not block the view.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Get Hurt”
Reviews.Author: celticmum
Reviews.Content: Was hurt while at the resort and need surgery to correct. The hotel is trying to skirt its responsibility. Horrible experience and I have stayed at 5 star hotels all my life. This is my first experience being injured at a hotel and cannot believe the way I'm being treated. So, watch where you walk, sit or stand there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views !!!”
Reviews.Author: SOBE07
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our 30th Wedding Anniversary at this excellent resort and were given an upgrade to an ocean view room on arrival. The view from the balcony was breathtaking and allowed great visual access to the evening entertainment at Mallory Square and the spectacular sunset. Although the resort is being upgraded, the noise and general work being undertaken did not spoil our three night stay. The reception staff, bar and restaurant staff were all very helpful and attentive and the food at the Hot Tin Roof restaurant was superb. We especially enjoyed the large spa bath in our room which was most relaxing after a day exploring the delights of Key West.. We look forward to returning here with friends and family in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not wonderful”
Reviews.Author: alwaystravelling8
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews and seen the price of a room, we were expecting a higher standard. Firstly, it is not a "resort" in the true sense of the word. It has a small pool and small areas for sun loungers. It has a pier with tables where food and drinks are served, but this is open to the public and can be very busy. It also has a spa. The majority of the ground level is taken up with car parking - at $20 a night - but it is useful to have parking available. Rather oddly, you have to walk out of the hotel and through the car park to reach the lifts to most of the rooms. The lifts are ancient and not in keeping with a hotel in this price range. As they are currently renovating the hotel it is possible the lifts will also be renovated. On the plus side, the rooms are large and ours had an equally large bathroom with whirlpool bath and separate shower. Only a single wash basin though. The staff were friendly and appeared to be well trained, but at times one had the feeling they were working to a well rehearsed script. In a nutshell, a very nice hotel, but you are paying for the position, adjoining both Duval Street and Mallory Square. If you stay there, insist on a room with a view of the Square and/or the sea.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful New Year's Stay at Ocean Key”
Reviews.Author: TravelChic214
Reviews.Content: We checked in on New Year's Eve - Just before sunset. Upon check in I was told we had been upgraded to an ocean view, newly renovated room (we had booked a partial ocean view). We were promptly taken up to our room and we were pleasantly surprised by the view, size, and general appearance of the room. Our room overlooked the pier and we were just in time for sunset - which was spectacular. We enjoyed the balcony by having some cocktails and ordering room service for dinner. When I called for room service I was told 20 minutes - which I thought was great, considering room service is almost always 30-45 min. WELL, the 20 minutes turned to 50! When we finally got our food we had no salad dressing! We had to call back and the server had to return with the dressing. He was polite and apologized for the wait and the dressing and explained "we are just so busy". The food was good - not great. Back to the room: The room was FABULOUS! We loved the view - the balcony - the decor - the bathroom was huge with a very romantic whirlpool tub which opened into the room. There was a large sitting area and two TV's in the room...the room was quite spacious for the two of us. The mini bar was stocked - complete with wine glasses. The teddy bear on the bed was a comforting touch. Overall, we enjoyed our short two night stay. The location cannot be beat...although we rented an electric car to get around - everything is walking distance - the hotel is on Duval St. - making it the ideal location. We usually only stay at 4 or 5 star hotels/resorts and for the $599+ price tag here we did feel as though we got alot of room for the price (in terms of size and view), however, there were some areas that need improvement to completely justify the price tag (see below for list of dislikes). Overall - Great room, friendly, helpful staff, great ocean front location. LIKES: The ROOM! Clean, bright, airy, lovely ocean front balcony, romantic and comfortable. Location! The best! Watch the sunset - boats - all from your balcony! Walk to everything! NO KIDS! This is not a place for young children. We did not see one. So, no loud screaming in the hallways!!! :) Friendly, helpful staff. Water activites right out your door - boats, jet ski's, etc. Now for the DISLIKES: Room tempature is controlled by the hotel - we could not change the temp from the pre set 71 degrees. The noise from our upstair neighbors - they were really LOUD and woke us up several times during the night with banging (we were on the 3rd floor). The fact that the hotel is built around the parking area - we had to walk through the parking area to leave the hotel - so it was not pretty - there were roosters all over - yes, I mean loud roosters! The stairwells were quite dirty. Food could be better and room service needs improvement. Please don't let our few dislikes prevent you from staying here - we enjoyed our stay and look forward to coming back! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Narsi
Reviews.Content: Ocean Key Resort is a great location, by the water at the end of Duval Street. An easy walk to most of the touristy part of Key West. Our junior suite was very comfortable. The swimming pool location is fantastic and a great place to view the sunset. Th e gym was pretty good. My daughter tried the spa and was really happy with the services. The front desk staff were very helpful and courteous. The bellmen were indifferent. One of the elevators was not working while we were there and there did not seem to be any attempt being made to get it fixed. There was an awful smell near the elevators. Not sure what was causing it, but it never went away while we were there. We ended up using a bank of elevators on the other side of the hotel to avoid the smell. A good, but not great choice, to stay in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Before you die, give it a try”
Reviews.Author: Flitter
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 423 last week and I love this hotel. The room was called a 'junior suite' which consisted of a large bedroom with balcony overlooking Mallory Sq and the sea, a huge bathroom with whirlpool bath and shower and a seperate room with settee, 2nd tv drinks etc. Staff were very good and the location cannot be beaten. There is still some work in progress but it did not affect us at all and the improvements will be for us all to enjoy. You can hear some live music from the 'Hogsbreath' if you venture home too early, so turn around and go and enjoy it before it's to late. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Once again - brilliant!!!”
Reviews.Author: kenandbren
Reviews.Content: This was our second vist to Key West and the Ocean Key Resort and we were not disappointed. Everything was as we imagined it would be. Our room overlooked Mallory Square and the Gulf and it was great to sit on the balcony and watch the entertainers and the sunset each evening. The resort is situated at the end of Duval Street and only a short stroll to the many bars and restaurants. The staff at the Ocean Key are more than helpful and go out of their way to make your stay memorable. We ate breakfast each morning at the Hot Tin Roof and both the food and the views were wonderful. The pool staff are very attentive and the cold towels and iced strawberry drinks were a nice touch We love Key West - it is our favourite of all the places we have visited and we have booked to go again next year staying, of course, at the Ocean Key Resort. We wouldn't consider anywhere else. CAN'T WAIT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overated”
Reviews.Author: cruiserap
Reviews.Content: Having read some excellent reviews of this property we arrived with high expectations. Unfortunately these were not entirely met. WE arrived early and were informed the room would not be ready until after 2pm (although we had rerquested early check in.) At 2pm the room was not ready and also at 3pm. WE overheard the reception staff laughing about the customers rooms not being available. WE had booked the sensory overload package direct with the hotel, The advertised one bedroom boutique suite actually turned out to be a larger bedroom with setee, but it did overlook the Malory Square and the pool.It was well decorated but had no in room safe. After turn down my wife noticed that the bedlinen had stains , hairs and creases indicating that the bed had not been changed from the previous customers. She spoke to the reception at 7.30 and when we returend from Dinner ( which was excellent at the Hot Tin Roof) two new sheets had been left on the bed! Whilst speaking to the young teenage 'Duty Manager' he explained that the eastern european staff did not always understand his requests. He gave us some breakfast vouchers and when we returned to the room the linen had been changed. There is alot of building work going on, but you somehow feel you are an inconvenience to the hotel, always having to go to the undercover car parking area to access the lifts and ice machines. Late checkout was not an option as they had incoming guests to the room. We found the pool staff to be short handed when you didnt order food or drink. The toilet facilities at the pool area were filthy. The breakfast food and service was excellent. This is an expensive property and in our opinion does not offer good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: ToonTowner
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was immaculate and had a great view. The pier was a great place to watch the sunset. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: gwallis1
Reviews.Content: Arrived Thurs 18th October stayed for 4 days. Hotel staff were very professional and had us booked into our room in no time at all. Car was parked and bags brought upto our room within minutes. There is a lot of refurbishemt work still going on but we were never disturbed by any noise Room 307 was clean and spacious with 1 Queen size bed in which was bigger than a Super King Size bed in the UK and had a nice view over the Gulf of Mexico. We ate at the Hot tin Roof Cafe for breakfast each morning and it was good to watch the cruise ships coming in and people watching from there. Pool area although small is more than adaquete with Alena looking after us making sure we had drinks and food whenever we needed them. The bringing cold face towels round just to cool you off and an iced strawberry drink round the pool where some nice little touches. The only 2 reasons I have not rated 5 stars is the smell of petrol fumes on the ground floor as you are going to the lifts for your rooms. Granted the smell was not in the rooms but it was not a great welcoming smell. The other was a false Fire alarm at 7 am one morning ( Although it did make us get up and see a fantastic Sun Rise ) We did not hear the Roosters but we did see a big pussy cat in the grounds so maybe its chased them off. Other than that I would recommend anyone to stay here

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Josie630
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter & I recently returned from a 4 day stay @ Ocean Key. Neither of us had been to Key West, before. WOW! Is the best way to describe it! Not just the resort, but the whole island...WOW! We booked the 2 BR, harborside suite. It was HUGE! Each BR had it's own full bath (plus a hot-tub). Full kitchen w/range/stove. microwave, toaster, coffeemaker & full size refegerater/freezer. Dining area & family room. 3 TV's (1 in each BR & 1 in family room). We could have moved in & lived there, comfortably, forever. It was clean & we loved the handpainted, decorative furntiure. The location is perfect w/Mallory Sq. to your right & Duvall street straight ahead. Sunset pier is fun. We went @ sunset & enjoyed the singer, food & people watching. Be sure to go to Mallory Square @ sunset also. There are 2 sections to Mallory Sq. One is all shops & restaurant & bars, the other is located next to the water (where the cruise ships come in). Go to the one next to the water @ approx. 6:00 PM. The street performers there are amazing! You can buy a beer @ the little kiosk & watch half a dozen terrific entertainers, form tightrope walkers to jugglers & everything inbetween. So much fun! One last thing about Key West.....At the opposite end of Duvall St., approx. 1.25 miles (you can walk) is the Butterfly House. OMG! It is SOOO awesome. It is a conservatory housing small birds, exotic plants, flowers& thousands of butterflys! You pay $10.00 to enter & when you walk in, it is stunning! The butterflys are EVERYWHERE! They land on your head, arms, camera, shoulders, etc. There are butterflys of every shape & color. It looks like the Garden of Eden! So worth the walk & entrance fee! Back to Ocean Key, we had breakfast @ Hot Tin Roof & it was amazing. We ate dinner elsewhere as there are hundreds of restaurants within walking distance. (Excellent she-crap soup @ Crabby Dicks, 712 Duval St.). The staff @ Ocean Key is friendly & helpful. Construction is still going on & is annoying, but it will be even more beautiful when completed. You cannot go wrong @ this resort. It has it all. My daughter enjoyed a massage @ the spa. The pool is tiny & half the right side of the hotel overlooks it, as well as the restaurant, so you do not have any privacy, (if that is a concern to you). We would definitely stay here again! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, perfect location, even surpassed the Hyatt from last year”
Reviews.Author: Neil&Sue
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and really didn't want to leave. Our experience was just great. Last year we had stayed at the nearby Hyatt and loved that, this was even better. We had booked a suite some months before, and on arrival found that the hotel pool (and part of the hotel) was under renovation (a big initial disappointment). The reception staff could not have been more helpful and accommodating. We were immediately offered breakfast vouchers which turned out to be magnificent. We were shown to our booked room, which was lovely, but then offered the next suite up which was truly fabulous and very comfortable. Seperate bedroom, lounge and kitchen, lovely bathroom with a deep spa bath. The hotel laid on a taxi to take you to an alternative pool which was just perfect at the other end of Duval Street (Southernmost Hotel). All the staff simply couldn't do too much to make the stay perfect. The food at the Hot Tin Roof restaurant was excellent; and setting just idealic (almost as good as the Princeville on Kauai). The Noble Benedict breakfast was to die for (we will happily pay for it next time if we don't get vouchers) and the Paella in the evening equally delicious. The hotel's location, at the end of Duval St and near to Mallory Square could not be better for us, only a short walk to the relaxed and chilled world of Key West. We own a holiday home in England's version of Key West, oddly we think the US version is probably better. We could not over recommend this hotel or location. We simply love it and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dpaina
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ocean Key from 10/1-10/3 to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We go to KW every year in September and generally stay at B&B's which we have found to be very comfortable. We decided to splurge a little at the tail end of this trip. Found a pretty good rate thanks to another TA member. The CS here in remarkable...very accomodating. The pool opened up the day before we arrived and we really enjoyed it both days. The service at the pool was really good, only one girl running the show and she did a great job. We especially liked the cold washcloths and icy treats brought around every few hours. We had breakfast at the Hot Tin Roof one day. My husband LOVED the Eggs Benedict, my omelet was pretty average. We stayed in room 522 which was a partial ocean view overlooking Mallory Square. All of the oceanfront rooms are still under renovation but the noise never bothered us at all. There were cruise ships that docked both mornings which blocked our view somewhat but they were always gone by sunset. Room had a separate living area, fully stocked mini bar, jacuzzi tub, his & her sinks in the bath. The maids turned down the bed both nights. We'll definitely stay here again if we can find another good rate that fits our budget. WE LOVE KEY WEST!!!

Reviews.Title: “No Stress Much Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: LuLaL
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed at Ocen Key over Labor Day weekend. We arrived about 7PM, settled our car with the valet ( free parking with handicap tag), and were escorted to our room by our bellman who pointed out various places we'd need to know as we walked to the lift to get to our room. We had a gorgeous room which over looked the ocean and Mallory Square. The room was an accessible jr suite and also included a small living room with a couch, coffee table and 2 chairs, mini bar, some crunchy snacks,lovely chocolate goodies, and a tv with many viewing selections. The couch was comfy. There was a perfect spot next to the buffet for my husband's power chair to park and get charged and not be in the way. We dined that evening in the Hot Tin Roof and had good service. The food was interesting. However, we did find it a bit dim for reading the menu and seeing the food on our plates :0 Oh after the drive and that nice meal I was ready to use that huge whirlpool tub. I am 5'8 and I could fully stretch out and enjoy all the bubbly water. True bliss! We slept quite well and awoke early for some "people free" street photography. We got back to the hotel in time to watch the sunrise and popped up to the room to order room service breakfast. It was hot, tasty, and delivered in a very reasonable amount of time. We asked the concierge for advice for the afternoon and WOW we got not only helpful, unbiased suggestions, we received some of the most incredible customer service we have ever had. Len was simply terrifc in assisting us to make sure that what we wanted to do was easily attained. Lunch was out on the pier which had those neat lil blowers to help keep you cool. Do try that crazy drink made in the coconut shell! Service at lunch was good and it wasn't too long a wait for our food. We were enjoying the people watching, our very tasty food, and just the whole ambiance when someone near by lit up a big ol cigar. URGH!!! We fled to a quiet area in the midgrounds of the hotel... a padded chair and a corner table amidst lush tropical foliage..perfect :) We stayed out of the hot afternoon sun and watched a first run movie on the tv for a reasonable fee. After that most amusing movie we got ready for dinner and deliberated going to the square for sunset first or heading directly to the restaurant Len had suggested for dinner. Not waiting in line for food won out and we were seated quite promptly at A&B Lobsterhouse for a sumptious dinner. When we got back to the resort, the pleasant music drifted up from the square and it made for a lovely end to the day. We awoke early and found checking out to be just as professional as checking in. We were even offered bottled water for the car just in case we got thirsty enroute :) We found the staff to be pleasant and courteous, the accomodations very comfortable, and we would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WeLoveOurLife
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ocean Key the week before Christmas. We learned it can get a bit chilly in Key West! We had a huge one-bedroom suite with full kitchen and large jacuzzi in bedroom. Nice balcony overlooked the water and sunset. We think pools are important in Key West because there aren't a lot of beaches and the pool and its setting were gorgeous. The location is the best on the island. Only issue is the cruise ships docking nearby but there is nothing the hotel can do about it. We would stay here again. For more info and to see our photos visit http://www.weloveourlife.com/vacation/keywest2.html

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Key was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: ALY64
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ocean Key 9/1-6/07. From the moment we stepped out of the taxi at their front door, the staff was welcoming and gracious. We were upgraded to an ocean view junior suite, when my res had been for a city view. The room was fabulous and the view of the water and Mallory Square was wonderful. Loved the decor, and the location was perfect. There was construction noise during our visit, both from room and pool renovations, but this was expected and never at night. I was surprised it started by 7:30am a couple of mornings, which was a tad annoying...but really not a big enough factor to warrant a complaint. We LOVED this hotel and definitely hope to stay there again on our next visit to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful-Hope to stay there again”
Reviews.Author: tanglesfoot
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here in July and can't wait to go back! I booked a regular room thru United Travel and when we arrived the front deck told me they were going to upgrade us to a one bedroom suite but it wasn't ready so we took a walk down Duval Street till they called. They called us about 15 minutes later and advised me they gave us a two bedroon suite. It was just wonderful. Large bedrooms with great Key West type of furnishings. I spend large amounts of time sitting on the deck looking at the ocean and all the colorful people walking by. I don't mean to fall all over myself about this place but everyone from the front desk to the housekeeping staff made our vacation one we will always remember. My only complaint is that I didn't book a longer stay. Stay here if you go to Key West!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, better than expected”
Reviews.Author: BeachKathy
Reviews.Content: This was our frist trip to Key West. We arrived on Monday, August 13, 2007 and stayed until Thursday, August 16, 2007. The staff at Ocean Key went above and beyond our expectations. It was great to see their customer satisfaction was a priority! The location is perfect and the Hotel itself is superior. Our room was brightly decorated and very clean. We absolutely LOVE this resort. We did not hear the Roosters talked about in the reviews we read before we left (we were actually disappointed!). The construction mentioned in other reviews was there and we did hear it when we were in the room, which of course was during the day, At night there was nothing but the peaceful rest we needed. The staff was always friendly and greeted us coming and going. They were there to offer suggestions and helpful hints. I would reccommend this to everyone, and we will return to this hotel when we return to Key West! Thank You to All Staff at Ocean Key!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: triumphsprint56
Reviews.Content: We originally booked a junior suite for ourselves and our teenage son for 3 nights. What a great welcome then after a flight from the UK to Miami and the long drive down to Key West, to be greeted with the news that we had been upgraded to a 2 bed suite. The space was amazing, 2 bathrooms, full service kitchen with full size fridge and washer/dryer - great for freshening clothes before the next part of our road trip. The rooms were always clean and cool with plenty of towels and hot water and the view from the balcony was fantastic. The valet parking was efficient and all the staff were helpful and friendly. The pool was open, large enough to keep our son amused and never crowded. We never got a chance to use the Hot Tin Roof, but Sunset Pier did good breakfasts and snack type meals. Altogether a brilliant start to our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Kelton
Reviews.Content: The people working at this resort are its greatest resource. The reservation agent told us that the resort was currently under renovation and to expect that many rooms were being renovated and the pool was also closed for renovation (this a nice heads-up of what to expect, rather than getting there and finding out about it). We checked in but were unhappy with the room. We did not feel that the room met the standards for a four-star Noble House property. This is where management stepped up to the plate and EXCEEDED our expectations by IMMEDIATELY fixing the problem. We were moved to an appropriate room and the previous room was taken out of service. We were thanked for bringing our concern to their attention. We were offered free breakfast (not necessary, but it was a nice gesture). The room we end up in was perfect. Even the standard rooms have a jetted tub. Nice. The bath products are from the spa (on-site) and are very nice with a tropical scent. The â€œfancyâ€� restaurant onlyserves dinner and has a limited menu. The casual restaurant is outside seating only, but has a nice breakfast and burger type fare for lunch. Every seat in the casual restaurant (outside) is on the water with great views. Most items are around $10 for breakfast or lunch. The location (Zero Duval) is literally von top of Mallory Square (where all the people gather to view the sunset). Half the rooms have balconies that actually overlook Mallory square and the water (ask for these as it is a perfect view). The concierge booked our parasailing (~$100 for a tandem parasailing ride, included a photo CD with about 40 shots of us parasailing!) He also booked our day long trip to the Dry Tortugas National Park (~$150 each included breakfast, lunch, national park admission, snorkeling equipment, and the round-tip boat ride of 70 miles each way). We recommend both activities. You may want to contact the concierge before you arrive so they can book these activities for you as they seem to sell out. We tipped the concierge $15 for his assistance. The hotel is decorated in a tropical beach motif with lots of blue and green. It is a very refreshing color scheme. The only drawbacks to this property are: (1) it is under renovation; (2) the pool is closed; (3) the elevators seem to lack air conditioning; (4) it has exterior corridors, so if you do not like the heat (especially in the summer), this could be a problem. Again, the people here are exceptional. Location is perfect. Jetted tubs are nice after a long day.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Arroba
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the Ocean Key Resort. It has the best location of Key West, right inf front of the Gulf and Duval Street. The hotel is beautiful and the rooms are confy. What really makes the difference is the staff. The hotel staff is very friendly and efficient (special mention to Eddie, at the Front Desk, he was awesome). Save time, stop looking and go to the Ocean Key Resort, you won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Why on earth would you stay anwhere else in Key West?!?!”
Reviews.Author: FlaPattie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ocean Key Resort & Spa 7/9-7/13. To say we LOVED the resort is an understatement !! We booked the "Sensory Overload" package. Our room was beautiful. Loved the double sinks in the bathroom and the whirlpool tub. The balcony was small and intimate and the view from the balcony was AWESOME !!! Our room (#421) overlooked Mallory Square to the left, the Gulf straight ahead and the pool/Sunset Pier to the right. Our room was clean upon arriving and the maid kept it spotless. As someone else on here mentioned, they provide plenty of towels for a second shower in the middle of the day (it's really hot this time of year!). The location was perfect....right within walking distance of everything. There is a Glass bottom boat tour dock right there, the Conch Railroad tour (GREAT for learning about Key West history), bike and electric car rental is right there.......and also a CVS Pharmacy is two blocks away incase you need some last minute essentials. We did everything online....booked the room from the hotel's website and e-mailed the resort to book the Spa appointments as well as to ask questions about the hotel from Bill the Director of Sales and Marketing. Bill was always EXTREMELY friendly and helpful with his e-mail replies and very accommodating (we requested the mini fridge be emptied to be able to store our own little snacks). On check in the staff was (as everyone has already said here)very friendly and helpful. There was construction on our floor (the resort made us fully aware of this before check in)but it was no big deal because we were out during the day and they kept to the construction time frames (I think it was 9am-5pm).Heck I even took a mid-day nap with the construction going on and it wasn't bad... I was able to sleep. The "Sensory Overload" package includes $50 per day credit for Spa Treatments and free dinner each night during your stay (including soft drinks, salad, entree and even dessert!) â€“gratuity not included. The Spa treatments were INCREDIBLE! I had the Balinese Massage the first day with Amy and she was great ! This is a wonderful massage that actually relaxes you first then gives you incredible energy at the end !! Next massage was the Hot Stone Massage with Andrea'. This was wonderful too; incredibly relaxing......I could have napped afterwards. The Spa itself was really cute and cozy. The receptionist genuinely seemed to care how my massages were afterwards and was so friendly and welcoming upon my arrival. We LOVED the hotel restaurant The Hot Tin Roof and actually used our hotel package credits to eat free here EVERY NIGHT !!! We were able to try everything on the menu this way and we received impeccable service. 3 of the 4 nights we had our favorite waiter Albert. Albert was the most attentive and warm friendly waiter we have ever met !! The food at the restaurant was delicious!! You can't beat having Lobster every night with only paying a $30-$40 tip!!! Seriously, we did not have Lobster every night, but you could have with the package. The hotel might have thought "With all these incredible restaurants in the area, who in their right mind would have dinner here each night?" They hadn't met us yet !!! Seriously there are a ton of restaurants to try and I am sure we might have missed out on some great food as many restaurants are not open for lunch, but with the incredible service we received from Albert and the mouth watering delectable food we consumed at The Hot Tin Roof - it was a no brainer to just eat there each night. We felt at home !!! We sat inside twice and outside on the balcony twice. Witnessed incredible sunsets on the balcony. The view was incredible ! By the 4th night the restaurant actually trusted us enough to give our opinion on a new dessert they were trying out. Also the restaurant manager John was no exception to the whole team at Ocean Key Resort & Spa - he made us feel very welcome in the restaurant. We also had breakfast one morning at the restaurant at the hotel on Sunset Pier. Great view, again excellent food....although we missed Albert. :-) I took a ton of photos (attached) specifically for TripAdvisor.com because we found this hotel on this website and I wanted to be able to give back to the website to help others considering this hotel. Roosters - Ok, some people have complained about the roosters waking them up. Not only do they go off in the morning (about 6am on our stay) but also ALL DAY intermittently. They are not bad and did not wake us up. My husband is an early riser so we were already up. His getting up to use the bathroom woke me up, not the roosters !! On the first morning, it was like the magic & excitement of Christmas morning as my husband said to me with a huge smile "Do you hear the roosters ?" then we got up to look for them over the balcony. Sure enough as the sun rose the roosters would crow and run closer and closer to the ocean through the brick lined floor of Mallory Square. We'd never seen anything like it !! The roosters are part of the charm of Key West people ! Maybe our room was positioned so it wasn't that bad to hear them and be annoyed by them, but with being back home and hearing traffic outside our Downtown Orlando condo I welcome the sound of roosters again instead !!!! Please note the pictures of the room attached to this review are probably going to be outdated soon as I believe the furniture in the room and the room look itself is undergoing construction, however if you stay at the hotel SOON your room might still look like ours did. It was the "Oceanview Boutique Suite ". They even have a house cat...on our first night we arrived back at the hotel from sightseeing around 9pm and met "Buddy" a black cat sitting in the lobby. A staff member explained he was the house cat and the restaurant was named for Buddy - because he used to walk on the roof when they first built the place, so cat on a "Hot Tin Roof"!. As many have mentioned the restaurant next to the hotel and in front of Mallory Square "El Meson De Pepe" (the Cuban place) has awesome food !! It also has a little Cuban history museum inside. Elevators- Yes they have no ac in them but with the mirrors and elaborate wood design - they are beautiful !! Plus how long are you riding in an elevator anyway? We stayed during temps in the low 90's and were on the 4th floor and had no problems riding in the warm elevator for a few floors. Cruise ships- We only had a cruise ship block our balcony view of Mallory Square/Gulf for one day. It was there from about 6am - 4pm. It was no big deal. Again, same with the roosters....it's charming. How often do you wake up to look outside and see a huge cruise ship in front of your balcony !!! Parking-It was $18 a day to park on property, but that is expected anywhere in Key West where space is limited. It was neat how the parking is arranged.....they park your vehicle for you with the valet and it's on the ground floor incase you need to get something out of your car during your stay. We brought bottled water so it was neat to be able to see our car safely stored each day and also to be able to restock our water for the mini fridge. You might be wondering if we didn't like anything about the hotel. Our only complaints are #1) the bed was extra firm. This might have been partly our fault because we are used to sleeping on a pillow top mattress. Any with the construction going on perhaps new beds (mattresses) are part of the improvements. #2) the last night I took a bath with lukewarm water because there seemed to be no hot water left. Our showers were just as lukewarm in the morning, but this was probably our fault for not complaining sooner. My husband told the desk clerk about this on check out and he seemed horrified and concerned, explaining with the construction the construction team sometimes works and forgets to plug the water heaters back in. So just make sure to communicate your concerns with staff during your stay and they will take care of any issues with concern and attentiveness. This was our first stay in Key West and easily the best vacation of our lives due to the relaxed feeling of Key West. Ocean Key Resort & Spa obviously played a HUGE part in our feelings on this. We will be back and have been telling everyone about the great service and amenities this resort has to offer. Again I ask, Why on earth would you stay anywhere else when in Key West ?!?!?

Reviews.Title: “"perfect"”
Reviews.Author: nikels8
Reviews.Content: we just returned home from our 9 day stay at the ocean key. we were upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite when we checked in. our room was perfect, very spacious, clean, large balcony. we had a partial ocean view that was amazing. the pool was great. i know that some of the other posts said that it was small, but it really is not that bad. we had friends staying at the hyatt, two hotels over, and that pool is smaller & it only goes up yp 4ft deep, the ocean key pool goes up to 8ft & is much bigger.the hotel is under construction but the only time we even heard any noise was at the pool, so it never interrupted our sleep. i would definately stay there again, we didn't want to come home.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Charlie_WashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate here on Orbitz. Was upgraded to an ocean view 1-bedroom, so I might not be an unbiased source. However, I'll say that everyone at the hotel was incredibly friendly. I can't imagine a better location for Key West, and the environment was great. Stayed there with my girlfriend for her birthday June 9, and we are still talking about it. Highly recommended. Also, Cafe Sole (off the beaten path a bit) is a phenomenal restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Key is for me”
Reviews.Author: dbailey
Reviews.Content: Just returned (6/2007) from Ocean Key resort in Key West FL where we spent 5 days. My wife and I really liked this hotel. From the moment we walked in the door everyone was smiling, friendly, and very helpful. Here are some quotes, "No problem Mr. Bailey - we'll take care of that for you," (at check in) or "Anything you want Mr. Bailey" (at breakfast). We stayed in room 228 which is a Jr. Suite overlooking Mallory Square and a peek at the ocean. The room was super clean and really nice for relaxing. The bathroom was spacious with really nice marble tile and good lighting that dimmed for night tub use. Two TVs, fridge, king bed, excellent AC, and a great balcony. The location is great for Duval street and hitting the restaurants where the yachts come in (preferred over Duval). Be sure to visit the Dry Tortugas on Yankee Freedom II. for a great get-away-day. We will be back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Key West Resort”
Reviews.Author: citygirl4616
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ocean Key for 3 nights at the end of June. I was in Key West for a wedding. The location on Duvall Street is excellent. We were able to walk almost everywhere. Check-in was easy, and the front desk staff was pleasant, professional and polite. We arrived at 1pm, but our room was not ready, so we gave them our cell phone number, and we told they would call us when our room was ready. We walked to the CVS located next door (VERY convenient to have a drug store so close), and got the phone call 5 minutes later than our room was ready. Nice! We had a junior suite which was very large, clean and well laid out. The king bed was comfortable, and the A/C in the room worked great (which was crucial because the temperatures reached close to 100 degrees outside). I was disappointed that the elevators were not air conditioned. They were seriously like riding up to our room in a small oven. The temperature in the elevator must have been close to 110 degrees. It was pure torture! There were lots of towels provided in the room and the toiletries provided were nice. The pool area is small, but pleasant. The chairs are comfotable, but I would have loved a little more shade. I had two spa services while at the Ocean Key. The spa is wonderful! It is small, but the range of services they offer is very impressive. I had a body scrub and a massage....both were excellent. The staff at the spa is professional, helpful and friendly. The products they use are lovely. I wanted to keep on going back to the spa...it was top notch. My visits to the spa were one of the highlights of my trip. I would definitely recommend the Ocean Key Resort. It is not inexpensive, but I felt like I got my money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: fortune82
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic 2 night stay here in the middle of two weekends in Miami. On check-in we were told we had been upgraded and were shown to an ocean view suite - absolutley amazing view from our private balcony of the ocean and Mallory Square perfect spot to watch the sunset. The room was huge, clean and very comfortable. The bathroom again was very spacious with a large jacuzzi bath (very clever design of shutters against the bathoom window into the room so by opening them we could look out to the sea view while laying in the bath - perfect) Pool area and staff were great and we had breakfast in the restaurant which was excellent and coming from the UK we felt very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: mdmOrlando_FL
Reviews.Content: We searched long and hard for a hotel in Key West. Ocean Key is part of the Noble House resort group which I'm very familiar with. We felt very confident in booking here based on that and the reviews I saw here on trip advisor. We got a great rate for a partial ocean view jr. suite through the hotel's website. Check in was fast and efficient but it was all down hill from there. The room was clean but only just barely. The tile floor was so dark and dingy looking that I didn't want to take my shoes off. There were stains on the couch fabric that grossed me out. I had to put a sheet down before I sat down. And my allergies immediately kicked in telling me there was dust and mold in the room. Although the bathroom was clean, the staff didn't do a thorough job of dusting. You could see it on shelves and fixtures. In fact all the furniture was like that. And there were scuff/dirt marks all over the walls. In need of serious repainting. At this point, I'm a little disappointed but trying to make the best of it. While unpacking, we can hear roosters crowing in Mallory Square. This went on for about an hour and it was in the afternoon. This concerns me because I'm a light sleeper and don't want to hear them in the morning. I can also hear the people talking in the room next to me and someone in the room above us keeps moving furniture around and I can hear it scraping the tile floor. I call the front desk to see if we can move to another side of the hotel to at least get away from the roosters. The snotty young man I spoke to gave me this whole lecture about the wild roosters being a protected species on the island and they are all over and you're not supposed to catch them. I told him I don't want to catch them, I just don't want to hear them. He basically told me I have no choice, you will hear the roosters everywhere. Very helpful! Well, the roosters woke me up early the next morning. And they don't just crow for a little while and then stop. No, they keep crowing. My husband complained that in addition to the roosters, there was too much light coming into the room. There is a window next to the door with louvers but they don't completely cover the window so a lot of light came into the room in the morning. So far not my idea of a relaxing vacation. That was all we could take. After the mean guy we spoke to yesterday, we did not feel like arguing with the hotel staff to maybe get a different room that would probably have the same problems. I made a couple phone calls and a very nice woman at the Marquesa Hotel matched the rate we had at the Ocean Key. We checked out and paid the $100 early checkout fee. They weren't even concerned as to why we were leaving after one night when we had booked for five nights. We had a beautiful room at the Marquesa. And guess what, I never heard another rooster the whole time we were there. Loved the Marquesa!! It was perfect there and worth the $100 to leave the Ocean Key and have a wonderful time at the Marquesa.

Reviews.Title: “great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bobbygold
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel and location. We hade a superior room which was a suite. Nice rooms and bathroom with jacuzzi bath was superb. large balcony overlooking end of Duval Street and sea with doors onto it from lounge and bedroom. Lunch on the hotels pier was great with jazz group on a Sunday. Recommend the Key West Sunset draught bitter with a fish sandwich. Pool area on the small side but fantastic views of the sunset and good pool service.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: addieusc
Reviews.Content: Everything at this hotel was excellent! We stayed there from May 20-26, 2007 for our honeymoon. We had booked late because of a construction issue at the hotel we had previously booked. We explained the situation and they were more than willing to help make our stay memorable. They gave us a great room overlooking the water and Mallory Square which was fantastic. The room was very clean and quiet and the staff was a pleasure from the minute we arrived! Anything we asked for was handled in a timely and efficient manner - not that we really needed that much! Everything was taken care of before we could even ask! It was well worth the money and we will definitely stay there in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Best of Key West !”
Reviews.Author: SEAJourney
Reviews.Content: If you want a fabulous time in Key West- stay at Ocean Key Resort. The rooms are so luxurious, the service wonderful- friendly and speedy ! You will be staying on the official Sunset Pier in Key West, with stunning views of the water or famous Duval Street. The restaurant is 5 star great, and still friendly while being gourmet/fusion and delicious. The website has specials that make a stay here affordable for the luxury received. I've stayed at the Westin at Mallory Square and Ocean Key is far and above a much better choice. The staff in the lobby is very friendly and helpful, and there is a CVS pharmacy conveniently next to the resort for those unexpected needs. I am an experienced traveler so you can trust this recommendation for Ocean Key- you will not be disappointed. The bathrooms are huge and even have very cool air conditioning ducts in the bathroom- which means alot in a tropical locale like this ! The rooms are gigantic and the beds are pure heaven. Just go, you won't be sorry, I promise you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: kez_ireland25
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ocean Key for 2 nights for our Wedding Anniversary on the 7th May 2007. The location is excellent, you couldnt ask for better. A couple of steps and you are on Mallory Square and Duval Street. The welcome we got when we arrived was fantastic. Our room wasnt ready but they parked our car for us and made us feel very welcome. The room we had was a box standard room and it was lovely. Big, colourful, comfy bed, balcony, 2 tv;s ( i mean who needs 2 tv's!!!) fridge, sofa. Huge bath, all really nicely done. The view from the balcony was over Duval Street and the ocean and was lovely. The hotel has plenty of amenties, the pool is nice, there is a bar on the pier where you can sit and watch the boats go by. You can walk practically anywhere on Key West from here. We ate in the hotel restaurant for our anniversary and it was ok. It did have negatives though, the man than welcomed us was really not very nice and was absolutely useless at his job. We arrived slightly early for our table and we were kept waiting approx 45 mins, with no contact, just a simple, well there's the bar get a drink while you are waiting. The restaurant wasnt even busy. It wasnt really on and with it being our Anniversary we felt a bit put out. The service in the restaurant was adequate and the food is pretty good. Its nice to sit outside too. I wouldnt rush back to the restaurant though! I would highly recomend this hotel. Its not cheap but there are deals to be done and the location is excellent and there are loads of bars and restaurant well within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kelly32
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our stay at the Ocean Key and loved every minute. The staff was very attentive and welcoming when we arrived. We took part in a package (spring fling) which offered a jr. suite, 2 drinks per person per day and lunch. The Lunch menu was small, but ample. They even traded out 2 lunch coupons for 2 breakfast coupons since we were leaving early on our last day. Drinks were very strong and service was good. We were at the pool area every day around 4pm and never had a problem finding a seat. Room was very clean and maintained nicely. We had a balcony overlooking the ocean and the only time we saw a cruise ship was our last day there and it was only in dock until 5pm. Location was great - left the hotel and was immediately in the action at Mallory Square. There were kids at the pool, but only a couple a day. The hotel is more for adults I think. Overall, a great experience. We have been to KW 5 times and I think we found our favorite go-to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Key West”
Reviews.Author: melindajirwin
Reviews.Content: I'll try to make this short, but informative. I am a travel agent, and I loved the Ocean Key. Great location for the activities of Key West - Dining, Duval Street, galleries, and water sports. The pool is small, but great chairs and service by the pool. The Hot Tin Roof restaurant is really good, but you really do need reservations if you want a decent table. We were in a 2 bedroom with a kitchen and washer/dryer and it was fabulous. CVS was right next door, and there was a little supermarket on Fleming. It was nice to be able to have cereal, toast, and take leftovers back to the room probably saved us quite a bit not eating out every meal. But really the staff there was amazing and made our stay perfect. They all really seemed to like their jobs-very refreshing! I would recommend this hotel to anyone, but don't think Key West is good place to take children. Lots of obnoxious drunk people on Duval street which seemed to spill over to the Sunset pier in the evenings. Small fitness center, great spa, and all the rooms looked really large.

Reviews.Title: “may 4-7”
Reviews.Author: budcans1
Reviews.Content: went down for a well needed three night stay. originally booked dewey house based on reviews here but after getting a great deal on another sight i took three nights at ocean key for less. we have stayed at noble house hotels in the past and they have never ever let us down. they lived up to their reputation and neither one of us had a single complaint. if i had to sum up my stay in one word, "flawless". staff was there when i needed them and polite. room was spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Que
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful hotel. Check in was quick and the front desk staff were very polite and attentive. Itâ€™s exclusively valet parking and obviously you have to pay for it, but we never needed to move our car from the time we checked in. The bell boy gave us a run down of all the services that the hotel offers (it was his first day and he was supervised but certainly had all of the information down pat). Our room was excellent â€“ a two bedroom suite (there were only two of us) with full kitchen, fridge, clothes washer and dryer, dishwasher etc. There was a basket of goodies on the countertop and in the fridge to purchase if you wanted â€“ biscuits, chocolate, wine and spirits, champagne, soft drinks etc. It was quite expensive, but a nice touch. The toiletries in the bathrooms were lovely and the whirlpool tub was fantastic (though we only used it once as it took an age to fill). The suite had a large balcony overlooking the pier and was a great place to relax. We ordered room service breakfast one day and it was nice to eat out on the balcony though the portions were rather skimpy â€“ a slice of toast with the omelette wouldnâ€™t have gone amiss (they even brought jars of jam, but Iâ€™m not sure what we were supposed to do with them!). We thought the prices were reasonable, but exchange rates for the UK are so good at the moment. We booked the room online with opodo and it was less than $200 per night which was excellent value â€“ they donâ€™t mention that you have to pay the various taxes separately which is a bit cheeky, but thatâ€™s an issue with the online booking site rather than the hotel. Even with taxes, it was still good value â€“ Iâ€™m not sure whether I would have paid $900 a night that the previous poster quoted. Itâ€™s always worth looking around for the best deal. The location of this hotel at zero Duval Street canâ€™t really be bettered â€“ everything is within walking distance. The pool is a decent size and overlooks the ocean â€“ we spent one of our days there and the service from the waitress that day was second to none, she was so attentive and everything was delivered with a smile. She worked non-stop all day and deserves a medal. The only negatives we can think of were specifically to do with the suite we stayed in â€“ the laundry dryer only ran on cold, so we had to call maintenance to look at it and he had to take our clothes to the hotel laundry to dry them. I thought he had a bit of a strange chauvinistic attitude, but he got the job done. The beds were extremely comfortable, but the pillows were not â€“ they were too high and too hard for us, but I guess thatâ€™s down to personal choice.

Reviews.Title: “dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: ttuby
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Ocean Key 3 years ago, but this time was not up to par. They promised us a certain room, but upon arrival we were told the room was already given to another guest. The manager, front desk offered no appology, no adjustment for our inconvienance. We were told our room was non-smoking and we would be charged extra if we smoked, but our room had an extreme odor of smoke when we checked in. They had to deep clean our 2 bedroom suite. For $900 per night, The service, personal were definately not what we had last time. We will not return to this hotel again, as the service has deterioated.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Expectations”
Reviews.Author: lovs2fly
Reviews.Content: Even though we have stayed in Old Town before we decided to try a new resort and we were not disappointed. Beyond expectations would be the only way to describe our stay at the OKR. We booked through AAA for a jr suite at a very good rate for the area. We were scheduled for a city view but were keeping our fingers crossed for an upgrade. At check-in a very friendly attendent was swiftly checking us in and offered us the upgrade without asking. We now had a room that faced the pool/Mallory Square/sunset's. Oh, the room was also much larger than what was booked and now became a large 2 room suite. We could have asked for no more. The staff was always polite and attending always said good morning and would offer the elavator to us first. An example of a well trained staff. The little things werere important to them and it was evident it their approach to their guest. The grounds were well kept and in good order. The pool was clean and towels always provided. Although I did notice this was a function of who was working the pool. Our young waitress was very attentive. However on her off day we had a waiter who did seem a bit out of sync. From our room we had 10 steps and we were on Mallory square -- you can not get better than that. Or, maybe we could. We also chose to watch the sunset from our patio. While during the day there could be a cruis ship in our way, during the evening (after 3) all was open to seen the great setting sun. The beauty of OKR beyond the resort itself was how close you are to what makes Key West unique. The free-spirit town itself with all the shopping and nightlife. For us it was a 10 sec walk and we are in the middle of it all. While the upgrade in room contributed to much of our enjoyment there were too many other positives to say this was the only reason we had such a good time. This was our 4th trip to Key West and we have stayed at other premium resorts. However from this point forward the Ocean Key Resort will now be our destination of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, not luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Clarkenn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here one night after staying at its sister resort, Little Palm Island Resort for four nights. The best part about staying here is the location, but don't expect luxury. Location is perfect for exploring Key West - right at the end of Duvall Street on the water. The view from the balcony was beautiful - you could watch the sunset as well as view the crowd next door at Mallory Square. Our room, like the hotel, was in need of a major renovation. The bathroom tile was broken. The shower was small and old. Our room smelled of cigarette smoke, even though it was a non-smoking room.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: dsykes
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the other positive reviews for this hotel - the location and hotel itself are excellent. Try to get a room that has a seafront view and watch the sunset over Mallory square. A fabulous 3 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “The pulse of Key West”
Reviews.Author: DaisyLu
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first trip to Key West. We had a room called the Jr. suite. There was a living room, bedroom, jacuzzi tub, separate bathroon, balcony. Our view was on the corner so it was part city and part water which was okay since we weren't there to stay in our room. We were in the heart of everything, I could not ask for a better location. The bed was comfortable, the room was clean and bright. We are very pleased with the accomodations. Since there were record low temps during our stay we didn't get use out of the balcony. Our neighbors must have though as we heard them dragging chairs early a couple of mornings. Seemed the garbage or some large truck came early each morning too. Aside from that I didn't hear much noise from outside. The pool area is nice, but small and when the cruise ships are in you cannot see the sunset from there. I cannot say I was too pleased with the room service menu, I did not care for the food I received and what was supposed to be hot was lukewarm. We were also billed for a parking charge every night and we did not have a vehicle!! It was removed from my bill upon request, although when I got home I realized I was not provided a receipt for one night...of which when I called parking charges and an unidentified charge were on it. I was told my receipt would be emailed but have yet to receive a copy of the receipt less these incorrect charges. Make sure to check your bill upon checkout!

Reviews.Title: “It's all about location...”
Reviews.Author: SammyRaeHall
Reviews.Content: As previous travelers have mentioned, this hotel is perfectly located at the end of Duval Street and next to Mallory Square. If you are looking to stay in the heart of Key West this is the place to be. All of the shops and bars are very close & within walking distance. The hotel is not 5 star, however it is fun and colorful with fresh paint and interesting artwork. We had a large room with vaulted ceilings & a skylight. The patio had a beautiful view overlooking Mallory Square and the ocean, perfect for watching the famous Key West sunsets. The formal restaurant, Hot Tin Roof, sits on the edge of the property overlooking the water. The food is delicious, however the service was rather slow. Sunset Pier is more lively with good music and a more "pub-like" menu. It gets crowded at sunset so get there early to get a good seat and enjoy the tasty drinks. The only negative for this hotel was the noise in the morning. We like fresh air so we opened our patio door during the night. The roosters in Mallory Square are extremely loud in the early morning so be sure to turn the a/c on instead of opening the door! All in all we loved this hotel and will stay again for our annual trip to the Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: Barbthor
Reviews.Content: Amazing staff, room, pool and location! Our only disappointment was the "spa". More like a room with an inexperienced masseuse. But the rest of the resort made up for the disappointing spa experience. Definitely, THE place to stay in Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Darbaby
Reviews.Content: This is the gem of Key West. It is located at 0 duval street and our room over looks the ocean and mallorey square. We enjoyed the sunsets from our balcony. The rooms are just fabulous. From check in to check out everything was great. Valet service for the vehicle and never needed it again until we left. Everything is within walking distance. I would never stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: travelermarc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2-2-07/2-7-07. Check in was fine. The location was great, right on Mallory Square. The room was adequate, nothing special. We had a one bedroom suite. TV in the living room was set in a cupboard with very limited visibility and was approx. 15 inches.. TV in the bedroom was set higher in an armoire but was the same very small size. TV also shut itself off intermittently. The room was VERY noisy. We could hear normal conversation in the room next door. Evidentally, the balcony of the room above us was over our bedroom. We heard furniture being dragged around almost constantly. Basically, the rooms were poorly designed as no exterior noise was muffled. The bed was great! I liked very much that the first day, we were left a card to indicate preferred time for housekeeping. We enjoyed the proximity to all the activities of Key West. It was a good time. Hotel was adequate but not special.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel with the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: surfgirlz
