Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay because it has everything you would want in a hotel. The staff is very friendly and will go out of their way to help you find good restaurants and good places to visit. It's in a perfect location.. you're far enough away from the noise of the main street, yet you are close enough to walk to the night life. The sunset celebration is just a short few blocks away. The pool is crystal clean (but too small if you're a lap swimmer like me)... never-the-less, it is a great place to sip a drink and be waited on hand and foot by the pool staff. We tipped generously because the staff was so outstanding. We had an ocean front room... and the sunsets are just, indescribable. Definately worth the extra money for an ocean front room. The cruise ships dock nearby as well. The room was great. It was huge... with cathedral ceilings. We also had an oversized jacuzzi tub. Each day, the maid would make up your room and leave a seashell on your bed. That was a nice touch, and a lot less fattening than a chocolate! I highly recommend this hotel and would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Key is the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: CMS4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our 8 year old son to Key West during the long MLK weekend. We had not been to Key West in 20 years and the island has made some wonderful changes. We stayed at the Ocean Key Resort which is at the very end of Duvall Street beside Mallory Square where the Sunset party is held every night. This hotel is perfectly situated to enjoy the sunset, watch sailboats go by, and view the large cruise ships that come into port on a daily basis. The hotel is very clean and well kept. Our junior suite was roomy and colorful. The friendly staff was helpful with restaurant ideas, directions, and things to do. I enjoyed a massage at Spa Terre at Ocean Key. The spa is soothing and offers a variety of massages and salon choices. The hotel's pool sits beside the ocean. So, as you sip your tropical cocktail by the pool, you watch these beautiful boats sail by. Key West is a wonderful vacation spot. We hope to visit more often and when we do, we will definitely stay at Ocean Key.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience!”
Reviews.Author: kenny706
Reviews.Content: It was an incredible stay with everything beyond positive! The room was incredible, the view was awesome, the people were unbelievable! The restaurants nearby and the We were staying at the Atlantic Shores and were stuck there because it was New Year's Eve. We were desperate to get another hotel because the Atlantic Shores was such a bad stay overall... (Read my other review)... So, here goes the story... We were walking up and down Duval street, doing a mini-crawl. We went into each of the hotels desperately searching for another room to stay in. Of course with us being at the Atlantic Shores and eventually ending up at the Ocean Key, you can tell we checked out a LOT of hotels. We went from one end to the other and when we got to the Ocean Key the staff was very nice and incredibly accomodating. We told them of our experience at the Atlantic Shores and they said they would call us on our cell-phones if there was a cancellation. So, here it is about 15 minutes after midnight (New Year's Eve) and we got a phone call. They had a room, we took it! When we arrived the next morning, it seemed that everyone had heard of our dilemma and actually seemed glad to have us at the Ocean Key. The entire staff took such great care of us and made our stay in Key West the BEST!

Reviews.Title: “Nice touches but not exceptional”
Reviews.Author: London_Traveller2-TA
Reviews.Content: We paid above our norm to stay here because we wanted to experience Key West based in a nice place in an optimum location. Ocean Key meets these criteria but no more. The staff were largely helpful, the room very nicely appointed although to have called it an "Ocean View" was stretching the definition a bit far. The pool area is extremely small and often appears to be overlooked by a couple of hundred people on a docked cruise liner. The location is perfect, allowing immediate access to the square and main party area without it being noisy or effected in any other way. Overall we'd recommend it but don't expect great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, loved it, loved it !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Been-there-as-well
Reviews.Content: A co-worker and I had the pleasure of visiting the Ocean Key Resort last June (2006). It was amazing! The staff went out of their way to accomodate us. They made us feel so welcome. We had a beautiful two bedroom suite with a large balcony, overlooking Duval Street. I would love to return there some day!

Reviews.Title: “it keeps getting better”
Reviews.Author: FATHEAD
Reviews.Content: This was our forth stay ot ocean key and once again everything was great except the weather that is(65 and windy prefer the normal 75 to 80 ) Service was great, stayed on the fifth floor in very spacious room overlooking pool, ocean and mallory square. They have a new spa which also was nice, not so large but massage was nice offers alot of other services. Rooms are spacious decorated Key West like ( tropical bright colors) large bathrooms and new plasma tv also. We ventured thru other hotels on the island and were still glad we stayed at Ocean Key Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Best Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: tobysmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ocean Key Resort for our honeymoon, after a wedding in Islamorada at Casa Morada. These are truly two different places. Key West is must more touristy!! So keep that in mind. The resort is very nice, however some of the rooms need a little updating. We booked an oceanview boutique suite, however when we awoke one morning we did not have a view at all. We were staring into the Carnival Cruise lines window. We immediately went down to the front desk and they felt very bad, since this was our honeymoon, that they told us to go and have breakfast and they would see what could be done to rectify our situation. Well when we returned we were upgraded to a one bedroom suite oceanfront!! Talk about a view!! It was spectacular. The only drawback was that the boutique room had much nicer accomadations. The bathroom was beautiful and this room had a very old bathroom and the doorwall to the lanai was almost impossible to open, due to rusting. However do not let that hinder you from staying at this facility. The staff at the front desk and the bellman were outstanding!!! They were the best! We had dinners included in our package at the Hot Tin Roof restaurant and everyone was yummy! The wait staff was excellant! We had a wonderful time at this facility and before we left we were going to book the time for our return visit for our anniversary!! You will enjoy your stay at this fine establishment!

Reviews.Title: “Wild Key West”
Reviews.Author: CEL78
Reviews.Content: Located at the bottom of Duval St on the waterfront at Key West. Small pool with good waitress service. Slightly noisy but in a lively part of town. Have to pay for parking. Ask for a room away from the lifts/elevators which are extremely noisy.

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing get away!”
Reviews.Author: clubbwife
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a beautiful 3 night, 4 day stay in Key West at the Ocean Key Resort. This is one of the few vacations that I can say everything was absolutely perfect. The staff at every turn were helpful and friendly. I never got the feeling that I was a pain in the neck tourist....these people truly understand that tourism IS their economy. Every part of the resort was beautiful and impeccably maintained. The room (junior suite) was very spacious. And the location turned out to be nice too. I was worried that we were going to be too close to the all night partying, but the hotel is located in a quiet block at the very end of Duvall Street, so we never heard any late night noise. Also, the balcony we had overlooking Duvall Street allowed for some very interesting people watching! Definitely a GREAT trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Hendes1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in September and I didnt want to leave. We arrived at around 10pm after a long drive from Miami. When we pulled up in front of the hotel we were greeted by the porter who took our bags and left us to check in. The check in staff were friendly and we went up to our room. As it was dark we had no idea what we were looking out over but we unpacked and then went out for a meal. The next morning we opened the curtains and saw that we looked out over Mallory square and could see the ocean. It was a great view. The bedroom was nice and clean and there was a nice bathroom with a deep whirlpool tub. We spent most of our time by the pool and the pool staff were very friendly. All in all our stay here couldnt have been better and we cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: TKDoc29
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were staying at the Ocean Key Resort for 2 nights celebrating our 4th wedding anniversary. When we arrived, we were told our room was not ready. My husband's brother and his wife were staying at the hotel also, so we placed our luggage in their room, and went to the pool. The pool staff was the only friendly staff we encountered our entire stay. Finally, our room was ready and when we entered our room (515), it looked so disgusting we should have walked right back out. First there is a serious bug problem in that room. We are local Florida residents and understand there are occasionally bugs in hotels. However, when you sit on the bed you should not have bugs crawling over your body! The bathroom was foul, we had no washcloths, and we seriously thought it was a joke that the â€œwhirlpool tubâ€� was actually from this century and would be able to work properly. To make matters worse, there was a wedding that evening below our balcony, so our â€œromantic anniversary on the balconyâ€� was turned into a horrific display of screaming at each other (just to hear what the other was saying), with all the doors and curtains closed tight!! It sounded like the speakers for the band were in our room with us! The next day when we asked for a room change we were told it was not possible, however the staff did finally accommodate and we were moved to 521. The elevator ride to the 5th floor was almost unbearable without air conditioning. The elevator turned into an airless sauna by 11 a.m., which as you can imagine is very uncomfortable! The second day was even more unpleasant than the first due to the fact that my sister-in-law noticed someone took a metal brush to their brand NEW Lexus SUV. We had NOT been notified of any incident, and when we approached the front desk it was almost a joke among the staffers. The maintenance man had gotten white paint all over their black vehicle, then decided he would â€œscrubâ€� it off with whatever metal rag he had in his pocket, completely destroying the paint job down both sides, and the entire front end including the front bumper. As you can imagine, that put a damper in everyoneâ€™s mood, opinion of the resort, and literally made the entire remainder of the stay at the Ocean Key Resort miserable. The response from the manager was not comforting, and he did not make the situation seem like a concern for him. He merely handed them an incident report and a card for the HR department and said he was â€œvery sorry.â€� The Hot Tin Roof had very good breakfast, however the staff was slow and not always correct in the orders. When we checked out, we were rushed through the process. My husband and I DID pay for our first nightâ€™s stay, even though it was something out of a bad movie. The desk employee did not take our valet ticket so we had about 4 people get their vehicles first, and finally when our vehicle did arrive we had no one available to help load our belongings. My husband and I had hoped for a fun and romantic getaway to the Ocean Key Resort, what we had was a catastrophe and we will never stay at that hotel again. The Lexus had to be completely repainted and the front windshield replaced due to the extensive damage. The hotel did pay for the damage...after many phone calls and hassel. Regardless, my sister-in-law was left without a vehicle for over a week and a half while the repairs were completed. Bottom line, you would be better off with Chevy Chase on a â€œGriswald Family Vacationâ€� than ever staying at the Ocean Key Resort.

Reviews.Title: “for $189? Maybe”
Reviews.Author: wiggles21
Reviews.Content: We booked Ocean Key because we had never stayed at a "luxury" resort and they had a sweet deal for Florida residents ($189 instead of $399), and it was our honeymoon. In the end we felt let down. The lobby is lovely and the people all friendly, but then the niceties end. The elevators had no AC or any air flowing in and were hotter than being outside. We thought it was a temporary inconvience, but a sign was never put up and it stayed that way for the whole 4 night stay. So we get to our room and we head straight for the balcony. It really is an Awesome view. Then we turned around and were slightly horrified by the whirlpool tub surrounded by mirrors, only 2 feet from the bed, in the middle of the room. Let's start with the tub. Loud, not quite big enough for 2, and hard to get in and out of. It is deep (nice) but there is no step into it, you just drop. Getting out is just as hard since you step onto slick wet marble. The mirrors also were a little cheesy, like a sleazy motel. The lack of a door or anything made it quite obvious that this suite was meant for couples only. The bathroom area is a little odd, too. The double sink was gorgeous (would love one like that in our house), but the actual place where the toilet and shower were was awful. Very small and cramped into a small place with no privacy. The door to the toilet/shower area was a shutter door. You know, the ones with slats in them?? Not cool. The shower also did not accomodate 2 people very well, and that was glass also. Very little privacy in the suite. And then there was the bed. VERY uncomfortable. We checked the mattress and it is this miserable thin thing. We only assumed this "luxury" resort would have at least nice beds. The linens were pretty scratchy and standard Days Inn fare with the velour blanket and silly "comforter". We've stayed at Doubletrees for $130-$150 a night and had more luxury (awesome beds, pillows, comforters, cookies!) than this place. We were so tired at the end of the night that we never complained about most things to the staff, and put up with all the issues. I am sure that if we had said something, the friendly staff would have tried to fix it as best they could, even though the website practically guarantees perfection. Oh well. Was it worth the half rate of $189? No, since you are only paying for location, (which was fantastic). We would walk a few extra blocks or a different view to get a better room next time. I don't know about the other rooms, but room 506 did not live up to the hype. PS: Honeymooners: Don't expect any upgrades, champagne, etc. Us and another couple had made it quite clear that it was a honeymoon and neither received anything. Some people are just lucky, but don't expect it.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Key is the place to be...maybe.”
Reviews.Author: playamongthestars
Reviews.Content: My husband, 14 month old daughter, and I recently spent one week at Ocean Key. Overall, the resort is quite marvelous and it made our first time in Key West very appealing. We were upgraded to a one bedroom Oceanview room and the view were magnificient, especially during sunset. Every staff member with whom we interacted was professional, courteous, and friendly. We had two minor issues during our stay and they were both resolved almost immediately. Although our stay was spectacular, I do want to point out what I think were some of the cons of the resort. Considering there was an LG flat screen plasma TV in the room, there were some items in our room that surprisingly were dated and in need of updating/repair. For example, the jacuzzi tub in the bedroom needed to be updated. Also, there was a piece of metal rim at the base of the sliding doors to the balcony that was completely bent and appeared dangerous for an adult to step over, never mind a 14 month old. We also noticed that the tile floors in the room was very dirty. We were uncomfortable walking around with bare feet. We did request it to be cleaned, and they happily accommodated the request. However, as the days went on, the floors got dirty quickly and they don't appear to clean the floors at all. I know, I know...these are nitpickey items but this is a high-end, luxury resort. They should have these details down. Regardless, it is a wonderful resort. The property is nice but not as nice as the Pier House across the street (we took a walk over on the advice of some other guests). One bit of advice: if you are looking for a quiet room to retire in, do not ask for a room directly over or near the Sunset Pier restaurant/bar -- it is LOUD, and we were there during their slow time!

Reviews.Title: “Too much for too little”
Reviews.Author: PatriciaG
Reviews.Content: The location and view are fabulous and the rooms are very colorful and pretty, but for over $400 a night one would expect more for the money. Breakfast is not included. I went with my boyfriend and my nephew and my nephew slept on the sofa bed in the room. Unfortunately, when he opened up the bed there were no sheets or pillows. We called the concierge desk and was told that the sheets and pillows were in a trunk and we would have to make the bed up ourselves. This was just unbelievable for the amount of money we paid for this room and they knew someone was going to be sleeping on the sofa bed. Also, we booked a package which included a champagne welcome. The champage only showed up about four hours after we reminded them about it. I think it would be a great place to stay for about $250/night. It's just not worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough good about this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WI_Suze
Reviews.Content: Going to Key West in July seems a little crazy.....or does it??? Two girlfriends and I took a gamble, our travel agent gave us a deal we couldn't refuse. Ocean Key Resort and Spa is absolutely the place to stay in Key West. Our balcony looked out on Mallory Square, the pool was steps from the ocean, the view was perfect. Whether we chose to be a part of the Mallory Square celebration or not, was an easy decision. We watched it all from our balcony when we were too lazy to join the celebration. We had to remind the housekeeping staff about three women in the suite, but that was our only complaint. The rooms are just fine, the interior decoration is perfect for the Keys. The sunset pier is so close, the address being 0 Duval Street is perfect for getting around. I will definetely stay at Ocean Key Resort and Spa on my next Key West vacation. By the way, don't miss Casa De Pepe on Mallory Square, try anything, the food is wonderful and the music is intoxicating.

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: travelerSL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had an oceanview boutique suite for 4 nights ; July 17-20, on a package arranged through the hotel that included 2 cocktails daily, full breakfast at the Hot Tin Roof each day, and a voucher for use at the spa which was a $67.00 value. (more on this later)The room was very colorful, large and comfortable. From our balcony (3rd floor) we had a view out over the pool, Mallory Square, and the ocean. I think we liked this better than the rooms at the back of the hotel which were direct ocean front, but no views of Mallory Square, or the pool. We emptied the honor bar (put everything on the dresser above) and went to CVS next door to stock the refrigerator with our own drinks. This lead to a mistaken charge of $25 on our bill that was quickly removed at check out. The service at this hotel was exceptional. Each day the lounges at the pool are covered with towels, and you are given another one to use. The staff delivers iced water with lemon or lime, as well as any drinks or food you may want to purchase. They also have a bucket of all types of sunscreen for guests to use. Though the pool is small it is perfectly positioned for sea breezes and watching the boat traffic. One day a crusie ship parked right in front of the pool which was awful. All other days they docked on the other side of Mallory Square down by the Hilton. Breakfast at the Hot Tin Roof was very good with nice variety; a pot of coffee, a USA Today paper, and prompt service. We did not eat any other meals at the hotel, but were told dinner there is amazing. We did eat at Conch Republic (not good), Michaels (wonderful) and A&B Lobster which was very good if not for the rude attitude of the staff. Island Dog Bar right around the corner from the hotel had great burgers, and light fare as well as A/C and entertainment. Overall we had a great trip and would definitely stay at this hotel again. Our only regeret was that we did not check out the spa until our next to last day. The certificates did not have a value on them, and we found that they could be applied toward any service even though they indicated a head, shoulders, and foot massage. I quickly booked the signature facial, and my husband was able to squeeze in a massage one day and pedicure the next day. The spa is busy and I would suggest making appointments as far in advance as possible. Since we waited until the last minute and did not want to waste the certificates, we had to take the spa services that were available but still checked out leaving 5 unused. Sunset Pier was a lot of fun. It is right on the other side of the hotel from Mallory Square, and has entertainment each evening at sunset. The staff was great, efficient, and very friendly. We had a 6 pm flight out and asked about checkibng out later than the posted time of 11 am. They gladly let us check out at noon and the extra hour was just enough time for the rain to quit.

Reviews.Title: “Fell In Love with Ocean Key”
Reviews.Author: BobCat06
Reviews.Content: Ocean Key was wonderful, We have traveled to The caribean and Stayed at Many different 4 and 5 star Beach and Ocean resorts, I have to say that Ocean Key was on of the best. We had a 1 bedroom suite, that was Ocean front . I was very nervous about booking here, because of some of the reveiws. We were treated great by the front desk and the rest of the staff. They met our every need. The Pool staff was great also. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Pivo2000
Reviews.Content: We had an older room - not one of the newer ones - and so the room looked like... But it was a very clean room with much space and a beautiful view. Pool area is very nice and not crowded. The best on the hotel is its location directly at Mallory Square in the heart of Key West with bras and restaurants surrounding it. Would stay in this hotel again but would book one of the newer rooms wich look much nicer on the website.

Reviews.Title: “How to please two 16 year old girls & two over 40's!”
Reviews.Author: Roxy-Popsy
Reviews.Content: Idyllic for all of us is the only way to describe our stay at the Ocean Key Resort. It is difficult to please teenagers & us oldies but we did exactly that by staying at the Ocean Key. We found the best deal by 'phoning the hotel direct, it was an even better rate than quoted on their website.We stayed for 2 nights commencing 30th June in 1 of only 2 (I believe) 2 bed/2bath suites. On advice, by 'phone from the reservations dept, we chose the suite on the 4th floor that has the better view of the 2 suites. This is room 410 & overlooks the pier & ocean. However, the view is 'softened' by the palm trees which I guess will continue to grow. It is a spacious suite which gave our girls a sense of being in an apartment. There was a fully fitted kitchen which included dishwasher & washing machine, a good-sized dining area & also sitting room area. Our bedroom was large with a jacuzzi tub in it & a huge sleigh bed. 2 hand basins, toilet & shower were in the bathroom. Our bedroom also had a door leading out onto the large balcony which also had french doors leading to the sitting area of our suite. The second bedroom had a large double bed & bathroom with half-sunken bath as well as all the usual necessary facilities.This had a good-sized window which overlooked the courtyard. On the balcony were 2 chairs & a table, also 2 recliners & table. The chairs & recliners were covered with thick comfy cushions. the quality was excellent as was true of all the furnishings.We all enjoyed sitting on our balcony letting life go by. The pool was good & never crowded even though it was pre-4th July weekend. I like the touch of the staff always being on hand to give you fresh towels & laying 2 towels on each lounger each time some guests had departed. We ate at The Pier one evening & thoroughly enjoyed watching the sunset & listening to fab live music from an excellent singer.It isn't expensive when you consider the location & unbeatable view. I had a couple of 'Foto Finnish' cocktails at $7.50 each.They wosh lurrvvly! I won't repeat the praise that has been heaped upon Ocean Key but, I do agree with it. Also, take note of the useful comments that tripadviser users have given. The girls I had made use of the Spaaaaaaaaaaaah. Wonderful treatments & worth every penny if that is the sort of treat you like. Do note that service is added on top of the prices quoted & then tax. Do make sure that you take a trip on the 'Conch Train', $25 per head but, a great way to see & learn lots in an hour & a half. We did the 'Original Ghost Tour'(make sure it is the ORIGINAL TOUR , not the Legends) on Friday evening. $15 per head with discount coupon available in the hotel reception. Try to go on a night that 'Brant' is your guide, he is fantastic, the girls loved him. Again great entertainment & value for the money. Go to Ocean Key & enjoy everything that we & other tripadviser commentators have enjoyed. We had a couple of issues which the management sorted promptly, courteously & efficiently. Do take care when booking a room/suite. Ocean view overlooks the pool below which could be noisy & then the ocean with cruise ships coming & going on various days so check. Ocean front overlooks The Pier & harbour & ocean. The view here on the lower floors could be interupted by palm trees. Think about what you want. Also the type of room/suite you want. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “friendliest service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We travelled a lot and this hotel gets our vote for the friendlies service EVER. Hotel has a great location on the harbour next to the square. The restaurant is one of the best in Key West. room is spacious, nice balocny, great bed, large bathroom, 2 TV's. You have to pay about $20 extra for valet parking but this is the way it's in Key West. Pool is a bit small but the staff in the pool are on top of things with cold water and clean towels are distributed routinely. Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Max013
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the Ocean Key and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The check in process was excellent and as our bags were taken to the room we were shown where everything was. There is an $18 per day charge for parking but as the hotel is directly on Mallory Square we expected to be charged. We had one of the cheaper rooms at the back but still had a partial ocean view and the spa bath was great but if you are a little unsteady on your feet it can be difficult to get into as it is quite deep. Once in it is really refreshing. As the hotel is built around a courtyard it can sometimes be noisy but generally we had no problems. The room was a good size and kept clean and there were free robes to use. The service around the pool was excellent. We were brought iced water every hour or so and cold flannels to mop our sweating brows, all gratis. A young girl, I think called Jaime, was especially helpful and chatty and had excellent customer service. We did not eat in as there are so many restaurants within walking distance which are alot cheaper. We did have a nice breakfast overlooking the ocean which wasn't too badly priced. We would stay again and would recommend it but it is not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: YvoParadise
Reviews.Content: The location of the Ocean Key Resort can't be beat. With the hotel located at the end of Duval St. you are close to great restaurants, water activities and Mallory Square. Did lots of research before deciding where to stay and based on the reviews from Trip Advisor chose the Ocean Key Resort. First of all, the entire hotel staff are exceptional folks - they are friendly and very helpful. We had a junior suite on the top floor which was nicely decorated and had cathedral ceilings which made the room seem very roomy. Only drawback for me was there was a skylight which apparently all the top floor rooms have which makes it difficult to sleep in with all the sunlight pouring in. The hotel's restaurant, Hot Tin Roof, was decorated very nicely as well as the lounge area where we enjoyed having a drink each night and watching the sunset plus all the boats sail by. We had breakfast one morning which was very good and sat outside on their covered lanai which has a great view. Other restaurant suggestions are the Roof Top Cafe very close to the hotel which has wonderful food (celebrated our anniversary there) and the ambiance is very nice. We had a very nice lunch at the Grand Cafe where we ate inside which is very nicely decorated and was a short walk from the hotel. Overall, we enjoyed our 3 days in Key West and being close to everything was a plus. Yes, it costs $18 to park your car each day, but we felt it was well worth it since finding a place to park in Key West can be difficult. We look forward to returning to Key West and will definitely stay in the Ocean Key Resort once again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tracym2340
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Ocean Key. My husband, myself, and our 12 year old daughter loved it. The service, the location, the room, the pool, and the view are all awesome. We had the junior suite and it was perfect for the 3 of us. The decor is great and the room is spacious and very clean. Breakfast at the Tin Roof restaurant was included too. It was very good. What a great stay and vacation. Key West is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Key and Key West a Perfect Combination”
Reviews.Author: Kjoeradio
Reviews.Content: We stayed last summer at Ocean Key for 2 nights and chose it again for 5 nights this year. It was every bit as good as last year. The staff was extremely courteous at check in and everytime we were walking through the lobby. The bar staff although efficient at the Tiki Bar could get a little more personality but knew how to pour a generous drink. The people servicing the pool from the bar were wonderful. When we come back to Key West it will most definitely find us staying at Ocean Key. The location can't be beat. The only little complaint was I brought a laptop - unfortunately not wireless and had to use the dial up connection - racked up a $900 phone bill - at check out the gentleman did credit me $767 but still stuck with $133. Wonderful resort, pool, location, bar.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place to Stay in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: pandoram920
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying in Key West at Ocean Key from 6/11-6/13/06. We are Florida Natives and come to Key West for some R&R every year or so and have stayed in many different resorts on the Island. I booked on their website for a Junior Suite and we got a Florida Resident discount, so the bill came out to around 210.00 per night with taxes and fees, which is very reasonable especially for the quality and location of this hotel. Let me begin by saying that the Ocean Key far exceeded our expectations and from now on, we will only stay at the Ocean Key! Arrival: We pulled up to the Ocean Key at about 1:30 PM at the end of Duval Street, and we were greeted so warmly by the bellman. He welcomed us very heartily to the Ocean Key, asked us if he could take care of our bags and also our car. When we walked in we were also greeted very warmly by all of the desk attendants and the concierge. We went to the desk and proceeded with check-in. They informed us that our room was not ready yet, but that they would take care of our things and they had our cellphone number and would call us when the room was ready, and to go have fun while we waited. As we left the lobby we just couldn't believe how warm the welcome was, I mean, we have stayed at many places before, but never had we been received before in this way! It may seem like a small thing to some of you, but this really set the tone for our vacation! Room: After about 45 minutes of sightseeing, we received the call from the desk saying that our room was ready. We made a short walk back to the hotel and received our room keys and the bellman got our bags and showed us to the room. He showed us to the elevator, all the while telling us about some of the happenings on the Island during our stay. He then brought us to our room and left. We did notice soon after he left that this room didn't have a jacuzzi tub and I had expected one as it described on the website. I phoned the desk and explained my concern, and they quickly told me that they would see if they could get us a room with the jacuzzi tub and would call me right back. Two minutes later, they rang and said that the bellman was on his way back up to take us to our new room. FYI, if you would like the jacuzzi tub, be sure to ask for one with the Junior Suite, some only have a standing shower. When we got to our new room, we were so impressed. When you walk in you have a living room, complete with sofa bed, chair, coffee table, a credenza with a TV and mini-bar fridge stocked with goodies (they are very expensive though!). You then have a hall-way with a large closet with extra pillows. Next is the beautiful bedroom with a large Island Style bed with tropical bedspread, lots of comfy pillows and even a tropical teddy bear (too cute)! Nearby the bed is the jacuzzi tub (yeah!) and the bedroom has a tall wood-paneled vaulted cieling with a fan to keep you cool. The restroom is a long hallway with double pedestal sinks, two more closets and a toilet closet with a standing shower. There is also a dressing area with a stool and lots of their yummy smelling toiletries from Spa Terre (the coconut lotion was my fave!) There is an armoire decorated Island Style with another TV and 4 roomy drawers for your clothes. On top of all of this you have a french door leading out to the balcony with a table and two comfy chairs where we had a view of the water to our left and Duval street and Key West to our right. We loved coming out here to see all the goings-on and to chill in between our activities. Dining: We had breakfast at Hot Tin Roof which was amazing! I had the Noble Benedict which had wilted baby spinach, canadian bacon, two poached eggs, Florida lobster meat and a key lime hollandaise--very yummy! My husband had the Ocean Key benedict which was a split homemade biscuit with sausage, scrambled eggs, melted cheese and gravy..very yummy as well. The prices were reasonable and the food was excellent! We didn't have lunch or dinner here though, those meals looked a little more pricey. We had drinks at the Sunset Pier, but never dined there, but we did enjoy the view and the close proximity to Mallory Square. Location: This hotel has to be in the best spot if you love to explore Duval Street! You are close to Hog's Breath, Sloppy Joe's, Front Street and the harbor restaurants and shops, watersports activities, and of course Mallory Square and the sunset celebration. We have stayed in other locations, but this was, to us the best location for what we wanted to do while we were here. Customer Service: I can't say enough about how friendly and helpful the staff was during our stay. For instance, my husband was badly in need of a haircut and they recommended Salon 128 to us and they took him right away, gave him a quick and great haircut and it wasn't pricey either. We felt confident to ask them anything we needed and got helpful advice everytime! Tip: There is a CVS pharmacy/convenience store downstairs and next to the Ocean Key. I would recommend stocking up on all of your snacks, sodas, beers, etc. here instead of using the items in the mini-fridge, it will save you lots of $$! I wish we knew about that beforehand. Overall: This vacation we took was honestly the best stay we have ever had on the island, thanks to the Ocean Key, even though the weather wasn't so great due to Tropical Storm Alberto. Our room was awesome, the extras were the best, the prices were reasonable, the food and drink was good, the location unbeatable, and the customer service was top-notch. Again, for these Florida Natives and regular Key West visitors, we will only stay at Ocean Key!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: The Shannons
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed more than 25 times in Key West, in fact, we were married there; and we are pretty picky when it comes to hotels, typically stay at Four Seasons or upscale properties whenever we can. Key West has very few full service resorts; we've stayed at them all from the Hyatt to Sunset Key, plus a ton of B&B's. The Ocean Key impressed us. The location cannot be beat. It is directly next to Mallory Square, where the Sunset Festival takes place, and SO convenient to all the hotspots on Duval. Our room was a lovely, spacious, 1 bedroom ocean view on the top floor. The water view was wonderful! We didn't have a direct view of the sunset, but the green-blue water was just outside our window and we had a HUGE balcony. We had a large jacuzzi tub in our bedroom and a separate living area. The decor was light, airy and beachy, and the room was immaculate. I can't say enough about the friendly service. We were greeted with a smile and an enthusiastic greeting every time we entered the lobby. We never were far away from a staff member, and a call to the front desk about a minor mechanical issue was answered immediately. The pool was wonderful, and the server was available to deliver drinks and food. Our package included daily breakfast at Hot Tin Roof, and the breakfast was delicious- the only complaint we have about our entire experience is that the service was a bit slow and inaccurate at the Hot Tin Roof. All in all, the typical "Key West Attitude" present in many B&B's and resorts on the island wasn't a problem at the Ocean Key The staff was wonderful, the accomodations were great, and we wouldn't hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Key Resort - perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: txcyn
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 25th anniversary at Ocean Key Resort. Ocean Key resort is in the perfect location. Room was perfect overlooking the ocean. Staff was very pleasant. Will definitely return..

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 nights in the hotel as a last minute extension to our honeymoon in the keys. we chose the Ocen Key resort because we had spent time in one of their sister hotels and were impressed. We called and made the booking the day before we arrived - we got given 2 different rates in the space of an hour and were told that we hadn't been given the cheaper rate earlier. when we arived, we were told that the restaurant was closed both nights we were there and that the pool area would be cleared in the afternoon in preparation for weddings. one of the bar areas was also closed for a private function. The room was very large and clean but very dated. The shower/toliet area was very cramped and there was a jacuzzi bath in the bedroom. The room was very different from the way it was described at the time of booking, although we had a much better view than the "partial ocen view" described. At 8.30am saturday builders started work on the roof directly above us and were even looking in through the gable roof windows directly into the bedroom. We decided to cut short our stay and when we complained to the hotel management, our complaint was handled well and professionally.

Reviews.Title: “Bright Cheerful Huge Room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Read several of the reviews before booking hotel and was a little skeptical, but our room turned out to be GREAT! We went to the Keys with two other couples and visited their rooms in other hotels. But when they came to our's they were dually impressed. We had a fabulously HUGE bathroom with jacuzzi tub, double pedastel sink...quite a luxury. Our bright and colorful room had a large sitting area, plus on two evenings all six of us hung out on our oversized balcony, had drinks from our bar and enjoyed the music and entertainment on Mallory Square. We did have views of cruise ships most mornings but they in no way obstructed our ocean view. As a matter of fact, we found them quite impressive in their stature and condition. The Hilton really had a hard time with cruise ships. The ships docked right in front of their hotel each morning although you never heard them coming in and it was cool to see how they left every afternoon. We only happened to see them from a distance, not a big deal at all. They have to depart every evening before sunset NO EXCEPTIONS as to not obstruct everyone's view of the ocean during sunsets. The staff was courteous and helpful and always prompt with requests. I would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Don't understand bad reviews!”
Reviews.Author: bobsakamano
Reviews.Content: We got married here and stayed from April 17th-23rd. For the life of me, I cannot understand some of the bad reviews. Maybe it was becasue we were getting married here and we were spending alot of cash, but I really doubt it. From the moment we set foot here, we were treated above and beyond our expectations. We had stayed one night at the Pier House the night before and had to meet with our vendors throughout the day so we walked into the Ocean Key at around 9am and they immediately congratulated us on our upcoming wedding before we even introduced ourselves. (They saw her wedding dress in a David's Bridal bag.) They said they would hold our 5 bags of stuff and call us when our room was ready. They ended up calling us at 1130 so we had a quick lunch at Lobo's and headed back. When we got there, our luggage was waiting in Room 418 and when we walked in, we realized they upgraded us from a Jr Suite to a big Boutique Suite. It had a great bathroom that my fiance (wife) loved!!! It had a 42 inch flatscreen TV too. Yes, the colors may be a bit tacky, but so what! The bed was a kingsleigh and was very confortable also. Yes, the pool area is not huge, but I always was serviced quickly and was given towels, drinks, and food by Charles the pool guy in a pretty timely manner. The water was a perfect temperature for conditions becasue it cooled you off quick and you could adjust to it quickly. It was not bathwater so it made it more enjoyable. The tiles are scorching hot arounf the pool so make sure you keep your flipflops on too. The spa services were top notch too and while thier workout area is small, I never had anyone else in there when I worked out so it was not a problem. They set up snorkeling and jet skiiing for me with no problem too. Room service was better than average. The only negative I have is that their elevators need some work. I was on the 4th floor so I took the stairs the majority of the time because I cant wait for an elevator more than a minute. However, that complaint is a very small one and really should not effect your stay. I have stayed at sprawling 5 star resorts the last three years with far more amenities than here but I had ten times the experience here than I did at any one of them. I appreciated that I was just not a number and that they treated us like guests should be treated. Hail the Ocean Key!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Hospitable Staff and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WellTraveled3
Reviews.Content: The Ocean Key is the place to stay in Key West if you want to be right on the water, close to Mallory Square, at the very start of Duval Street (the address is actually 0 Duval). The staff is very friendly and extremely helpful. We were referred by the Hilton after they failed to find us a non-smoking room, and the people at the Ocean Key could not have been more accomodating--they provided us with an upgraded two bedroom suite with a large plasma TV in one room (regular TV and large bed in the other). The oceanfront suites have a great view and the only drawback is some noise at night from the outdoor bar, if you are planning to turn in early, you just need to pull the heavy curtains. Seem to be alot or return guests who have been coming here from years. The bell staff is also very helpful and valet parking is provided so all you need to do is drive up and throw them the keys---not like other hotels where you are charged heavily for parking in garages or lots near Duval Street. Really enjoyed our stay at the Ocean Key and will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice...But still under construction...Pricey”
Reviews.Author: jbbrown
Reviews.Content: Just return from the Keys and a stay at the Ocean Key. This was our 5th. time staying at the Key and was our worst so far. The Key is a nice Hotel, don't get me wrong as we have stayed at others, Pier House, Ocean Reach, etc. which were not as nice. However this time it went wrong from the start. We arrived at the 4:00 p.m. flight from Orlando. Once we were there they only had 1 Junior Suite ready, so I think no problem. Wrong. The suite was a handicap suite on the 2nd. floor. I'm sorry but we are not handicapped and it wasn't what we were exspecting. We took it anyway to be nice. Well after a couple of hours the air conditioning went out. 78 degrees in the room, no way was this going to work. They generously sent someone to work on it, but we requested a move, which was only 1 door down. Ok, now we have a room and its cool. Then the next morning we are awaken at 7:00 a.m. by the sewer truck pumping S**t from the drains at the resort. What a wreck. Finally after about 30 minutes the truck blew up...thank goodness for this, there was smoke everywhere, not to say the noise was unbelieveable. Well, maybe a day at the pool was going to be better. Wrong again, they had 6 electricians which only 1 looked like he was working trying to fix the speaker and lights from the hurricane. They were always running back and forth trying to determine where they were going to put a box. Finally the straw that broke the camels back was the poor JACK HAMMER they used to go through the concrete at the pier. This must have went on for an hour and a half before we finally had to leave. They really need to get a grip on things as this has always been our favorite place to stay and now its moved way down due to these poor management decisions. The personnel are always super nice, I just question the higher ranks decisions.

Reviews.Title: “NIce but expensive”
Reviews.Author: NHVaca1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weeklong stay. Overall we had a nice experience. Pros: The location is PRIME (best benefit of the hotel), the rooms were nice (adequate but not exceptional) and most of the staff were very friendly and helpful. Cons: The pool is small, can be crowded and is not well serviced. Specifically, there were times late in the day when it was difficult to get a chair and towels were non-existent. Since it was not good beach weather while we were there, this was disappointing for us. Perhaps the biggest negative for the hotel is the cost. It is expensive and just not a good value. Other hotels seemed to be less expensive. This was our first trip to Key West and although we enjoyed the trip, we've had better trips in the Carribean for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Rip off!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed with our choice of hotel. For almost $500 a night, we expected much more from this " 4 star hotel". The hotel website and search engine virtual tours are very misleading. Everything in the hotel is exhorbitantly priced, the service is barely average, the pool is small and often crowded. We had breakfast at the hotels resturant "Hot Tin Roof" and we were appauled that our waiter had at least 4 warts on his hands...in clear view!! As you can imagine it put us off returning to Hot tin roof again. We were charged an extra $150 on checkout for movies we had not ordered, valet services we had not used etc. I have to say that the room was spacious and had a nice view of Mallory Square. Unfortunately there is no access to the beach from the hotel, but the hotel is well located near the historic marine district, duval street and most of the tours. When we return to Key wesy we will be staying at the Hilton resort and Marina. The location is excellent, classy and service is superb.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly & Helpful Staff, Would Definifitely Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a boutique suite and it was very spacious and nice. The bed was very comfortable. I had an incredible view of the beautiful water and Mallory Square. The breakfast was good at the Hot Tin Roof restaurant located on property. Others is our party utilized the room service and they spoke highly of it. I can't say enough about the friendly service provided by all of the staff at the hotel. They were a joy. The hotel is located at the very end of Duval St. where the sun sets each evening. It is a perfect location and was close to all of the great places like the Hogs Breath Inn and Irish Kevins, two places our group enjoyed for their entertainment. There are so many great places in the area... something for everyone. The food was great at the local restaurants, with lots of choices and price ranges. With regard to price of the rooms... I think all of accomodations are high priced in Key West compared to other places that I have traveled. You will not be disapointed with the Ocean Key. When I return I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Potentially nice hotel, but not a 4-star. Sadly in need of updating, especially bathrooms (Think early 80's Holiday Inn motiff) Booked one of the most expensive (and supposedly best) suites in the hotel .. oceanfront with private balcony. The suite was not quite 'as described' on the website .. no king sleigh bed, no marble bath. They also failed to mention the cruise ships that arrive daily at 6am and park directly outside your suite. No view of ocean, no privacy on balcony (or in suite), and NO SUNSET until the ships depart sometime between 3-7pm. Small but nice pool if you don't mind the 10-story ship parked within a few yards overlooking. There are better hotels in Key West with good locations without the cruise ship hassel. Feb 28, 2006

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Been to Key West twice. First time on other end of Duval (the quiet end) and put many miles on the shoes to get to the action. Ocean Key by far is the best from the time you walk in to when they close the cab door bidding you farewell. Rooms were clean, big and bright. Our balcony had a palm tree right in front of beautiful view but who cared everything else made up for it. Don't know what that other person was complaining about. Maybe expected too much after hurricane. I do believe they have done a fantastic recovery. Can't wait till next year. Same place, room time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to Honeymoon, and I will never stay anywhere else when I travel to Key West in the future. We ate almost all breakfast's and one dinner at the Hot Tin Roof; it was great! The pool area was great and staff was very accomodating at restaurant and pool and Tiki Bar. Request a room on the top (fifth) floor. Cruise ship parks in front of hotel on Wednesday. I was very weary about accomodations for my Honeymoon but could not have asked for better than The Ocean Key.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were impressed with Ocean Key from the moment we pulled up outside. The lobby is beautiful, and everyone is helpful and friendly. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived, so they took our cell phone number, and called us when it was. They so kindly upgraded us to a suite! It was larger than our apartment! Wonderful private balcony, full kitchen, washer and dryer (which came in VERY handy after a day of fishing, and let us go home with a suitcase full of clean clothes), whirlpool tub, gorgeous decor. Staff was always helpful with restaurant and activity recommendations, or answering general questions. We can't wait to see a full recovery from last year's hurricane season. The only thing we didn't like was that we had didn't have easy access to our car because of the expensive valet service. I know parking is at a premium in Key West, but at the prices the hotel charges, it would be nice if parking was included.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Key is the best there is”
Reviews.Author: WorldAtSea
Reviews.Content: For a town that is so layed back this hotel stays on top of things. Lovely huge rooms. Nice spa treatments, but call early. Hot tin roof was delicious. Try not to get a room near the parking lot or you will hear the roosters in the morning. The gymis small but adequate. we had a wedding reception there in december and it was nicely done. gets chilly at night though so be warned in the winter. the deck has since been destroyed so you will see it in the photos but it isnow gone. they are going to rebuild it though, but double check before you go.

Reviews.Title: “Not a luxury hotel but a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ok...we were expecting a luxury hotel seeing that we paid about $400/night so we were disapointed to see that this hotel was more like a 3 star hotel not a 4 star. The room was big but the furniture was ratan and uncomfortable. Also mattress was not comfortable-old most likely. Service at front desk was below average-very rude. The staff was impatient when asked questions and did not give us much attention. Also when we requested a late checkout they made a huge deal and only extended our request by 1 hour!! Again seeing we paid $400/night and seeing we checked in at 4.00 p.m when we arrived.... you figure they would be more accomodating! The Sheraton has shown us much better service by allwoing us to extend our checkout by 3 hours. Food at Hot Tin Roof was not very good. Not sure why they rant and rave about this resaturant. Definatley overpriced for the quality of food. Try A&B instead but dont order the salads-they didnt wash the lettuce -lots of sand in there! Spa was what made our stay fun and memorable. Service at the spa was terrific. Very friendly and warm. Tip: If you get a facial ask for Yahnna. Try and make your apointments so that you end at least 30 mins before they close.

Reviews.Title: “Used to be much better!”
Reviews.Author: traveler1345
Reviews.Content: Last February and also this February we are choosing to stay somewhere other than Ocean Key. In 2003 we had a fabulous stay, the Hot Tin Roof restaurant was phenomenal and we had attentive poolside service as well. In 2004 it seemed like we were staying at a different hotel. In 2003, we were even greeted by staff by our names probably ten times. In 2004, we were barely acknowledged with a "Hello". Cleanliness and condition of room both went down, while the price went up. Our room was very moldy and my son's roll away bed looked like something one of the homeless in Mallory Square had been lounging on. As I mentioned before, the friendliness factor declined, too. The Hot Tin Roof restaurant also seemed to be a shadow of its former self. No more does Ocean Key feel like the upscale spot to spend my vacation time and money on.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were on a work trip in Florida and decided to check out Key West for a couple of days. We reserved a room at the Ocean Key and when we arrived we found that they had upgraded our room......Surprised. We wondered why but didn't ask. Our room was beautiful. Spacious, clean with a perfect view of the bay and Mallory Square. The staff was very helpful and friendly. We will definitely go back.....Thank you Ocean Key for making our first trip to Key West unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Needs improvment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ocean Key in early Jan, 2006. We narrowed our hotel picks down to three in Key West (Hyatt, Hilton and Ocean Key.) Both the Hyatt and Hilton wanted well over 400 dollars for any room with an ocean view. The Ocean Key offered a partial ocean view with a balcony and hot tub for $269. We check in (staff was friendly but over worked.) Walked into our room and the bed had not been made? Bell boy called house keeping. 10 mins. later 3 house keepers arrive and clean room. Room is roughly 400 sq. ft. but quite worn. Bath room had two sinks, a large walk in shower and a deep hot tub. The room was on the 4th floor and the balcony was quite big and had a partial ocean view, but you could also watch the whole sun set festival from your room. The bad parts that stick out are on the second day a cruise liner parked in front of the hotel and blocked the whole ocean view. After further inspection of the hot tub, it looked like it was pulled out of a condemned trailer in Marathon. All the knobs were rusted, broken or missing. There was no hot water (only luke warm) and the tub would take at least 1.2hrs to fill up. Really, we timed it. Also, they had pay per view, but you could not order movies? Our room was not hooked up for that? There were chips, knicks and scratches all over. Pool was small, but well heated. I thought it was worth the $269 because of the location (it is in the most exciting spot in Key West) and the balcony. I am not sure if you can call it a "resort" though.

Reviews.Title: “Skipping Christmas . . . in the Keys!”
Reviews.Author: edm08551
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 5 days lolling around Key West. What a wonderful time! The weather was perfect and the hotel was excellent. I had stayed at the Ocean Key years ago, but found it to be even better than before. We arrived to find that we had been upgraded to a wonderful gulf-front room. (Why? We didn't want to know!) It was spacious with a great deck overlooking the awesome cruise ships and/or the gulf, depending upon which way you looked. In addition, it also gave us a bird's eye view of Mallory Square, the congregating area for each evening's sunset celebration. The bathroom was gorgeous; the showerhead provided for an addictive shower experience! The restaurants were fine; food was the usual stuff, nothing too inventive (although we didn't make dinner at the hotel - just sampled the outdoor waterfront cafe for lunch, and the regular restaurant for breakfast). The only negative to the hotel was the early morning sound of roosters (yes, roosters!!) crowing constantly and loudly from 3 a.m. onward. It seems they hang out around the nearby Cuban restaurant, although they are somewhat of an island thing anyway. It was annoying not to be able to sleep. The concierge assisted with snorkeling and parasailing reservations, as well as scooter rentals. We'd go back in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury prices, but not a luxury resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: agree with the 2 prior reviews. the hotel is BADLY in need of a make over. the rooms very VERY tired looking, and could do with a face lift - the hotel must realize that just putting up a plasma TV does not do it. the prices are way too high for this hotel to get away with providing the mediocre rooms and service the hotel is also in an incredibly noisy place (rooms facing the ocean) with the bar downstairs, and there is absolutely no privacy on the lower floors.

Reviews.Title: “Unique, friendly and so nice to visit!”
Reviews.Author: DJBoca
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out (which included complimentary chilled bottled water for the trip home), we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. A wonderul suite that felt so comfortable and unique; not the usual "cookie cutter" hotel room. Tile floors, ceiling fan, flat screen tv, jacuzi tub in the bedroom, huge balcony with a marvelous view of the sunset... what more could you ask? Friendly staff: courteous, helpful, checked in to see if we needed fresh towels and gave us a small gift as a thank you... again, what more can you ask? Wonderful music on the rebuilding pier (Thanks Wilma!), boats to rent and take private trips and the location at the end of Duval street gives you access to everything! We had a marvelous little trip and will stay here every time we go to Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Lacking in Several Ways”
Reviews.Author: Grazzidad
Reviews.Content: I don't mean to sound a note of dissent among the chorus of praise for this place, but I must (and, so would my 4 travelling companions). First, the good: the rooms are enormous, clean and well-appointed; in fact, they are probably too large, unless you have many people in a room. The location is unbeatable, if you want to be "where the action is". Some of the staff are friendly, some not (the woman who checked us in was actually surly). Now, the not good: do not come here expecting a *resort*, as the hotel is almost ridiculously short on amenities. The pool is small and spartan, the lobby tiny and cramped, restaurant/bar options highly limited, and there is literally zero to *do* there. NOT recommended for people with small children; they cannot be left to their own devices even for a minute. We found the place to be extremely costly for what it offered; by comparison, we stayed at South Beach right after in a truly magnificent hotel (really, really, REALLY above expectations) called The Palms for less than half the room rate, and it was superior in pretty much every way, except the sheer size of the rooms. That's what competition will do. This place is reasonable if you have money to burn (our room was over $400 a night) and absolutely need to be at Ground Zero of the shoreline. We won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: mercedes88
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the PERFECT location in Key West. If you can, skip the parking and take a cab there. It's right at the beginning of Duval Street where basically everything happens. You can walk right out of your door and rent a golf cart, go on glass bottom boat tour or jet-skiing (would not recomment the jetskiing as they only let you go in a very small area.) You can also walk to the marinas and go deep sea fishing. The outdoor bar was really fun except they were always in a hurry to close once the sun went down. Great drinks though and good apps. Our ocean view was incrediable and we had a front row seat to the world known sunsets. Our friends had a side view which was alright but their room was HUGE! 2 bedroon suite (by mistake) with a kitchenette, plenty of room for 4 or family. The only downside was we requested a wake up call, which we never got and missed our flight. The hotel was very apologetic and did give us a partial refund to cover the fes we incurred with the airline. So bring your own alarm and enjoy the hotel, it's really unique and beautiful! Oh, go to world's smallest bar on Duval - it's great!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous room!!!”
Reviews.Author: grantsfavorite
Reviews.Content: We loved our room, loved the staff, loved the location!! Our room overlooked Mallory Square, had a perfect view when the cruise ship wasn't docked and it wasn't too bad when it was. The food was excellent, the staff at the bar and pool were great~served complimentary Key Lime sorbet poolside to all of the guests...it was awesome!! The only issue we had was when we were leaving we tried working out a deal to stay longer at the rate we got through our travel site and they didn't go for it. Oh well!

Reviews.Title: “Can you say "Room Upgrade??" :)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have come to the Keys 3 other times and it's always a great experience; this time was no exception! Romantic, close to everything but tucked back far enough on Duval to be quiet and secluded. We got a room upgrade to a 1-bedroom from a junior suite. HUGE canopied bed, cool tiled floor, tropical decor, and the best black-out curtains money can buy! We were ocean-side, just above the pool, with a roomy balcony. There were a few cruise ships but nothing blocked our view of the sunsets or the nightly Mallory Square festivities. The Sunset Pier grill had good food and great drinks with reasonable prices but tacked on an automatic gratuity for just 2 people at lunch. I would have tipped more than the 15%, but since they felt obliged to help themselves, 15% is all they got. All in all, a great trip and we were very lucky to be there BETWEEN hurricanes. We will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, great place to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Reet28
Reviews.Content: I was nervous enough about two Brits visiting Key West, but also about if I had chosen the right place for us to stay. I had read all the reports on Trip Advisor and concluded we needed to stay at Ocean Key. It was definitely the right decision. I had booked by phone and settled on a boutique suite. I was not disappointed. The room was on fourth floor, large, the bathroom splendid and the view superb. We ate at Hot Tin Roof a few times and it was excellent. Drinks and snacks at the Sunset Pier were also very good. We spent some time around the pool; it would have been nice if it were bigger but the activity on the waterway it overlooks made up for any deficiency in pool size. The staff were helpful but not overpowering. One morning we woke up to a cruise ship directly outside. I immediately rang to complain as I had expressedly asked at the time of booking for a room that did not overlook a cruise ship (another review warned me of that!) I was put through to the reservations manager who offered us a room change or a discount on the room price. He could not have been more helpful. I would, and hope I will, definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited the Ocean Key Resort for two nights on 10/6/05 and 10/7/05. Our room, an Ocean View Boutique Suite was wonderful. We were on the 5th floor in room #520. Had a teriffic view of Mallory Square and the ocean. The room was huge, clean, and very Key Westy! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: BillyTTroon_Scotland
Reviews.Content: This is a brilliant hotel! We managed to get one of the rooms overlooking mallory square, which also had an excellent view of the sunsets (room 525). The room itself is very comfortable and spacious. The decor is quite lovely. The bathroom is wonderful, it is large and has a shower and a spa bath, twin sinks and a wc, good lights and plenty of mirrors. The veranda has a great view of the pier area and mallory square. The location of the hotel is right at the end of duval street next to the sunset pier, and is approx 100m from everthing you will need, shops, bars, food, music, entertainment. The staff are very helpful and pleasant. The pool is good sized and deep. This is THE place to stay as far as we are concerned and we would definately stay there again, especially room 525 What a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: antontravel2004
Reviews.Content: I was super impressed with this hotel, which is part hotel and part time share. It is run by Noble House, a chain of luxury hotels. It is right where sunset takes place at Mallory Square. The jacuzzi in the room was huge.. I never saw one that big before. Allison checked us in, and was super nice. There is absolutely no place near to park so you MUST use their valet service ($18 a night I think) if you have a car. It's right next door to the conch train sightseeing tour and CVS pharmacy. The only cheap breakfast place was Burger King, about 6 blocks up Duval Street. The easiest way to get to this hotel is take highway 1 into town, turn right on Duval, and go until you hit water. The hotel is right at the water. The decoration was awesome, with tropical bird lights palms, etc. When I came down at 2 in the morning trying to find a coke machine, the man at the desk said they dont have a machine, but he gave one one of his personal cans of coke totally free. That impressed me. All the staff were nice. I really believe that this was the best hotel I ever stayed at in all my life.. Anton Anderssen, Warren Michigan.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, great views!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ocean Key 10/2-10/7/05 w/ the husband. First time in Key West. Hotel is at the very end of Duval St, close to all the action. Purchased the "Romance" package for $279/night, which included breakfast daily (off the menu, not buffet) in the Hot Tin Roof restaurant and 2 drinks/each daily at the Pier Bar. Made reservation by calling hotel directly, I highly recommend doing that vs internet as we got a better deal than what was advertised online. Room was on top floor (room 514), we had reserved jr suite, but when we arrived we found that we had been upgraded to an oceanfront suite. King size 4 poster bed & tv in one room, living room had tv, mini bar small table. Each room had vaulted ceilings and ceilng fans. Bathroom was nothing exciting, and no jacuzzi, but I'm pregnant and can't use a jacuzzi anyway, so it wasn't missed. The view from the deck was unbelieveable. Our room overlooked the pier, panoramic ocean views, simply gorgeous. When the bellman brought us to the room we thought they had made a mistake, it was a great value for what we paid. Only one day did we wake up with a cruise ship outside our window, and it only blocked a small part of the view. Most of the ships tend to dock in front of the Hilton -I would be mad if I paid for an oceanview there! Service was really good, although we tend to be pretty low-maintainence. The turndown service was a special treat, with a shell left on the bed every night. Found most staff to be extremely friendly. Only ate at the Hot Tin Roof for breakfast, which was very good. Pool is on the small side, but very clean and again had a great view of the water. Service at the pool was spotty, it depended on who was staffing it that day. Chaise lounges were comfy. Tiles around pool do get hot on sunny days. Saw/heard very few kids, which was nice. It's not a hotel that I would choose to bring children to, not much for them to do there. Spa was nice, albeit a bit spendy. Had a great prenatal massage from Andrea. Parking at the hotel is expensive, $18/day, but you're in Key West and there isn't much parking. If we were to do it again we would have turned the car in at the Key West airport after we drove down from Miami. You don't need a car in Key West. Walk or rent a scooter or electric car. Only complaint was the live music at the Pier Bar was really loud at night. If your room overlooks the Pier you will hear it inside your room. They play 7 pm-11 pm, so if you're an "early to bed" type of person or sensitive to noise, you should book a room overlooking Mallory Sq or the city. Through the conceriege we booked a snorkeling/scuba trip on the Sea Breeze, which docks at the end of Front St next to Galleons Resort. A 5 min walk. Highly recommend it. $35 for snorkeling, and I believe $65-70 for scuba. Boat takes both snorkelers and scuba divers at same time, which is nice for couples in which only one is scuba diving. Reef is 7 miles from Key West. 2 dives, 50 min each. We went to Sand Key & Rock Key. Visibility was 40 ft, saw a ton of fish as well as barracuda, 2 nurse sharks, a huge spotted eagle ray (stingray) and a sea turtle. Good crew, including the captain's dog, Shayla. Mac was our favorite dive master. We went back a second time and they took $10 off. We also went on the Conch Train on a cloudy morning - skip it. $25 for 90 min tour was a rip off. Buy a guidebook and walk it/moped it yourself. Our favorite restaurant was Fogarty's on Duval. Get the crab-stuffed grouper - delicious! Overall - a great vacation in laid-back Key West & definitely recommend the Ocean Key Resort!

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Key was 'fantabolous'”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Ocean Key Resort in Key West, Florida and it is a beautiful property. The outside of the building, entrance and the lobby was unassuming and plain...but our suite was awesome! The hotel upgraded us from a junior suite to a one-bedroom suite with a partial ocean view. When we asked for it, the clerk was so super nice--they had already upgraded us. The 'partial view' from the balcony and bedroom was just gorgeous! The balcony was roomy with nice chairs and a small table. Back to the suite -- super clean, the living room was very large, comfortable and the bedroom was a very nice size, bathroom nice with a jacuzzi and separate shower, double sink. The 20 ft tall ceilings were spectacular. I suppose this is only available on the 5th floor of the property...the highest level. The decor was also very pretty, very colorful and decorated with a lot of detail..nice pictures on the wall etc. The kitchen was small but had all the conveniences..microwave, apt size fridge, stove, dishwasher and a washer and dryer. The staff was fantastic, room service great. The pool area was small but it got the job done. It looks toward the ocean. The property is at the end (or maybe the beginning!) of Duval Street and a short walk to Mallory Square. My new husband and I fell in love with the place. We planned our trip w/airfare through Expedia, so I don't remember exactly what the room rate was...but I think it was less than $200 a night. If you can get the room for under that I would definitely go for it.... Oh, do a sunset cruise on Danger Cruises, very nice short sail.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed during Katrina”
Reviews.Author: CKC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived at the Ocean Key Resort just as Katrina was making its way through Miami. We thought the location couldn't be beat, and loved out junior suite room. It had a view of Duval Street and if you stretched your neck, of the Ocean. I awoke at 4:00 am to the howling winds of Katrina, which was about 30 miles away. I thought that the staff was incredible. They were short-staffed that day, but everyone went out of their way to keep things running as smoothly as possible. We only lost power briefly and were lucky, some on the island had no power for 48+ hours. I would highly recommend this beautiful resort and would like to commend its hard-working staff.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Key”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Yes, the location of this hotel is unbeatable....BUT are you kidding me with the 4 diamond rating?? I must start off by stating the staff, aside from the exterminator (and yes I did meet the exterminator, I will get to that later) was extremely pleasant and helpful. A few weeks ago, my husband and I along with 3 other couples checked into the Ocean Key "Resort". We arrived tired from the long drive and excited for what our vacation had in store. Greeted by a friendly face, we were whisked off to our 2 bedroom 2 bathroom suite and junior oceanview suite. We were not impressed with the room at all. It seemed to be clean, until you looked closer and saw dust everywhere! We were excited to see we had a full kitchen, not that I would be cooking on vacation, yet still a nice addition to the room. A not so nice addition to the room were the hundreds of ants all over the kitchen. I called the front desk and they sent up the exterminator immediately. He outright said it was our fault there were ants in the kitchen because we opened a beer. Can you believe that?? I saw him the next day too because there was a roach in our bedroom...yeah yeah I know a palmetto bug. I live in NY, it's a roach. This is not a luxury resort/hotel for so many reasons and for $600/night I want to stay in luxury. I don't know if there are any real resorts in Key West. We had stayed in several other hotels on the island previously and had high hopes for Ocean Key. I cannot reccommend this hotel to anyone for the price. Now I get to the billing portion of our stay. Yes, I did travel with 3 other couples and there were 4 credit cards on the 2 rooms. But I was told everything was under control...until I checked my credit card statement. I was charged for another couples room. It was resolved rather quickly and painlessly, crediting me for the charges immediately. Then I discovered that they had charged another couple in our party incorrectly for this same room. It still is not completely resolved and we have been home for almost 2 weeks. Don't skip your trip to Key West, but definitely skip staying here. Oh and I almost forgot, no air conditioning in the elevators! Doesn't sound so bad but once you experience it, you'll never want to again.

Reviews.Title: “Key West at its Best”
Reviews.Author: CTcouple
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our anniversary here and were definitely not disappointed. We had been to Key West back in 97, but just for the afternoon. The end of Duval, we decided, would be the best place to stay. At Zero Duval, the Ocean Key's location can't be beat. We were able to leave our car in the garage every day except for the time we made an excursion to Bahia Honda State Park. Lots of breakfast, lunch and dinner spots all within walking distance. We especially liked walking along the boardwalk at the end of Greene Streeet to the historic seaport, where there are several good restaurants (including Turtle Kraals--yummy breakfast and then in the evening we were there for their turtle race competition) and a spot where many of the sunset cruises and other excursions take off (we liked the stargazer cruise...something different). The marina right at Ocean Key also has lots of adventure....we did the speed boat tour of the island (leave your hat and sunglasses at the hotel!) from there. We ate at Hot Tin Roof just once...for breakfast our last morning. It was really good, better than most hotel restaurants. I second the other reviewer's comments about the blue tiles surrounding the pool being too hot. Granted, it was summer so you would expect them to be hot. But even emerging from the pool with wet feet, I got burned walking back to my lounge chair. I would suggest leaving your sandals next to the pool. As for the room itself, we loved it. We chose a junior oceanview (not oceanfront) suite, which overlooked Mallory Square, in my opinion a much better view than you'd get overlooking Duval.
