We went downstairs for the sunset celebration a few nights (can't beat seeing the street performers up close), and other nights just watched all the action from our balcony. Even though you can't see as much, you get taken into the scene with the live music and atmosphere. We were on the fifth floor and found the balcony to be very private (we could see people on one fourth floor balcony but none others). More than once we would hear someone below remarking that they wished they were staying at our hotel so they could see everything from the balcony. Interestingly, we did find that the Mallory Square action shuts down completely around 10. I guess everybody is heading to the bars on Duval by then. Since we don't drink, we found that our night pretty much ended early, once Mallory died down. You can't even get an ice cream anyplace if it's past 10. I believe 9:30 is when room service shuts down...I would have liked it if we could order something later than that so we could continue enjoying the balcony. One heads up for those staying in Key West during the summer: From Mallory Square, the sun doesn't set over the ocean but behind Sunset Key, a nearby island. So actually the views weren't quite as spectacular as we thought. Definite reason to do a sunset cruise at least one night. Back to the room: I agree with others that the island decor was beautiful. Bed was very comfortable, jacuzzi tub a nice touch. As a couple staying there, we could have done without the front room, which had a pullout couch, table and fridge. Obviously that fridge came in handy, but the room just had a tiny window overlooking the inner courtyard and walkways. So we found it rather dark in there, not really an inviting place to sit. Although I guess it provided a nice buffer so that we didn't hear any noise from other guests along the walkway as they came in each night or left each morning. We found the service to be very good at Ocean Key. The conceirge desk was a little too busy once or twice when we might have used it, but they did help us to select a restaurant and, right upon check in, helped me to surprise my husband with a room service meal (I arranged this in advance). The turndown service was good; also liked the seashells left for us. The bellhop staff was extremely friendly. And when we needed to get our car, the vallet service was quick. All in all, we loved the location and room at this place...and I think we'll be back one day. If only Key West were a little closer to home...

Reviews.Title: “Wow, What a View and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: pmazcomm
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Key West and after doing much research, I chose the Ocean Key due to the location and ocean view. Our original room was for a city view but since we were planning on extending our stay, the hotel upgraded us for a fee to an Ocean View Suite! Wow...we walked in to the sleigh bed, jacuzzi tub that is also a shower that has glass doors and shutters on one side that can be opened to view the ocean outside. We went to the balcony and had the view of Mallory Square, the ocean and the pool. We were able to watch the sunset right from our balcony as well as all of the events that occurred in Mallory Square. The next morning I woke up to go write my kids a letter (they are at overnight camp) and was blown away by the view of this large cruise ship that was outside my window. It was absolutely amazing. The pictures we took of the sunset by the pool were incredible. The customer service and staff were incredible. Anything we requested they were right on top of our request. We wanted to go to eat at a restaurant, the operator called and got us immediate reservations. We were running late so as we were asking for directions, the hotel receptionist was already dialing a cab for us. It was amazing. On our way home, they gave us 4 ice cold bottles of water for our car ride home. The only negative was the male pool waiter on one of the days who needed training on how to managed a busy pool. He kept making excuses for why he couldn't get our drinks. The other pool waitresses were great, he was the only negative. I highly recommend this hotel. It was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “What a place!!”
Reviews.Author: lemstar
Reviews.Content: Characters: Husband--51 years old, likes museums, history Wife (that would be me)--49 years old, likes animals and nature Son--10 years old, does not like restaurants (swell, huh?) Setting: Ocean Key Resort for three glorious nights Rooms: We had the pleasure of staying in a two bedroom suite on the 5th floor, facing the marina, and the little island out there..... The "room" was gorgeous. It was like an apartment, with a large balcony almost the entire width of the suite. There were two bedrooms with very comfortable King beds, and hand painted furniture. Even the floor lamps were Key Westy. Each bedroom had a TV with remote, and the master bedroom had a CD/clock radio. There were two full bathrooms, one in the master bedroom, and one just outside the other bedroom. The master bedroom was quite large, and had the deepest whirlpool tub I have ever seen. My son disappeared when he was in it. It was actually in the bedroom, with a lovely wicker basket with towels all rolled up. The commode and nice sized shower were behind a closed door, while the double sinks were located between the tub and the shower/commode, with pretty wrought iron and glass shelves holding the very coconutty soaps, shampoos, lotions, and conditioners. The living room was very large, with brightly colored upholstery and furniture, including a couch, chair, end table, cocktail table, console with TV, and a dining table with four chairs placed just outside the...KITCHEN. There was a full kitchen, with stove, dishwasher, antique microwave oven, and as pathetic as it sounds, my all time favorite, a WASHER-DRYER!! Now many of you may not care about that, but when you have been on the road for more than three days with a 10 yr old boy, especially this boy, it was heaven! It was so nice having everything clean! Our balcony had a table and two chairs, and two large comfortable lounge chairs. It was on the fifth floor, overlooking the marina, and the sea. I loved just sitting out there and watching all the action--the boats, the people, the sunset pier, Duval Street--and of course, SUNSET! Staff and service: The staff was quite friendly and accomodating for the most part. We were greeted in a very friendly manner by the valet guy. We arrived early (10:30am) in order to try to get the room we wanted, which was top floor. We were able to get it, but it wasn't ready (cleaned) yet. The valet guy told us that the previous people had already checked out, so it shouldn't be long. We went out for a walk, and came back around 1pm. It still was not ready. We checked back all afternoon periodically, and at 3:55pm, (check-in was not guaranteed til 4pm), I suggested that we be given a discount if our room was not ready by 4, and just then it became ready. We watched people come in, check in, and go to their rooms all day long. I understand the rules of check-in, ie not guaranteed til 4, but still.....it seemed a bit, well, stingy, especially considering the level of room we had..... The concierge/valet/bellman that helped us to our room was very nice and helpful, full of info. There was one guy at the desk whom we queried about some things, and he was not knowledgeable, and even gave us some wrong info. He did suggest we ask the concierge guy, but he was not there at the moment. (Can you imagine he didn't know who the cat guy was??) All in all, the staff was quite friendly, and housekeeping kept the place clean. The turndown service in the evening included a pretty shell placed on the pillow--what a nice touch. Food: We had breakfast every day at the Tin Roof, and it was superb. The setting was lovely, the service was good, the food was good. My son had the croissant sandwich everyday ("just like a Burger King croissanwich!", but better). I had a fluffy waffle, yes, fluffy, with fresh berries and whipped cream--mmmmm. We ate a big breakfast, then skipped lunch, then ate out for dinner. We did have drinks on the Sunset Pier, where the music was incredible! There was a great guitar player (my husband is a trained guitarist, and raved about him), an amazing singer, and then later, a woman who sang and played guitar, with a great bluesy, old-time voice. The drinks were good, and the service was fast and friendly. This pier is a short stroll from Mallory Square. What else can I say? We are quite picky travelers, and love nice hotels. We are not the people who say the hotel isn't important because you don't spend much time in it. We do. We like special hotels. I don't know about the rest of the hotel, but our suite was truly spectacular, and our experience at the Ocean Key superceded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “The Ocean Key: Informal Luxury”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Ocean Key is just a fabulous place to stay. This was our second visit to Key West and our first time staying at the Ocean Key. We upgraded to an Oceanview Suite on the 5th floor when we arrived and the view was spectacular. The suite itself was more like an apartment - fully equipped kitchen, dining area, separate bedroom, etc. Furnishings were beautifully hand painted and the bed was very comfortable. The turn-down service was a special treat - each night an attendant turned the bedding down and a beautiful seashell was placed on my pillow. Paradise. Personnel at the hotel always seemed to have a smile on their faces, always friendly and helpful. Location is everything, and the Ocean Key is right in the center of it all. The beautiful Gulf, festive Mallory Square and, of course, Duval Street. I'm writing this review in July 2005 and have already made our reservations for March 2006. Hope you get to stay at this beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasure in Paradise.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having just spent the most wonderful two weeks at Ocean Key Resort, there is very little to crticise and a great deal to praise. Bearing in mind that we were the first guests to arrive since the hurricane, the staff made every effort to have our room ready for the Monday morning. The room was excellent with a full view over the pool area, Sunset Key and Mallory Square. Front desk staff were extremely helpful and friendly, as were all the other staff. Singled out for special merit is the untiring Rosy, who seemed to run the pool area almost completely on her own. Her cheerful demeanour won over even the most demanding of guests and we have nothing but praise for her service and smile. We cannot understand the remarks made by the guy from New York and can only assume that he was assigned the broom closet as a punishment for an unknown slight to the legions of staff walking round with checkboards. The pool is small, heated to an unpleasant temperature, even when the outside temp. is around 100 degrees. The pool surround is of blue mosaic tiles which inflict third degree burns to your feet at around midday. There are only about four umbrellas around the pool area to enable we poor Brits to escape the summer heat and requests for more were lost or ignored. The saddest failure is the lack of an infinity pool surround at the Sunset Key end, which would make the most amazing feature. One last minor gripe is the funereal music played during breakfast which led us to ask if anyone had died. So here is the summary, great staff, superb rooms, perfect location, good facilities, better than Pier House, what more could you want. Would we stay there again? Oh indeed, yes.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: sportingreview
Reviews.Content: This place was perfect. Great service. Great views. great food. Great bartenders. The only problem with the hotel is that we had to leave and come back to the real world. STAY AT THIS PLACE!

Reviews.Title: “A Special Place”
Reviews.Author: shamrock0421
Reviews.Content: I fell in love with Key West the first time I went there. On Valentine's Day of 2004, my boyfriend gave me a pocketbook as a gift. And, inside of the bag were tickets to go to Key West for my birthday that April. When the cab took us to from the Key West Airport to The Ocean Key, I couldn't catch my breath. It was beautiful. I'd stayed in Key West before, at the Hyatt, and - while the Hyatt was lovely - I was taken with The Ocean Key from the moment I stepped in to the lobby. I loved the decor and the relaxed atmosphere and the hospitality and friendliness of everyone who worked there. We were early, and our room wasn't ready, so I took my boyfriend (who had never been to KW) for a stroll up Duval Street. His cell phone rang a couple of hours later; and it was the front desk to let us know our room was ready. Wow. We went to the top floor, to an ocean front room, and I was speechless. I can remember, during prior trips, standing in Mallory Square and watching the people on their balconies at The Ocean Key thinking, 'I hope that's me up there some day...' And there I was. I loved everything about the hotel - everything about the room - it was my dream birthday weekend. The sleigh-bed was huge and so very comfortable. The hand-painted furniture in the room was beautiful. I absolutely loved that, from the jacuzzi, we could see the water - I could go on forever. Everything was there for us - The Pier - Hot Tin Roof - Mallory Square - the amazing cruise ships coming in to port for the day - the ambiance and the staff were all just incredible. We had dinner outdoors at the hotel that evening. I asked my boyfriend where he would like to see his first Key West sunset. (We weren't sure if we should do it from Mallory Square, the pier, or our own balcony.) He opted for the balcony so, after enjoying a delicious drink at the outdoor bar, we went back up to the room. When we did, I walked in to find candles, roses, rose petals, a bottle of champagne on ice, chocolate-covered strawberries - and so on. We went out on to the balcony, opened the champagne, watched the sunset, and I was proposed to. The next morning when we went down for breakfast, the entire staff came running up to me to see my ring - congratulate me - and to ask if everything was the way my fiancee wanted it to be. Apparently, they went above and beyond my fiancee's expectations to be sure that everything was perfect. And it was perfect. We were married exactly one year later. I hope this doesn't sound more like an engagement story than a hotel review. Because, without the ambiance and the staff and the sheer beauty of it all, it could never have been as memorable as it will always be. We will stay at the Ocean Key every time we visit Key West. It's a magical place.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: cheguevara949
Reviews.Content: to begin with, were were under the impression that every room has a jacuzzi, WRONG. We got to the hotel, and they upgraded us to a beautiful room overlooking the gulf on the 4th floor. Walked into the room, there was a beautiful living room, bedroom, porch, and a dinky little bathroom, with no jacuzzi. Insert Extremely angry face here.when we booked the room, we were told that we would have a jacuzzi, but low and behold, we didnt. But whatever, who needs one when your in key west anyway. So just be careful when bookign this place, it seems to cater to the rich snobs and push us normal folk around. WITH THAT SAID, this place was perfect location, extremly clean, with everything you can imagine. Good towels, soap, ect ect. Excellent pool area, with lots of 30 year old guys trying to hit on everything that walked by, which was a funny sight. they wouldnt let us check in early, because they said our room wasnt ready, but i know it was. They DID however call our cell phone at around 2:30 to let us check in. The view was spectacular from the porch. Bad TV channel selection tho. Oh yea, and there was a mysterious mini bar charge for 2.56 for something i didnt take. Hmm.. THEY DID only charge us for 1 night of parking tho, so i guess it evens out. If you dont like to tip, dont stay at this place. finally the elevators here were not air conditioned or even air blown, it was about 125 degrees in them, and made for a miserable 25 seconds of freefall. All in all, this was an excellent place, but i dont know if it was worth 270 dollars per night....

Reviews.Title: “Glorious rooms.....”
Reviews.Author: ju123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our Florida fly drive in June 2005. The location of the hotel cannot be bettered for me, you are right in the heart of Key West, the Conch trolley tour depot is just across the street, and Sloppy Joe's bar is also only a stone's throw away. Our room was the most attractive room I've stayed in, in North America, with some nice little touches, a Teddy Bear on the bed, wonderful toiletries & a stunning wash/vanity/bathroom area, which could be opened out or covered with shutters if someone needed privacy. The rooms all have jacuzzis, which we took advantage of, as well as double sinks & as many fluffy towels as anyone could need. The bed was a very comfortable Sleigh-style, not too soft with ample provision of pillows & layers of quilts (who needs a quilt in Key West!?!). The hotel has it's own pier, with a very lively bar situated at the hotel end, which is open the public & hotel guests, and there was live music nightly. Serving staff were lovely, not intrusive but very good at keeping the drinks flowing. You also have a great view of the enormous cruise ships which dock at Key West each day from here. The hotel has it's own watersports dock, yards from the pier & close to the the hotel entrance. They offer speed boating, boat hire, parasailing, jet ski, almost every thing you could want to do. We enjoyed the Jet Ski tour, $110 for 90mins with 2 of us on one machine. You are taken all around the bay & out into the atlantic and it was very very enjoyable, if a little scary at times! This is pretty good value for Jet Skiing in these parts. Small negative points for us, well, our room was only on the 2nd floor, so the view was 99% blocked by palm trees, so we could hear the sunset celebrations, but not actually see much of it, although we didn't spend a lot of time in the room as we were out enjoying ourselves. Parking is valet only, currently $18 per day, so include that in your budget. When we arrived, we were told our room wasn't ready. It was 1.30pm & we were told to check back later, but it would definitley be ready by 4pm!! We had driven down from Key Largo, so could have done with going straight to the room, this was the only annoying part of our whole trip, but they could advertise the late check in times more. I don't think 1.30pm is that early to try & check in to most hotels. I must stress none of these things would prevent us from staying here again. We didn't eat at the hotel, because we enjoy eating out & sampling the local cuisine, both Carolines cafe & the Hard Rock cafe are highly recommended in Key West, as is Fogartys Bar & Restaurant, all within a 5-10 minute stroll of this stunning hotel. All in all, This is THE place to stay here, everything right on your door, high standards of cleanliness & friendly staff, especially the valet parking guys.

Reviews.Title: “Great Ocean Key”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is THE place to stay, a bit pricey but worth the convenience and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly Perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel and not a bed & breakfast, try this great place. It is huge, but feels like a boutique, tropical hotel. My boyfriend and I stayed here May 26 and 27, 2005. Started our vacation right when we arrived at the hotel and our room was surprisingly ready at 9:00 a.m. The city view room was HUGE and actually we could see a bit of Mallory Square and the water from the balcony. The bathroom had a whirlpool tub and his and her sinks. The minibar fridge was not one that automatically deducts from your account when you move things so we could use it for the water we bought from CVS which is conveniently next door. The room was immaculate and I usually hate walking around with bare feet, but the tile was so clean it didn't bother me. Location is excellent and there was surprisingly little noise from the street at about 11:00 p.m. Mallory Square is crazy during the sunsets of course, though. This may be worse during the high season. Bring ear plugs if you want to be safe. You are near the water which is nice. The fitness room is more than adequate and the pool area is beautiful. We had a couples' massage which was nice, except that the couples' massage room was a little bit too bright and the music a bit too up-tempo. Staff is extremely helpful. You can rent bikes from Paradise Bike and Scooter which is nearby on Front Street. Ask for Will. :) 30$ for 15 for 24 hours. Great way to see Key West. Also check out Dominque and his Flying House Cats at the Hilton Pier (next to Mallory Square) at sunset. It's pretty impressive. Also Caroline's for good, relatively cheap food (great mahi fingers). The Garden of Eden clothing optional bar atop the Bull and Whistle is great entertainment. :) One more thing, if you like house or dance music the only place we could find was the Blu Room. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Love it.. Love it. Love it..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying here, and its the best.. Perfect location for the Sunset. The hotel staff is very accomindating and the guests are plesent and inviting. I take a vacation alone every year (just to get away from and relax), and I never go to the same place, but I found it so relaxing I came back. REMEMBER to go to RICKS for a drink...

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: Linda_and_Phil
Reviews.Content: This is the only place to stay in Key West! I mean it.....!! This was our second trip to Key West. We stayed at the Banana Bay back in 2001 (also a lovely place and I'd recommended if you want to be out of town). Anyway, we first saw the Ocean key back in 2001 and said that if we ever went back to Key West we would stay there as it was right on the pier overlooking the ocean. We never reckoned on going back so soon but a friend was getting married out there. On arrival at the hotel we were checked in by the very helpful staff and made to feel welcome at once. We'd had a long day flying and driving to get there so it was nice to be made so welcome straightaway. The hotel is total class. You really feel like you have well and trully spoiled yourself by staying here. The bedrooms are lovely. Huge emperor sized bed, lounge area and 2 TVs. The bathroom was gorgeous with a capital G. Double French style washbasins and lovely accessories and bath products for you to use (even nicer than those I brought myself). The shower is glazed on the side that separates it from the bedroom. Don't worry, if you are bashful there is a privacy screen. If you're not.....have fun! Lovely balcony with good chairs to sit on and have a drink. We had a partial sea view. The restaurant is great for breakfast which we had most days. Pool is pretty good, not too big but not crowded. The loungers are padded and layed out with fresh towels every day. Poolside service was top notch. Free sorbet and water to keep guests refreshed. The waiting staff were great at keeping up with requests for poolside snacks and drinks. It is 0 Duval Street. It is the place to be for Sunset Celebrations every night. It is within walking distance of all the shops and restuarants. Recommend Turtle Kralls and Conch Republic for casual waterside dining. A&B for the most amazing lobster. I hope we go back to Key West again in the future and have no doubt in my mind that we'll be booking the Ocean Key. Have a great holiday. Enjoy the margarita's!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing time at the Ocean Key”
Reviews.Author: PPines
Reviews.Content: The Ocean Key was wonderful. It has the best location on the island. It is within walking distance from eveything. From the moment we arrived we were totally satisfied. The staff and service was great. If you are going to stay at the Ocean Key it is worth the money to pay for a room with a view. We loved to sit on the balcony and watch the boats coming in and all the action on Mallory Square. The jr suite (i think) was impressive. Large bathroom, sitting area, great bed, and balcony. We had two dinners included with our package and traded in one dinner for breakfast, so we could eat one night out. We wish we wouldn't have. The breakfast was great and the prices were reasonable. Dinner at the Hot Tin Roof was the best! We made reservations to eat out on the deck while the sun was setting, and it was the best time we had in the keys. Must have the Key lime pie here! Our stay would not have been the same if we had not stayed here. We will go back. We also enjoyed Irish Kevin's on Duval for drinks and entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Key wonderful”
Reviews.Author: bmpope524
Reviews.Content: Staff was absolutley outstanding from the Valet Parking, front desk, wait staff all the way down to the Pool Server. The staff works very long hours and they are so accomodating to all our needs. Live entertainment every night. We had a late flight return and even though we had to check out by 11a.m. Ocean Key allowed us to keep our car at their facility and use the pool until it was time to head to the airport. Atmosphere of our Junior Suite was just what we were looking for to get away without the kids. We had a junior suite looking over Mallory Square and partial ocean view. The cruise ships would park right next door or close to our hotel on the harbor, but we enjoyed watching them come and go. So much activity to just sit back, relax and watch at such a convienent location. $18.00 a day to park plus tax but we did use our rental car to drive up the keys and check out the state parks and beaches. If you just want to stay on Key West, save your money and rent a scooter or take a taxi. Walking distance to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently visited Key West and as usual arrived without a hotel booking. We came accross the Ocean Key Hotel by accident and are so glad we did. The hotel staff were fantastic, friendly and accommodating. We had an ocean view suite, which overlooked the pool and the sea - fantastic view and great balcony to have our breakfast. The hotel was immaculate with a gym and a spa and the Hot Tin Roof restaurant was well worth a night staying in. The location couldn't be better. On one side you have Mallory Square and you can stand on the balcony and watch the performance artists at the sunset party (no noise penetrates the double glazing!). Walking out the front door, you are at the marina end of Duval Street, with a short walk to the bars and restaurants. We have stayed in some fantastic hotels and this is definately one for the top of our list.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, we'll go back”
Reviews.Author: flynduck
Reviews.Content: We had a jr. suite package; balcony overlooked mallory square and great ocean view. The room was delightful -- clean and wonderfully decorated. Staff was very friendly, the breakfast (included in package) was outstanding. We love Key West, this hotel makes it easy to get to all our favorite Key West spots. We will definitely go back. LD

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong with the Ocean Key”
Reviews.Author: LCM1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend stay at the Ocean Key House Resort and loved every minute of our vacation. The junior suites were large and well thought out, and they even upgraded us to a partial ocean view overlooking Mallory Square. The location is the best in Key West if you want to be in the center of the all the action. The staff was friendly and very accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel , not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here in may 2004 as part of our honeymoon, i was so looking forward to it as the website looks fantastic, we had previously requested a superior room when booking in england, but when we arrived, although we had a partial sea view, it was a standard room to my expectations and quite small, though the bed was huge and so comfy. The pool was tiny and a little ridiculous for the hotel size and the pool toilets were absolutely disgusting and smelt of urine, as did the car park area. That said, the rooms were always clean , and the jacuzzi bath was great. The restaurant attached to the hotel was fantastic with great staff, (our waiter was lovely) although the hotel manager was probably the most unfriendly man in key west, and not helpful about us booking a superior room, saying we'd have to pay 200 dollars to upgrade! however i still loved key west and fulfilled my dream, and we only slept at the hotel, although it was an expensive holiday if you look at it like that!

Reviews.Title: “Overall - great - location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our staff. They were great. Joshua was wonderful on our first night and put me at ease for the rest of the stay. The concierge was great each day with setting up with coupons and making arrangements. We faced Duvall Street and it was rather loud at night. If we closed windows & doors it was quiet but I missed the fresh air. Not a problem of the hotel - obviously. I was disappointed on our last day to go down for breakfast and have half of our view blocked by a cruise ship. The room overall was nice but the bathrooms could use a good scrubing. There was a layer of dust on the trim, corners on the floor needed attention and the shower needs to be treated for mold a little mold. Considering everything else about the hotel the bathroom cleanliness was disappointing. It was very average. I could have stayed at a Hampton or Holiday in and had as good or better in the bathroom. I travel alot so this is something I notice. I would still go back and stay there again. The other nice thing was you are so close to everything. The pier for the sunset, Mallory Square for the sunset celebration, shops, bars, marina. It is all right there. It is the best hotel I have every stayed at from a proximity stand point. I would also recommend the Discovery Glass bottom Boat and Schooner Wharf bar.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable staff and location”
Reviews.Author: SBeth1966
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Ocean Key in late February 2005 and our time spent in Key West was unbelievable. The staff was so very helpful and friendly. The location was unbeatable. We were central and walking distance to anything we wanted or needed and the resort was immaculate. Should we ever get a chance to return to Key West we will not hesitate for a moment to stay at The Ocean Key.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: VKM
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Key West, stayed at the Ocean Key from 3/4 thru 3/9 and I don't have one bad thing to say about the experience. Great rooms, great view, friendly staff, the best location. I can't comment to much on the food however breakfast was good. When we return to Key West we will book the Ocean Key again.

Reviews.Title: “Super Duper”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had booked the trip to the Keys a while back. I found a good package for the Ocean Key for $309 a night (which included breakfast, and 3 different tours). I started to get nervouse before I left after reading some of the reviews... some about the place being dirty, noisy, bad products, bad food, bad service... I really was starting to second guess my choice! After staying there for 3 nights in February, I haven't one bad thing to say about the place (except for the TV not working too well). The place is beautiful, the staff is GREAT, the views are superb, and the pool is very relaxing!! If I had three thumbs, I'd have them all up! Maybe I should include that we're campers....

Reviews.Title: “Right in the Action of Sunny Key West”
Reviews.Author: Siteseekers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ocean Key Resort for 4 nights in February. We had the perfect weather. The resort is located right in the heart of the downtown directly on the water. We had an oceanview room, which made a huge difference. If I had a city view in the front I would not have been happy. Spend for a water view. Also, I wish we had a room on a upper floor, you will have a better view. Our room was right above noisy generator which was a nusiance. The pool is lovely and nicely maintained. The breeze off the water feels great, making it nice to have a lovely terrace to sit on. If I returned I would request a higher floor/oceanview/larger terrace. Our room was on end and the patio was smaller which was a disappointment. Bathroom looks very "magazine like" but not terribly functional as a showering bathroom. Nice robes, very pretty decorated room. Ours was a "boutique" suite and I was told this was a newer remodeled room. It was very appealing to the senses, pretty, bright colors. If you are looking for quiet--this hotel is not for you. This overlooks in the back where the cruise ships pull in and dock for the day. Thousands of people walk by the hotel to Mallory Square where all the "Sunset Performers" gather in the evening. There is constant sweeping. power washing, garbage pick up, maintenance in the parking lot behind the hotel. This is very noisy and on vacation I would rather have a quieter environment. It is still a great location to be in the "action" of Key West. A big plus you can walk to many attractions and restaurants. The desk staff is very helpful and friendly. The "Sunset Pier Grill" has an incredible place to sit and look over the boats and Sunset Key. The food is mediocre at best, expensive for what it is, and drinks are small and diluted served in plastic cups. Seems as though, for such a beautiful spot a better food option could be here. Still a lot of positive aspects of this property. Bring your wallet when visiting during winter rates.

Reviews.Title: “Nice . . . but not quite a **** star hotel as advertised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I agree with the other reviews. Paying Four Seasons/Ritz prices for a Holiday Inn. What we liked: Close location to sites and attractions Pool is OK Good view from room Did not feel it was comparable to other $500 night hotels we stayed in because: Deluxe Oceanview Room was tiny so was the linoleum bathroom Amenities were sparce Housekeeping was not timely Room and public facilites were dirty. Pool bathroom was filthy Elevators stunk of what smelled to be urine Need better security around elevators. Could easily access them from the pier and from Mallory Square. Non hotel guests were all around the garage Service around the pool was slow and sporadic. Never even offered ice water Service on the pier was just as bad. Slow!! Construction on the pier was intrusive. Diesel fumes and banging was annoying especially at 9:30 in the AM Won't be back and can't recommend to family and friends until major improvements are made.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed reviews”
Reviews.Author: hjegirl
Reviews.Content: We were just there for a six night vacation and although it was a great location, we ran into some issues. They are currently making a fitness room and spa...so the jackhammer was not pleasant at different times of the day! The hammering at 9am was not what I had invisioned for a restful week either. Unfortunately for us, no one mentioned when I made the reservation that there was going to be harbour dredging for the whole time we were there! Very loud and right at the pool and restaurant for breakfast. Rooms were nice but I was just disappointed about all the noise you can hear while in your room. Great view over Mallory square and the sunsets, cruise ships too. Can't believe we couldn't hear these huge ships come in but you could hear people slamming thier doors. The staff was always pleasant but we were dissapointed that they didn't offer us some sort of discount from all the noise. It would of been nice if we were informed about all that was going on before spending sooo much $$$.

Reviews.Title: “Rip Off....$50 hotel room for $400!”
Reviews.Author: VanGogh20
Reviews.Content: I stayed here becasue of the positive reviews. I have traveled all over the world. I know what luxury is, what nice is, what to expect for a room at $400 per night. (With the added audacity to charge $18 per day to park.) This hotel is a complete rip off. The hotel is dirty and shoddy. The furthest thing from luxury from the moment you pull up, then enter the motel 6 lobby, the single dirty elevator, then step into your room with bare floors and unnerving lime green walls. I've stayed at $70 per night hotels that were nicer, and had better if not more amenities. It was noisy, there was no gym or spa facility, the pool area is ridiculously small, (as if it was an after thought), and accessible only through the garage. Even the toilet paper at this premium priced hotel is bargain basement rough. The staff was pleasant and nice. It was the hotel that was in my opinion nothing if not overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Downtown Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First the location has to be about as good as can get. Save money and leave the rental car at the airport...you're in the heart of the "old town" and "Mallory Square" where everything is just a stroll away. In addition the western location pretty much guarantees a front row seat for Key West's sunset celebrations. I say pretty much because it's also the same location the mega cruise ships use to dock and unload their passengers each day. We splurged for one of the Suites on the 5th floor and found on several occassions our view was either restricted or completely blocked from the sunset by the cruise ships. Fortunately the resort has a waterfront pier, which can overcome this obstacle and offers an acceptable viewing angle with drinks available! We found the hotel and our suite to be very clean. The high speed internet worked out well the in-room CD stereo was broken and the tv has no in-room movie features or DVD capability. (comes in handy for kids, on those rainy days, or when you've had a little too much at Hog's Breath!) If you're going to spend some time in the upcoming months you should be aware of ongoing renovations to some of the rooms. The construction workers were there daily...including Saturday! We heard both the tile saws and the hammering during our stay and it appeared they had a good deal more work ahead. We didn't get to sample the resort's restaurant but have only the greatest comments about Antonia's restaurant on Duval street. I believe Zagat's lists it as the highest rated restaurant in Key West and we concur 110%. Overall, we would stay again at Ocean Key. The location and facilities make it shine over neighboring resorts.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Wedding!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married at the Ocean Key in December and I can't say enough great things about it! The majority of our 50+ guests stayed at Ocean Key and everyone had a great time. The only complaint was that some of the rooms had construction noise during the daytime (ask for a room away from the remodeling). The resort staff was accommodating and friendly, going above and beyond to make our entire weekend special. We had both our ceremony and reception on site (ceremony on the terrace and reception on the pier). Our guests had such a wonderful time that they've asked us to make it an annual event! By no means was it an inexpensive location for a wedding, but it did live up to our expectations. The food was great and the rooms spacious and beautifully decorated. We're already planning a return visit for our first anniversary!

HotelInfo.Name: Ocean Key Resort & Spa
HotelInfo.Address: Zero Duval Street, Key West, FL 33040
